loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina has been married to Antonio for 27 years, and they have two children. Thanks to the values and the good examples instilled in them, they have become exemplary people that are their parents’ pride and joy. Ever since she started her family and up until just a little while ago, she dedicated herself to selling delicious cheeses that her highly valued in her city markets. Now, having saved enough money with this job, she decided to rent a space and open a poultry restaurant with the support of her loving husband and wonderful children. To finish opening her poultry business, she needs a loan that she will invest in buying tables and chairs. She promises to repay the loan in no more than her seven months. Guillermina and her lovely family await your selfless support to meet their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina está casada desde hace 27 años con Antonio y tienen dos hijos quienes gracias al buen ejemplo y valores que inculcaron en ellos ahora se han convertido en personas ejemplares que los llenan de satisfacción y mucho orgullo.Ella desde que formó su familia y hasta hace poco siempre se dedicó a la comercialización de quesos muy sabrosos y bien cotizados en los mercados de su ciudad; ahora después de haber ahorrado lo suficiente con este trabajo decidió alquilar un local y abrir una pollería; con apoyo de su fiel esposo y sus ejemplares hijos y para terminar de implementar su pollería solicita un préstamo que invertirá para adquirir mesas y sillas con el compromiso de reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso no mayor de los siete meses.“Guillermina y su encantadora familia esperan tu apoyo desinteresado para cumplir con sus objetivos”.

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs to open a new restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To further improve the image of her business and to provide better service for her clients

loans.name: Zuhrajon

texts.en: J. Zuhrajon lives in Spitamen and she is married and has 4 children. Mrs. J. Zuhrajon applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and recommended herself as a serious and executive client. Mrs. J. Zuhrajon is experienced in business of livestock and has the appropriate knowledge. She has been engaged in the livestock business from her early years when she helped firstly her mother on the farm and now she helps her husband. It is the family business that brings the general income. Now she works in the hotel “Orom,” too, but most of the time she is engaged in the family business. She is engaged in milk production and its work out. In time she dreams of purchasing a pedigree milk-cow for the milk-sour products making. Now Mrs. J. Zuhrajon requests a loan of $375 for the milk-cow purchasing.

loans.use: milk-cow purchase

loans.name: Witness's Upendo Group

texts.en:
Witness S., age 36, is single and owns a small general store, which she started 2 years ago. Working from 6 AM to 5 PM daily, she earns about $65 a month from this business.

In the past, Witness successfully took out 1 previous loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy inventory for her business. She now hopes for a loan to once again purchase shop inventory. Witness belongs to a loan group called Upendo and will be sharing this loan with group members Easther H., Rhoda S., and Frida A.. These women have businesses dealing in hardware, clothing, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy shop inventory

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba B. is 57 years old. She and her husband have raised four children.

Mahbuba and her family have run a business for 10 years already. Mahbuba bakes the national bread called “lepeshka.” She has her own bakery shop. Mahbuba is well-known in her neighborhood as a hard-working woman. Everyday, she bakes up to 500 “lepeshka.” The prepared products are sold from her bakery as well as in the local market. The business is successful and generates a stable income for her family.

Today, Mahbuba needs to purchase materials for her business, like the flour and fuel that are required for the operations of her business. For this purpose, she requests 950.00 US Dollars for a term of 9 months. Mahbuba is a repeat client for IMON and has a positive credit history. She wants to thank everyone for supporting her today and promises to be accurate in her loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchasing the flour and fuel required for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 63 year old woman who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. She has a grocery shop and is also a tailor. She needs a loan to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
A. Betty Florence owns a cosmetic shop and also sells clothing. She is married and has 2 children. Business is doing very well, and she wishes to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is asking for additional capital to buy more cosmetics and clothing for sale.

loans.use: This loan will be used as additional capital to buy more cosmetics and clothing for sale.

loans.name: Mayoro

texts.fr:
Mr. F. is a young businessman who manages a spare parts shop at the bus station in Thies. He is from the Medina Falls neighborhood in Thies. He is married and has one child. He has been a loyal client of the loan association since 2004. In order to increase his income, he is requesting a loan to buy large quantities of spare parts.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr F. est un jeune commerçant qui gère un magasin de pièces détachées à la gare routière de THIES. Il est originaire du quartier MEDINA FALLS de THIES. Il est marié et père d'un enfant. C'est un fidèle client de la mutuelle depuis l'an 2004. C'est dans le but d'améliorer ses revenus qu'il contracte des prets pour acheter des quantités importantes de pièces détachées.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of spare parts

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana dedicates herself to raising cows, from which she then sells the milk at the PIL Andina milk plant.

She lives in the Huancollo community in the Tihuanacu section, about three hours from the city of La Paz.

She lives with her husband who works as an employee in the mayor’s office of the region. She has four children, ages 11, 10, 8 and 6, respectively.

The loan would be used to purchase a milk cow of better quality so she can increase her milk production, therefore her sales and income.

This is her first credit with IMPRO, and the evaluation conducted qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Valeriana se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive., vive en la comunidad Huancollo del sector de Tihuanacu provincia Ingavi a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como empleado en la alcaldía del sector, tiene 4 hijos de 11,10,8,6 años de edad respectivamente. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así aumentar su producción de leche y por ende sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow to increase her production and therefore her sales.

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Husna Kanwal Baji is the wife of R. M. Anwar and lives in an area named Yadgar (a famous historical place) in Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her elder son works in a spare parts shop. The next eldest is an employee in a newspaper company named “Inkilab”. Her younger sons are enrolled in a school and are in 5th standard (level). Her first two daughters completed 12th grade. Her younger daughter is in 6th standard.

Hussna Baji is a housewife but she sews clothes and earns a profit. Her husband, R. M.Anwar, is a newspaper seller. He buys newspapers from a newspaper market and distributes them to various places. He has been in this profession for the last 10 years.

Husna Baji successfully completed three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and expanded her husband’s business. Now she is applying for a loan for the same purpose (to purchase more newspapers).

loans.use: To buy more newspapers

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica tends a newspaper stand that is on the corner of her house for 20 years now.

In addition, Angelica has divided her house into small commercial spaces to be able to rent them out. She has also built several rooms in her second floor, which she rents out. She has been working in this way for 20 years.

The loans she has received have been used to maintain the rooms she rents out.

Angelica would like to build a mini-apartment in her home to be able to rent it out and help her son in his business of motorcycle spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Angélica atiende un quiosco de periódicos que está en la esquina de su casa desde hace 20 años.

Asimismo, Angélica ha dividido su casa en pequeños locales para poder alquilarlos. También ha construido vaR. cuartos en su segundo piso, los cuales son rentados. Ya tiene 20 años trabajando de esta manera.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para el mantenimiento de los cuartos que alquila.

Angélica quisiera construir un minidepartamento en su casa para poder alquilarlo, y ayudar a su hijo en su negocio de venta de repuestos motociclísticos.

loans.use: to maintain the rooms she rents out  (Para el mantenimiento de los cuartos que alquila.)

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy P. is 57 years old and married with six children. She has many years of experience in the grocery business. She sells her groceries in her village and to the public six days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~$250 USD).

Daisy has benefited from five previous successful SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) loans. SPBD loans are Daisy’s only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan. She will use her loan to improve her business and to help financially support her family. Her husband also helps out with her grocery sales.

loans.use: To purchase items to improve her grocery sales and business status, and to help financially support her family.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 38 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 13 años llamado Susanny. Se dedica a la atención de su pequeño quiosco, donde ofrece bebidas, golosinas, galletas, etc, desde hace ya 19 años, ahora que su hija Susanny tiene 13 años, la ayuda mucho en la atención del quiosco, en sus ratos libres, y así juntas, trabajan para sacar el negocio adelante.  A Victoria le gusta su trabajo, ya que puede educar a su hija, realizándolo con mucha alegría, siendo lo más difícil, el no poder pasar todo el tiempo que a ella le gustaría junto a su hija. Victoria se esfuerza mucho para brindarle a su Susanny un futuro promisorio con muchas oportunidades. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más mercadería para la abastecer su quiosco.  En el futuro Victoria se ve con una gran tienda de abarrotes, que atenderá en la comodidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Victoria is 38 years old and a single mother of a 13 year old girl named Susanny. For the past 19 years, she has made a living by running a small kiosk where she offers drinks, candies, cookies, etc. Now that Susanny is 13 years old, she helps a lot with the kiosk in her free time and together, they work to move the business forward. Victoria likes her job because she can educate her daughter, which she does with great pleasure. The most difficult part is she cannot spend all of her time with her daughter. Victoria puts a lot of effort into providing a promising future with many opportunities for Susanny. With this loan, she will buy more merchandise to supply her kiosk. In the future, Victoria would like a big market of groceries that she could run out of the comfort of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise for her kiosk

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo, sus hijos y sus padres. Desde niña, con sus padres, ha realizado la actividad de la agricultura, ahora que tiene pequeños niños siente dificultad en hacerlo, su esposo trabaja fuera en una mina, por ello no siembra grandes cantidades como a ella le gustaría, pero de todos modos, así con sus pequeños bajo su responsabilidad, está sembrando con ayuda de sus familiares. Para ella le es muy rentable la agricultura, ha visto por conveniente sembrar papa en mayor cantidad, ya que también siembra olluco, aunque a veces el hielo lo quema y pierde, pero no todas las veces. Lo difícil para ella es que sus hijos están muy pequeños y esto dificulta su trabajo. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y ha sido puntual en el  pago todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero va comprar guano de corral y fertilizantes químicos para abonar su chacra.
texts.en:
Maritza is 30 years old, is married and has 3 children. She lives with her husband, her children and her parents. Since she was a child she carried out the activity of agriculture with her parents and now that she has small children she feels difficulty doing it. Her husband works away in a mine which is why she does not grow as large of quantities as she would like, but in any case with her little ones as her responsibility, she is growing with the help of her relatives. For her agriculture is very profitable and she has seen it to be convenient to grow potatoes in greater quantities as she also grows "olluco", although sometimes the ice burns it and it is lost, but not always. The difficult thing for her is that her children are very small and this complicates her work. This is her 7th loan with MFP and she has been punctual with the payment of all of her installments. With the money she is going to buy farm manure and chemical fertilizers to fertilize her field.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of manure and fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. sells food items like fresh tomatoes and pepper, onions, and others at Iture near Elmina. Elizabeth has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children; her husband is a mason. Elizabeth has been selling food items since 2007. She is responsible for paying the children's school fees and other utility bills.

Her loan will be used to buy additional capital for more food for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy as an additional capital to buy more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un C., is 40, married with two children, and lives with her husband in Phrey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their rice paddy growing rice for their annual supplies. Besides growing crops, the couple also operate another business performing classical and traditional music. When there is a celebration, a wedding party or ceremony in the community, the person in charge of the celebration will hire them to play the music. Together, the couple can typically earn around US$ 4/day in revenue.

The instruments they need are CD player, microphones, big speakers, and some other instruments. Mrs. Un C. and her husband would like to request this loan from Kiva to purchase more instruments to meet their customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more music instruments to satisfy her customer demand

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose P. sells bread and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Rose is 45 years old and married. Her husband is a soldier. They have 2 children who attend school.  A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna D., 37 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Saré Yéroyel depuis 2 ans  Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des produits comme des arachides, de l’huile, du jumbo et du sucre. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Maimouna D., age 37, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Saré Yéroyel for two years. Her work consists in buying and reselling products, such as peanuts, oil, Jumbo (bouillon cubes), and sugar. She wants to boost her commerce. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell consumables

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es: Juvenal es un joven de 26 años, vive solo en una casa alquilada, donde tiene su negocio y lo que más desea es salir adelante. Dándole gusto al paladar de sus clientes, Juvenal pasa sus días, vestido con su mandilito blanco realiza sus actividades diarias, pues tiene un snack en el centro de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde vende sus deliciosas pizzas, a él le gusta bromear y conversar con sus clientes y desea que su negocio crezca y se vuelva una gran pizzería, para así mejorar sus ingresos económicos, lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que mantener su horno de pizzas caliente. Son 4 años los que lleva en este negocio y siente que ya es hora de progresar, Juvenal está muy contento con su negocio, ya que desde que lo puso su vida ha mejorado mucho. Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con el dinero solicitado pretende comprar más ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus pizzas, ya que quiere que su negocio progrese.
texts.en:
Twenty-six year old Juvenal lives alone in a rented house where he has his business. What he most wants is to get ahead. Juvenal spends his days pleasing his customers’ palates. He goes about his daily activities dressed in his white apron. He has a snack bar in the center of Juliaca (city) where he sells his delicious pizzas. He likes to joke and talk with his customers. He wants his business to grow and become a great pizzeria. This way he could improve his income. The most difficult thing about his work is that he has to keep the pizza oven hot. He has been in this business 4 years. He feels it is now time to progress. Juvenal is very happy with his business. Since he started it his life has much improved. This is his first loan with MFP, and he feels capable of making all of his payments. Because he is one of the most active members of his community bank he is well liked and respected. With the loan he will buy the ingredients necessary for making his pizzas. He wants his business to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Mrs. Elvie M. is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children, ages 14  and 10, both of whom are in school. Her husband's income as a carpenter is not enough to support the family, especially when the children approach college age. With no capital to start a business on her own, she applied for membership to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and received a loan to start a business in selling ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes to neighbors and friends on a monthly installment basis.  Hard work and determination are the only things Elvie and her husband have, but they believe they will enable them to send their children to college and live comfortable lives.

loans.use: To purchase more ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes for sale

loans.name: Rozik

texts.ru: Розик имеет 5 детей, женат. Работает в дехканском хозяйстве, жена нигде не работает. Кроме основной работы, заработок с которой не большой Розик занимается откормом скота. Так как у него очень хорошие условия для содержания скота. За скотиной смотрит его жена и старшие дети. Розик собирается увеличить поголовье скота, и поэтому подал заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Rozik is married with five children. He is a farmer and his wife is unemployed. In addition to his regular job, which does not pay much, Rozik raises cattle. He has good conditions for this kind of work. His wife and elder children tend to the cattle. Rozik is applying for a loan in order to increase the number of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a bull calf

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn is a resident of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Edwin B., who has been a construction worker in Roxas since 1994. He earns a salary of PHP 350.00 daily. They have been blessed with two children, who are both in school: Edilyn, the eldest, is 11 years old and in grade six, and Mark Andrew, age 7, is in grade two. Emilyn dreams that one day her children will finish college and have good jobs. She wants to earn additional income to support the growing needs of her children, especially in their studies.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 to expand her poultry business and start a piggery. As soon as she receives her loan, she will immediately buy piglets to fill up her empty pigpen. The loan will also help her maintain her existing poultry business.

While it is not easy, she always tries her best to save her daily income for their children’s future. She is happy that they already have their own house and she hopes that they will be uplifted to a better life in the future. She believes that God will always be with them to guide and give them spiritual support.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leira R. is a Tanzanian micro-businesswoman. She runs a clothing shop in the Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases commodity goods from the wholesale and retail shops at the Kariakoo shopping city center and sells them to her retail customers. She has been in the business for three years. She also runs a business in which she prepares and sells juices to customers. She is requesting a loan of TZS 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her retail store

loans.name: Willie

texts.en:
Willie N. is a rice farmer and is able to support his family. He tills a 3/4 hectare farm and has done so since 1989. Every harvest, he regularly earned Php 24,000 to provide food, clothing and other needs for his family. He was driving a passenger vehicle before that but was not happy so he quit to manage a small rice farm instead.

He would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and chemicals. He thinks that by doing so, he will be able to improve his harvest and help his family more.

CEVI is a partner of World Vision Philippines. CEVI provides its clients with loans, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo Emilian y sus hijos Kenji de 18, Carol de 11 y Jahir de 2 añitos en su casa propia. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, su labor consiste en mostrar sus revistas y catálogos a sus posibles clientas para ofrecerles los productos que se ofertan, obteniendo así diferentes pedidos, los cuales realiza a la empresa con la que trabaja. La ganancia que ella obtiene es que tiene un catálogo personal con precios más bajos, entonces ella compra grandes cantidades de esa revista para luego venderlos a su precio original, consiguiendo aproximadamente el 25% por producto. Teresa es muy ingeniosa, es por eso que le va bien en su negocio y por otro lado puede ayudar en los gastos de  hogar, pues su esposo es comerciante de choclos en uno de los mercados de su localidad y las ganancias que no siempre cubren todos los gastos. Es por eso que Teresa está contenta con su trabajo y espera en un futuro poder tener una tienda donde ofertar en una vitrina sus productos cosméticos. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con sus cuotas de devolución, además le gusta mucho el trabajo con su grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock y así obtener mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Teresa is 50 years old. She lives with her husband Emilian and her children, 18-year-old Kenji, 11-year-old Carol and 2-year-old Jahir, in their own house.
She has sold catalogue cosmetics for 9 years. Her work involves showing her magazines and catalogues to potential customers, so that they can see the products on offer, and receiving different orders, which she then makes through the company that employs her. She has her own discount catalogue, so she makes a profit by purchasing large quantities using this catalogue and then selling products at the original price. She gets approximately 25% per product. Teresa is very resourceful, which is why her business is going well and why she can also contribute to household costs. Her husband sells corn in one of the town’s markets and his earnings don’t always cover all their expenses. This is why Teresa is happy in her work and hopes to someday have a shop with her cosmetics products in the window.
This is her third loan with MFP and she has always been punctual with her repayments. She also enjoys working with her group. She will use the requested money to purchase a larger quantity of cosmetics to have them in stock, and thus make more sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Алибой

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Алибой мужчина 42 лет , женат имеет пятерых детей. Он работает в колхозе бригадиром, его доход не достаточен для проживания его большой семьи. Алибой вместе с семьёй занимается этим бизнесом. Его жена продаёт домашнее молоко и кефир.Для расширения численности скота Алибой хочет получить кредит.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Cesar Natalio

texts.es: Don Cesar se encuentra en su tercera secuencia, dentro de su historial crediticio no ha reportado problema alguno, pudiendose apreciar que es un buen cliente.  El vive en la casa de sus padres. Don Cesar ayuda a sus padres en sus gastos.  La actividad economica a la cual se dedica es la de transporte publico.  La inversion del prestamo estara destinada para la compra de bateria y llantas nuevas para su movilidad.

loans.use: Comprara llantas y bateria para el vehiculo

loans.name: Odo Ne Biakoye Group

texts.en:
Comfort is 31 year old she is married and mother of two kids who are currently in school. She is very supportive in taking of her kids in school. She operates a seamstress shop and started this business ten years ago. She is currently having four apprentices who are learning skills and experience for their future career. She sews all forms female wears with various kinds of styles like kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes, school uniforms, traditional wears etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase savings to support the kids in school.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Odo Ne Biakoye’ which means Love and Oneness. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members in this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
K. Joseph is a very hard-working and honest man. He is a businessman involved in shoe making and repair and he has been transacting his businesses from Mubende Town council for 12 years. He is 31 years old and married with 2 children both in primary section, and he takes care of other 2 dependents. Over the years, he has been able to increase his customer base because of the experience he has and as a result, he is able to make 300,000/= in profit a month.

Joseph has a dream of buying a shoe-making machine to make his work easier and faster as well as building his own house so he can stop renting. Joseph needs a loan so that he will be able to boost his business by buying new products like thread, shoe soles, heels, rubber, and so on.

loans.use: Buying materials for making shoes like thread, shoe soles, heels, rubber and many others.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
"Attaining success in life starts within ourselves," said Jennifer B.. She is 35 years old, married to Jerry, a responsible father, and works as a farmer. Jennifer and Jerry are gifted with six children: Jeffrey - 14 years old, in 4th year high school; Kevin - 13 years old, in 3rd year high school; Jayson - 9 years old, in grade-IV; Angelica May - 8 years old, in grade-IV; Jennylyn - 7 years, in old grade-II; and Jay Anne Ellaine - 2 years old. Jennifer and her husband are striving hard in order to sustain the needs of their family and supply all the needs of their five children who are studying.

Jennifer raises ducks in her village. She decided to venture into this type of business to help her husband in supporting the needs of their family. She is asking for financial support of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders as additional capital in developing and improving the business she manages.

Jennifer is aiming for success in life so she is doing her best to attain the goals she wants to happen in her life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Assa

texts.en: Assa is 42 years old and married with three children between the ages of 15 and 19 years.  All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a six-room house where she stays with 10 people. Assa takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  She has a stall selling crafts like mats, table cloths and bowls.  She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for 10 years, servicing her 20th loan.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home. Assa sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. She buys her crafts from women in Bombo (Nubian) who mostly work in crafts towns in Uganda and so she incurs transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season as she works from an open place. Assa wants to use this loan to buy more crafts. She hopes to see her business grow stronger and to start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more crafts for resale

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mr. Mao N., age 26, is married and has a lovely young child. Mao N. shares responsibility for his family by working in construction. His wife is a garment worker. Mao N. is looking for a loan to purchase piglets to raise for additional income. The new business that he starts with this loan will provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase piglet to raise

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a young Palestinian man, 27 years old, who is married with three children. He operates a grocery shop where he sells vegetables, canned food and candy.

Mohammad has requested 2,000 USD from FATEN to buy new products and vegetables for his shop.

Mohammad appears in the photo at his shop.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and products for his shop

loans.name: Debbie's Group

texts.en:
Debbie B. is from the village of Burgos. She is 52 years old. Debbie is the leader of a 8-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Caliguian Center."

Debbie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Debbie owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of products in the local community. Debbie has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Debbie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Debbie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. She used her previous loan to buy products to sell. Debbie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to buy products to sell. This will be Debbie's 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Candelaria De La Cruz Ramírez

texts.es: Candelaria de la Cruz R. de 35 años de edad, reside en la colonia Modelo ubicada en el departamento de San Salvador. La señora Candelaria esta acompañada y también vive junto a sus tres hijos todos menores de 18 años de edad. Su compañero de vida se dedica a la venta de productos varios como ropa, productos perecederos entre otros más. Candelaria posee una venta de zapatos la cual esta ubicada en el mercado Sagrado Corazón, uno de los mercados que cuenta con más afluencia de personas y  uno de los más antiguos de la ciudad de San Salvador. Candelaria es una persona muy trabajadora la cual dedica su tiempo a trabajar para darle todo lo que sus hijos necesitan y así mismo contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más zapatos de manera que tenga más variedad que ofrecer.
texts.en:
Candelaria de la Cruz Ramirez is 35 years old and she lives in the Modelo colony in El Salvador. Candelaria is married ans she lives together with her three young children. Her life partner sells various products such as clothing, perishable foods and others. Candelaria sells shoes in the Sagrado Corazon market, one of the best visited and one of the oldest markets in El Salvador. Candelaria is a very hard working woman and she spends her time working to provide her kids with all that they need, as well as to contribute towards the household expenses. She is requesting a loan so that she might purchase more shoes to add variety to her store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal N., 35, has a 3.5-hectare plot for farming in Kor village, Takeo province. She earns a little income from farming. She is married to Mr. Pem Kim, who is a construction worker and pig breeder. Her husband also helps her in farming. Since her rice field has a lot of insects, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides to kill insects and make her crops more productive. In addition, she would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers and fuel, and to fix her watering machine for her farm. She will also buy pig food and piglets for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides to kill insects to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Union Group

texts.en: Annie G. is a leader of a group of five borrowers called Union Group. She is 38 years old and is married with two children aged 7 and 9, with educational levels of kindergarten and 1st grade. Annie and her family live in the Bernard farm community on Kakata highway, but she sells in the Red-light market which is the biggest market in Paynesville, Liberia. Annie is illiterate due to poverty. Annie’s business is dressmaking materials. She buys them from wholesalers and sells retail on a table in the Red-light market. She has been running this business for more than twenty years and hopes to own a shop. Annie started by selling coconuts and her capital was 5,000 Liberian Dollars, given to her by her husband. She is popular in the Red-light market and talks to customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Annie needs this loan to purchase more underwear and bras for resale. She dreams of establishing the business for her children so that they can fend for themselves in the future. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Annie is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear and bras to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine and material that used when sewing

loans.name: Ana De Jesús

texts.es: Ana de Jesús A. de 50 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su madre de 80 años de edad, la cual se encarga de realizar todos los quehaceres del hogar, mientras que Ana sale cada día a ganarse el sustento diario. Ana posee una venta de agua de cocos, los cuales ella misma pela para que sus clientes puedan disfrutar de esta refrescante agua. Su lugar de ubicación es muy clave, ya que se encuentra sobre la autopista que conduce hacia el Aeropuerto Nacional de El Salvador, lugar en el cual cuenta con mucha competencia, lo cual no desanima a Ana, en esta carretera muchas personas se detienen con sus automóviles a comprar cocos, esto se da sobretodo con las personas que van fuera del país o regresan del extranjero. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar cocos por mayor, de manera que pueda obtenerlos a menor precio y de esta manera percibir mayores ganancias lo cual beneficie a su familia. Ana es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, la cual posee muy buenas referencias por parte de sus Vecinas.
texts.en:
Ana de Jesús A., 50, lives in La Paz department with her 80-year-old mother, who does all the household chores while Ana goes out daily to try to earn their living. Ana sells coconuts which she, herself, dehusks so that her customers can enjoy the refreshing coconut milk. Her location is key: she is located along the freeway that leads to the El Salvador National Airport. She has a lot of competition but Ana is not discouraged by this. Many people stop along this freeway to buy coconuts, especially those leaving the country or returning from abroad. For this reason, Ana is asking for funding to buy coconuts at wholesale so that she can get them at a better price and produce higher profits that will benefit her family. Ana is a very humble, hard-working woman, who is highly recommended by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coconuts at wholesale

loans.name: Panca Kerti 1 Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu W. (0) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Sombang, Jembrana, Bali. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Panca Kerti 1 (MUK-0008).

Ni Putu is widowed and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month.

In 2007, Ni Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. She is now requesting a new loan of 2,250,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 1st from MUK.

Ni Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


 About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


Note to Kiva Lenders:  
This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender.

This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers.
 
To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata F. est âgée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIANNAH-MALARY depuis 4ans et demi et a eu de très bonnes expériences avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficier 9 fois de suite et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est propriétaire d'un petit restaurant où elle ne vend que le petit déjeuner. Et parallèlement elle vend des tissus teintés. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Fatoumata F. is 35 years old, she is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois of Diannah-Malary for four and a half years and has had very good experience with the loans. She obtained nine successive loans and never had any issues with reimbursing it. She is the owner of a small restaurant where she serves only breakfast. In addition, she sells dyed fabrics. Her income allows her to help contribute to the cost of her children’s education.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and promote her restaurant busines

loans.name: Perlas Del Pedregal Group

texts.es:
PERLAS DEL PEDREGAL es un banco D. Emprendimiento formado en la zona del pedregal ubicado al sur D. la ciudad, esta compuesto por 11 socias que viven en la misma zona, por ser una zona alejada la mayoria D. sus habitantes se dedican a la crianza D. animales y otras actividades.

La Sra.Rosario es la presidenta del banco, casada  y trabaja en la cafeteria D. la universidad, y tiene como segunda actividad la venta D. artefactos a credito, actualmente vive con su esposo que es chofer D. una linea D. radio taxis y sus dos hijos que aun estan en etapa escolar, ella utilizara el prestamo para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo y mejorar la condicion D. vida D. su familia.

tambien forma parte D. este grupo la Sra. Virginia es la tesorera D. Banco D. Emprendimiento, es casada y se dedica a labores D. casa como su actividad principal, pero ademas tiene otra actividad que es la D. artesania en tejidos D. mantas y otros, ella vive con su esposo que trabaja como carpintero realizando muebles, ambos tiene dos hijos D. los cuales solo dos van a la escuela. la meta D. la sra Virginia es la D. poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo en sus artesanias y dedicarse completamente a este oficio. 

Todas las socias son personas responsables que en muchos casos mantienen solas el hogar y trabajan duro para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. toda su familia, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Perlas del Pedregal” (Pearls of Pedregal) was established in the District of Pedregal, which is located to the south of the city. The group consists of eleven members who live in the same area. Since they live in remote areas, the majority of the local residents engage in raising animals and other activities.

Sra. Rosario is the Communal Bank president. She is married, works at a university cafeteria, and has a siD. business selling merchandise on credit. Rosario currently lives with her husband, who works as a chauffeur for a fleet of radio taxis, and her two children who attend school. She will use her loan to increase her operating capital and improve her family’s living conditions.

Another member of the group is Sra. Virginia, who serves as the Communal Bank treasurer. She is married and works as a homemaker as her primary activity. Virginia also has a business making hand woven blankets and other items. She lives with her husband, who is a carpenter and furniture maker, and their two children of whom one is of school age. Virginia’s goal is to increase her operating capital and dedicate herself full-time to her craft business.

All of the members are responsible individuals who are, in most cases, the sole provider for their households. They work hard to improve the quality of life for their families and are grateful to both Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional operating capital to buy merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden B. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and ice cream from home and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish to sell.  Kiden is 21 years old and is married to a teacher. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock dried fish to sell

loans.name: La Criba Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario la criba esta ubicado en la aldea que tiene por nombre La Criba, esta ubicada a media cuadra del centro basico Terencio Sierra, este grupo esta integrado por cuatro mujeres todas vecinas de la comunidad.
a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Delmis Marina F. A. tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Marvin Geovani Rodriguez con quien han logrado establecer una panaderia en su casa de habitacion.
doña delmis se encarga de la elaboracion del pan junto con sus cuatro hijos y el señor Marvin se dedica a la venta del pan en su carro y tambien lo venden en la casa.
esta solicitando el credito para comprar harina y huevos.

la señora Luz Marina N. B. tiene 24 años de edad esta soltera y vive con su mama, Luz desde la edad de 21 años establecio un pequeño negocio en su casa y ahí vende abarroteria como ser granos basicos, frescos etc. 
el credito lo utilizara para la para la compra de abarroteria y refrescos.
Su deseo es que su negocio sea el mejor de la zona.

doña Maria Digna C. C. tiene 63 años de edad, es viuda,  su esposo se murio y tiene 5 hijos todos son independientes, Digna comenta que tiene alrededor de 35 años de dedicarse al negocio de pulperia. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de verduras, abarroteria, refrescos y carnes para preparar golosinas.

Greysi R. T. tiene 23 años de edad, esta en union libre con el señor Hector David Flores con quien tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad.
Greysi se dedica la venta de golosinas y venta de abarroteria, en estos momentos su pareja se encuentra fuera del pais, le envia remesas que invierte en su casa.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar carnes, tortillas mantecas, refrescos, aceite, papas, pollos, verduras, para fabricar sus golosinas.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “La Criba” is located in the neighborhood of the same name. The area is half a block from central Terencio Sierra. The group consists of four women who are from the neighborhood. Their business activities are described below.

Sra. Delmis Marina F. A. is 39 years old and married to Sr. Marvin Geovani Rodriguez. They operate a bakery inside of their home. Doña Delmis and her four children are responsible for making the bread. Sr. Marvin sells the bread from his car and at home. She is requesting a loan to buy flour and eggs.

Sra. Luz Marina N. B. is 24 years old, single, and lives with her mother. When she was 21, Luz established a small business at home selling grocery products such as basic grains, cold drinks, etc. Her loan will be used to buy groceries and soft drinks. She hopes that her business will be the best in the area.

Doña Maria Digna C. is a 63 year old widow with five adult children who all live independently. She says that she has been managing her grocery business for approximately 35 years. Her loan will be used to buy vegetables, groceries, soft drinks, meats, and ingredients for making candy.

Greysi R. T. is 23 years old and in a common law marriage with Sr. Hector David Flores. They have a six year old child. Greysi sells candy and groceries. Her husband is currently outside of the country and sends remittances to invest in their home. Greysi will use her loan to buy meat, tortillas, lard, soft drinks, oil, potatoes, chicken, vegetables, and ingredients for making candy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items & ingredients

loans.name: Lucas Agustin

texts.es: Lucas es de 35 años de edad, es tejedor, se decía a fabricar fajas, tiene 10 años de experiencia en la actividad, es casado tiene tres hijos varones y dos mujeres, con la ayuda de su esposa han salido adelante con su familia, solicita su segundo préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo específicamente compra de hilo, su productos los vende en el mercado local y lugares aledaños.
texts.en:
Lucas, 35, is a weaver; he manufacures shawls. He has been in this line of work for 10 years. He's married and has three sons and two daughters. With his wife's help the family has thrived. He is asking for his second loan to increase working capital, specifically to buy thread. He sells his product in the local market and in outlying areas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is very supportive of her family. She has a boutique where she sells her handmade clothes and does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She takes orders from different shops in Multan and supplies them on-time to make an income. She has been in doing this work for over six years.

Sughran uses a room of her house as a boutique to display her work to her customers. She does this because the rent of shops is too high in Multan. Her customer base is purely women. She prepares women’s wear such as shalwar kamiz and kurtas (pant and tunic outfits), etc. These two items are specifically used in Pakistan because this is its culture and women like to wear them.

Sughran has applied for a loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). With the loan she will be able to buy material such as clothes, beads and thread in bulk to fulfill larger orders for her customers. She is hopeful that she can earn a good profit and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase required materials for her boutique

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
El señor Valerio Fernández P. tiene 27 años de edad y vive en el barrio Simón Bolívar de la ciudad de Tarija. Valerio aun no se caso y vive en casa de sus padres. Valerio se dedica  al servicio de transporte de áridos (arena, ripio, grava, piedra, etc.) el cual vende en las diferentes construcciones que hay en la ciudad, actividad que viene realizando desde hace muchísimos años. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                 Valerio quisiera formar una familia, tener hijos y en un futuro nietos, el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar material de construcción para su casita, el crédito será destinado para la compra de dicho material.       
                                                                                                                                                                Valerio nos cuenta que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Valerio F. P. is 27 years old and lives in the neighborhood Simon Bolivar in the city of Tarija. Valerio has not yet married and lives in his parents' house. He makes a living by transporting materials such as sand, gravel, and stone, which he sells to various construction companies in the city, an activity that he has been doing for many years. Valerio would like to form a family, have children, and grandchildren in the future. He tells us that he needs to purchase construction material for his house, which is why he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction material for his home

loans.name: Massorie Progressive Union Group

texts.en: Umu S. K. (pictured in the middle) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Umu was born in Masorie village, which is about 32 miles from Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is approximately 37 years old. Umu is married to a farmer and the couple has five children, two of whom are in primary school and two in secondary school.  For many years now, Umu has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice and pepper. This is not the first loan that Umu and her group members have accessed from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of previous SMT/Kiva loans, they were able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. With the help of this loan, Umu will use her share (SLL 1,000,000) to expand her business. She will buy palm oil, rice and pepper at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice and pepper at wholesale

loans.name: Saingerel

texts.en:
Saingerel, B. is a humble, helpful and open-minded person. She is lives with her husband and one-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Saingerel has been operating a taxi business since 2005 and, after the birth of her daughter, her husband helps in the business.

Saingerel enjoys transporting people. She says, “I must be very responsible and careful when driving my car in order to provide a safe ride for my customers.” Also she says, “The most important thing to me is to provide a good education for my children."

Saingerel is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn B. is from the village of Brgy. Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old. Jenalyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jenalyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products in the local community. Jenalyn has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jenalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jenalyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jenalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda, de 51 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus dos hijos Nilton de 30 y Ángel 24 años, a quienes desea dar una mejor vida. El trabajo que Hermelinda se dedica, es el cultivo de papas, zanahorias, arvejas. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Ella vende sus productos en los mercados de Tarma y La Merced, puesto que es donde mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga de insectos y de los cambios climáticos. En adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos, para tener mejores ingresos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, los invertirá en insumos para cuidar sus plantas ya que tener sus campos libres de plagas.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, age 51, is a simple hardworking woman who lives in her own house with her two children Nilton, 30, and Angel, 24, to whom she wishes to give a better life. Hermelinda makes a living planting potatoes, carrots and peas. Early every morning she tends to her crops since she knows that the price she will get depends on their quality. She sells her goods in the Tarma and La Merced markets since that is where she gets the best prices. What she enjoys most about her work is harvesting the crops since that is when she sees the pay-off for months of work. She has been doing this for 21 yeas and feels that the most difficult part is protecting her fields from plagues and weather. In the future she hopes to improve her yields to increase her income. This is her eighth loan with MFP and say that his loan will help her work significantly. She is well loved by her partners in her community bank since she is very supportive. She will invest the 2500 Nuevos Soles she is requesting in various goods to care for her plants and keep them free from plagues.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods to treat plagues in her fields

loans.name: Nhil

texts.en: Nhil S., 44, is married with five children living at home in the Kampong Chhnang province. She raises pigs and cows, typically making $1 US each day. Her husband works in construction, typically making about $3 each day. Nhil S. would like a loan of $800 to purchase more cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Erkinoi's Group

texts.en:
Erkinoi U. is the leader of the group.  She is 39 and married. She has two daughters and a son. All of them are at school.  Erkinoi is a farmer and her husband works as a truck driver.  Erkinoi cultivates cotton and also breeds cattle.  She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase a calf for breeding.  In the future she wants to repair her house and provide her children with a good education. 

Diloromhon M. is the treasurer of the group.  She is 41 and married. She has two sons and a daughter. The first son is a baker and the other children are at school.  Diloromhon works as a nurse in the hospital.  She also helps her husband to breed cattle. Selling six liters of milk every day, she makes about $43 per month.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a cow for breeding.  In the future she wants to purchase a piece of land and start building a house for her first son.

Tojimamat S., 37, is married. He has a son and two daughters, all of whom are in school.  Tojimamat breeds livestock and sells some animals every weekend. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase sheep in order to resell them at a higher price after fattening.
 
Mahmudjon U., 38, is married. He has two daughters and a son. All the children are in school.  Mahmudjon is a farmer who cultivates cotton for making money. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase cotton seed. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Clari Marin

texts.en:
Clari lives with his partner (she is also pictured) and his 18-year-old son. They live in a rural part of the neighborhood of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, which occupies the northern section of the city of Chiclayo. Clari has lived in this area for over 12 years.

Currently Clari works in public transit. For four years, he has driven a moto-taxi in and around the city of Chiclayo, carrying passengers to work, on errands and to visit friends. This is a service that exhibits significant competition, but allows a certain level of flexibility and autonomy in the work, a fact that Clari appreciates.

The loan is requested in order to make repairs to the moto-taxi and purchase a number of accessories for it. The actions will reduce his ongoing maintenance expenses and he hopes to draw additional clientele. Clari has taken out loans from Edpyme Alternativa in the past. He has always paid punctually and responsibly. He has an excellent credit history and our analysis has approved him for the loan.

loans.use: Repairs to moto-taxi and purchasing accessories

loans.name: Gulnozkhon's Group

texts.en:
The current unemployment rate in Kyrgyzstan is extremely high. If educated citizens are in search of jobs, then unskilled workers have lost hope completely. Unfortunately, our nation cannot provide every citizen with a worthy job, so most workers have to be headed abroad. The Russian Federation is the best option for workers. First, the language is not a barrier. Kyrgyzstan as a former Soviet Union Republic still uses the Russian language as a second official one. Also, Russia is in great need of cheap labor, so this cooperation benefits both sides. In many families in rural areas of Kyrgyzstan, at least one member of the family is employed abroad. 

Gulnozkhon T., 44, is from a village called Aravan in Southern Kyrgyzstan. Her husband left to go to Russia in search of better opportunities to earn money. There, he works as  a construction builder.  Her older daughter is a seamstress and the family is getting ready for her upcoming wedding. Gulnozkhon’s second daughter and a son also help out about the house.  The family business is cultivating and selling cotton.  The purpose of the loan is purchasing a dowry for her daughter’s wedding, broadening her business by raising livestock also and making repairs in their house. 

Gavharoi R., 40, is involved in raising and selling bulls. Her husband and two sons work in Russia.  She plans to spend this loan on purchasing more livestock and broadening her business. She would like to spend her profit on finishing the construction of some of the rooms in her house. 

Takhir T., 39, raises poultry. The purpose of the loan is to start raising livestock and reselling it. He plans to spend the profit on developing his business and on repairing the house. 

Oktyabrkhon E., 43, raises livestock. She also does dairy farming. She needs this loan to finish the construction of her house and arrange weddings for her daughters.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to prepare the dowry for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Sarai Group

texts.es:
El grupo sarai lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es María José Gómez quien desde hace cinco años tiene una pequeña venta de gaseosa y refrescos naturales de cacao, cebada, piña, arroz con piña, cálala, pitalla, limón, chilla…etc. 
Las otras integrantes del grupos son Melba B. quien realiza frescos naturales e invertirá en frutas, azúcar, hielo, bolosas y pajillas y María S. tiene una pulpería la cual tiene surtida con los productos de mayor venta.
texts.en: The Sarai group is made up of three hard-working women.  María José Gómez is one of the group's members and has sold soft drinks and natural fruit drinks (cacao, barely, pineapple, rice and pineapple,passion fruit, pitaya, lemon, chilla etc. ) for five years. The others who make up the group are Melba B. who makes natural drinks also and will invest in fruits, sugar, ice, bags, and straws and María S. who has a small grocery store in her home.  She will stock her store with products that sell the most.

loans.use: Soft drinks and fruits

loans.name: Thet

texts.en:
The two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Thet T., 57, and her husband, age 56. They currently live in Kompong Cham Province. Thet T. is a  57 year old married woman and mother. This couple has given birth to seven children, three of whom are married, and the remaining four are single. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. Mrs. Thet T. always grows rice crop on her farmland, and she is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Presently, Mrs. Thet T. wants to start up another rice plantation to earn extra income to support her family’s need. 

Mrs. Thet T. would like to request a loan to invest in her farming business by purchasing cucumber seeds and sugar cane for planting.

loans.use: To purchase cucumber seeds and sugar cane for planting.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma A. is from the village of Poblacion, Kadingilan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Delma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Delma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. She is also engaging in buying and selling of livestock like pigs. Delma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Delma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Delma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like biscuits & junk foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Delma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like biscuits & junk foods

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao S., 38, sells rice and chickens, earning an income of 6 USD per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband grows mushrooms, earning an income of 3 USD per day. The family spends 40 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and 120 USD on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more rice and chickens to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more rice and chickens to resell

loans.name: Mirzokosim

texts.en:
Since he was a young Mirzokosim has known to work. His parents taught him how to get by as an agriculturist and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of two children and still works as an agriculturalist. Thanks to his parents Mirzokosim now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life. Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive, but without them his production will not improve. You can help Mirzokosim keep moving forward with his development plans.    

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia E. is from the village of Brgy. Kirang, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Virginia owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for breeding. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: 01 Dong Son Group

texts.en:
Vui L. T. (7) is a 41 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Vui is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 01 Dong Son (10.03.01 Dong Son).

Vui is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Vui owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling peanuts in the local community.  Vui has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Vui joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Vui has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.248.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.787.900 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Vui plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  P. T. Hoa (6) is a 35 year-old woman who is requesting a 5787900 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.

2.  L. T. Mien (5) is a 73 year-old woman who is requesting a 5787900 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3.  D. T. Tu (16) is a 33 year-old woman who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

4.  H. T. Ngan (13) is a 31 year-old woman who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
