Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Mary Aoko

texts.en:
Mary O. is a 42-year-old widow from Migori who has four school-going children, two in college and the other two in secondary school.

Mary has a business of selling second-hand clothes and has been in it for the past 11 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000 and the money is used to cater to her family's needs as she is the sole breadwinner.

She is applying for her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock, which is running out.
 
She hopes to expand her business and be able to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, aged 28 years, is married to Margret M., aged 25 years, who is a farmer. Together have one child, Denya, aged 10 years. David is a livestock trader and his business is located at Bissil market, a busy market, where he sells livestock to the butcher men from Kajiado, Kitengela and Nairobi. David has been operating his business for a year and it gives him a monthly profits of KES 17, 000.

He was introduced to KADET by another customer. This loan of KES 30,000 is his first loan with KADET and he plans to use it to purchase more livestock to sell. If the loan boosts his business, he plans to start dairy farming.

David hopes to be supplying livestock and milk to both Kenya meat commission and Kenya cooperative creameries. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock for sale.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El  señor Ramiro se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina de costura. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en al zona de Seke Padilla de la ciudad de El Alto. Es soltero y no tiene hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron.
texts.en: Ramiro makes a living as a tailor. He is requesting the loan to purchase a sewing machine. He lives in his parents' home in the Seke Padilla area of the city of El Alto. He is single and has no children. He is very satisfied with the loans that have been authorized for him.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia works hard to support her family. Rodelia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rodelia is borrowing PHP 1,500 through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Rodelia is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit  cookstove.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Mère de 04 enfants, akos  est mariée à un mécanicien .elle a 56 ans  et est revendeuse de céréales(mil,maîs,sorgho….)à Lomé et pour ses besoins de commerce se ravitaille sur marché de la place appelée marché d’Akodesséwa .elle fait cette activité depuis 1983 et  a fait preuve de beaucoup de sérieux lors de son premier prêt et ce second prêt lui faciliterait aussi l’achat de plus de céréales.
texts.en: Mother of four children, Akos is married to a mechanic. She is 56 and sells cereals (millet, maize, sorghum, etc.) in  Lomé. She buys her goods at a local market called Akodesséwa. She has been in this business since 1983, and she proved to be a very responsible person during the course of her first loan. This second loan will also make it easier for her to buy more cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Art

texts.en: Art, 37, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Art is a housewife while her husband is employed to break stones into pieces to sell, earning an income of USD 10 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 123 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. Art is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve her family farming. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander has been in the mining business for the last 25 years in Naivasha  town. He is 49 years old, married to Stella Nduta. They are blessed with four schooling children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy another extraction site and add more manpower. 

In future, Alexander hopes to own several extraction sites on the outskirts of Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy another extraction site and add more manpower.

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Janil is a 46-year old entrepreneur from Bint Jbeil, who is married and has one child. He has been renting a grocery store for the past 28 years, which has given him wide experience in this industry. His customers include neighbors, friends and other community members. Janil believes that it is high quality work and experience that have helped him succeed.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. This will be his second loan from Al Majmoua; his previous loan had a big positive effect on his social and financial situation, and he is a borrower of good standing. He plans to use the loan to improve his quality of work, through buying new summer products and doing some maintenance to his shop.

loans.use: to buy new summer products and to do some maintenance to his shop

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita is 54 years old and married. She has four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Virginita has been pig fattening for 11 years and also earns additional income from selling electronic loads and running a general store.

Virginita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Creciendo Juntos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Creciendo Juntos”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía en cuero, preparación de mermeladas caseras, preparación de comidas caseras, cortinaje y confección de ropa para casa. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Sergio quien en la foto aparece sentado en el primer puesto de derecha a izquierda, viste una boina y chaqueta color negro, además gesticula con sus manos el signo de la paz. Se dedica a la artesanía en cueros desde hace 40 años. Realiza vestuario y bolsos en cuero, específicamente chaquetas, pantalones, morrales, bananos, monederos, entre otros. Para la fabricación de sus productos habilitó una habitación en su casa como taller, ahí cuenta con una máquina de coser industrial. 
Sus productos los ofrece de manera particular y sus clientes realizan los pedidos a medida. Además su hijo le ayuda con la promoción de sus productos y le encarga trabajos. Comenta que tiene bastante material, sin embargo considera que a veces le falta tiempo para trabajar, su horario es durante todos los días de la semana, pero es relativo. Sus productos los envía a la ciudad de Santiago por encomienda. 
La temporada de verano es favorable para ofrecer y vender sus productos, debido a que concurren bastantes turistas a ésta zona. 
Con el préstamo comprará cueros de varios colores, cierres y pegamento.
Sus metas son comprar una máquina de coser que le permita realizar una puntada más definida y una mejor terminación en sus trabajos. Además expandirse en su negocio y poder enseñarle a más gente, con esto generar fuentes de trabajo. Comenta que no le conviene establecerse en un local comercial, ya que se dedica a producir y esto le demandaría más tiempo. 
Sergio vive junto a su esposa, quien realiza mermeladas caseras. Sus sueños son comprar un terreno para construir una casa, para esto espera vender su casa y contar con el capital para invertir en su proyecto. 
Sergio está muy contento y agradecido D. crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza. Se está integrando al grupo, por lo que recién está conociendo a los demás socios y sus negocios. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede D. poder legislativo D. país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa D. poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador D. Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
The Creciendo Juntos (Growing Together) Community Bank is comprised of 18 members who work in different jobs such as leather crafts, homemade jams, food preparation, making drapes, and making clothing at home. All of the members live in the town of Valparaíso. 

Sergio (seated first on the right in the photo, wearing a black hat and jacket, and making the peace sign) has made crafts out of leather for 40 years. He makes clothing and bags, specifically jackets, pants, backpacks, pouches, wallets etc. He fixed up a room in his house as a workshop and has an industrial sewing machine there.

Sergio only makes items to order and sells them privately. His son also  helps with advertising and is responsible for some jobs. He says that he has lots of material but sometimes lacks the time to do the work. He works every day of the week but it varies somewhat. Sergio sends his products to Santiago by bus where they are picked up by the customer. The summer is a good time of year for selling his products as many tourists come to the area then. 

With the loan Sergio plans to buy leather in a variety of colours, fasteners, and glue.  His goal is to buy a sewing machine that make more defined stitches and give a better finish. He also wishes to expand the business and teach more people how to do the work. This will generate more income for him. He says that it wouldn’t suit him to have a stall or store as he only wishes to make the products, not sell them, as it would take up too much time.

Sergio’s wife makes jam in their home. Their dream is to buy a piece of land where they can build a house. To do this, they would need to sell their current home and get some money to invest in the project. 

Sergio is very happy and grateful for the loan obtained through Fondo Esperanza. As a member of the group he has recently got to know the other members and learn about their businesses.

Valparaíso is located 120 km northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and also home to the national legislature. The city is also the main port for the country and has beautiful, picturesque countryside where, for example, the house of Nobel prize the poet Pablo Neruda’s house is located.

loans.use: to buy leather in a variety of colours, fasteners, and glue

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with three school-going children. She is a hardworking business lady who has been selling cereals for the last 11 years to make life more comfortable for her family. She wants in the next five years to have grown and expanded her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize and beans. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching her business management skills.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Lualhati

texts.en:
Lualhati is 42 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She wants to improve their computer shop to provide a better service for encoding and an internet cafe to their customers in the village. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional sets of computers with the excess to be used for their maintenance. Lualhati aims to increase her income to help her husband in financing the education of their children and to satisfy their daily needs. 

She hopes that the loan will help her to expand the business.She mentioned that hard work and strong determination are the key to make her dream into a reality.

loans.use: to buy additional sets of computers and to pay for their maintenance

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es:
Ubaldo nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 55 años de edad, él está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene seis hijos. Actualmente, él vive en la ciudad de Pisaq y donde realiza sus actividades, él es albañil y realiza todo tipo de obras como por ejemplo revestimiento de casas, pavimentación de calles y otras cosas más, él y su esposa tiene un negocio familiar  consiste en vender productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, y muchas cosas más.

Ubaldo requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo latas de aceite y tarros de leche. 

El Banco Comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Pisaq de la provincia de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Ubaldo was born in the city of Paucartambo (Cusco, Perú). He is 55, married, and has six children. He currently lives in the city of Pisaq, where he works. He is a bricklayer who does all kinds of work such as tiling houses, paving streets, and more. He and his wife have a family business selling basic staples such as rice, sugar, pasta, and many more items.

Ubaldo needs this loan to purchase merchandise, for example oil and jars of milk.

The “Mosoq Ñusta” Communal Bank meets every thirty days in the Pisaq district of the Calca province (Cusco, Peru). Cusco is known to be a very touristic and commercial zone, and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival. It is also known for being home to one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as cans of oil and jars of milk.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena, tiene 34 años de edad, estudio sus estudios primarios, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian. Se dedica al comercio, a la venta de ropa para diferentes edades, inició este negocio siendo trabajadora para otro negocio y hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia.

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de mercadería para ampliar sus ventas: compra de gorras, suéteres, ropa para bebés, lencería, etc. Espera en el futuro tener varios vendedores y así incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Elena, age 34, has an elementary education. She has two children in school. She is a merchant, and sells clothing for different ages. She started this business when she was working for another business and she now has two years' experience.

She decided to request a loan for the purchase of merchandise for increasing her sales: the purchase of caps, sweaters, baby clothing, lingerie, etc. She hopes to have various sellers in the future, thus increasing her earnings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Jeova  Jaire Group

texts.en:
Snodia is 49 years old and lives in Gweru.  She is married and her husband is a farmer.  They have three children aged 23, 23 and 19.  The last-born is still at school.  They also look after seven further dependants.

Snodia raises and sells chickens. She is part of a co-operative with three other members.  The main challenges facing her business are the difficulty in raising growth capital and the high mortality rates among chicks during the cold weather.

She will invest the money she borrows in chicks, vaccines and chicken feed.  She believes that this will enable the family to have a better life through providing food for the family.

Over the next five years, Snodia hopes to develop a thriving business of her own.

loans.use: to buy chickens, vaccines and chicken feed

loans.name: Aracely

texts.es:
La señora Araceli vive en una localidad pequeña es muy bonita ella vive en unión libre con el señor  francinel y con quien procreo dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

       Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  frutas de la región, como son: chayotes, frijol, calabaza, entre otros y lleva practicando en esta actividad  un mes  y le está yendo bien.

     Su motivo a solicitar el préstamo para esta actividad  es porque vio que es una actividad muy cómoda que le dejara buenas  ganancias para cubrir sus gastos generados en  su hogar.

     Lo que mas desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda ir aumentado  sus ingresos y sacar adelante  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Araceli lives in a small, pretty village with her common-law husband, Francinel and their two children who are their dependents.

She requested a loan to buy regional produce of the region such as: chayotes (vegetable pears), beans, squash, and more.  She has been working in this for a month and it’s going well.

Her reason to request the loan for this work is because she sees this as a comfortable business that will give her good earnings to cover the household expenses.

What she most likes about this little business is that she can continue increasing her earnings and get her children ahead.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of regional fruit and vegetables of the region.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es socia del FINCA Peru desD. hace 13 años. Teresa se dedica a la venta D. cochinilla y tara, tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, siempre trabajó en la venta D. cochinilla y tara, y recuerda que con sus ahorros, pudo empezar con el negocio D. su tienda y también pudo construir su casa, da gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal porque le enseñaron a poder tener un negocio próspero, el préstamo fácil, y las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder ser mas eficiente en su negocio, ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando comprará arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa has been a member of FINCA Peru for 13 years. She sells cochineal (a natural dye) and “tara” (a natural tannin used in making leather), but she also manages a grocery store. Teresa has always sold cochineal and “tara”, but she recalls using her savings to establish her store and to build her house. Thanks to the training she has received from her Communal Bank, Teresa has learned how to have a prosperous business. The loans have been easy to manage and the training has helped her to make her business more efficient.

Now this loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, milk, and noodles so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and noodles.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Cirila vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Cirila es la venta de tubérculos y granos secos como por ejemplo maíz, cebada y trigo. 

En esta oportunidad Cirila requiere el préstamo para comprar más granos secos como maíz y cebada así de esa manera poder abastecer su puesto de venta de más mercadería. 
  
Cirila agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Communal Bank “San José de Urubamba” which is located in the city of Urubamba. The members of this Communal Bank conduct their meetings every 30 days in the city of Urubamba in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Cirila lives in the city of Urubamba, which is where she conducts her business activities. Her main business is selling tubers and dried grains such as corn, barley, and wheat. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more dried grains, such as corn and barley, so that she can restock her vending post with more merchandise.

Cirila appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy dried grains, such as corn and barley.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and is married with six children aged between 5 and 14 years old. She takes care of seven children. Rose owns a business selling cows. This is her fourth successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 6 am until 4 pm every day except on Sunday. She currently employs one person to help her.

Rose has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her animal sales business. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to sell

loans.name: Olival

texts.en: Olivial is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and they have three children between 10 and 17 years old who are in school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling dry coconuts in the local market. She makes lots of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry coconuts for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dry coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
La señora Mirian tiene 47 años, está casada con el señor Milciades de 39  años, el es empleado de una empresa de transporte, la pareja tiene 3 hijos, uno de 18 años, otro de 14 años y la más pequeña de 8 años, los dos mayores  estudian y ayudan a su madre en el negocio.
La señora  Miriam se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, empezó hace mas de 5 años en su negocio, gracias a la ayuda de su marido quien es chapista de una empresa de transporte importante de la ciudad.
Ella comenta que con un poquito de capital empezó, y actualmente ya cuenta con local propio donde vende prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. Desea mejorar su local comercial, y es por ello que solicita el crédito.
Desea comprar materiales para mejorar el local, ya que quiere ir creciendo y mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mirian is 47 years-old and married to 39-year-old Milciades who is employed by a transportation business. The couple has three children: one who is 18 years-old, another who is 14 years-old, and the youngest who is 8 years-old. The two eldest ones study and help their mother with the business.

Miriam makes a living selling garments. She began her business more than five years ago thanks to the help of her husband who is an automotive body repair worker for an important transportation business in the city.

She says that she began with little capital, and currently has her own store where she sells garments for women, men, and children. She wishes to improve her commercial store and for this reason is requesting a loan.

She would like to buy materials to improve the store since she wants to grow and better her work conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her business.

loans.name: Chepkorir

texts.en:
Chepkorir is a mother of 2 children aged 4 and 3 years old and has been in mixed farming for 5 years. She currently produces tea, pineapples, bananas, and milk, which all go to the local market. She says she fully relies on farming for the upkeep of her family.

Chepkorir has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chuff cutter for her dairy farming  business. She hopes this will reduce waste on feed and her production will improve significantly. She adds she will venture into other businesses in order to spread her farming risks. 

She is greatfull to Juhudi Kilmo for their loans which are uplifting the living standards of farmers.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is single. He is 30 years old and resides in Labinay, Ozamis City, Philippines. He owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. He has been 7 years in this business. Each month, he earns about 3,700 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. In 2011, Dante become a member of GDMPC. In the future, he wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el tiene un carro que hace servicio interprovincial hacia el distrito de Anta,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es comprarse otro carro.El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz y azucar para su casa.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues with his transportation business.  He has a car that provides interprovincial service all the way to Anta.  Through this business he wants to get ahead.  His dream is to buy another car.  He’s asking for the loan to buy rice and sugar for his house.  He’s happy about the loan and committed to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Usman is a maize farmer from Magajin Aska village. As a Babban Gona member, Usman is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Usman would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Usman can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Usman no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Usman hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Eliana Ysabel

texts.es:
Eliana con 39 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa familiar,junto a sus hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos como son piqueos,chicha,parihuela,ceviche,arroz con pato,caldos entre otros. Adicionalmente se dedica por las mañanas al servicio de limpieza. Solicita préstamo para la compra de activo fijo, como sillas, mesas,etc, para mejorar su atención al público y otros gastos.

Eliana es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: para la compra de activo fijo, como sillas, mesas,etc.

loans.name: Togbé

texts.en:
Born in 1977, at Gninoumé, Mr. Togbé D. is married and the father of two (2) children; in addition, he takes care of his two (2) nieces. He is the owner of an upholstery shop on National Highway No. 2 in Aného, which provides for the basic needs of his household. He is now facing an ever-growing demand that he cannot meet, owing to a lack of working capital. Mr. D. is a trustworthy man who has demonstrated good management by paying off his first loan without difficulty.

He is now asking for a loan of $850 to improve his workshop by acquiring a new machine and equipment that will allow him to better serve his customers and develop his business. Implementing this project will clearly add to his income and enormously improve the quality of life for his family.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY/J.V. Guy-Bray.

Monsieur D. Togbé, né en 1977 à Gninoumé, est marié et père de deux (02) enfants en plus de ses deux (02) nièces qui sont à sa charge. Il détient une tapisserie sur la nationale N°2 à Aného à travers lequel, il subvient aux besoins élémentaires de son foyer. Il fait face aujourd’hui à une demande sans cesse croissante qu’il est incapable de satisfaire à cause de l’insuffisance de fonds de roulement. Monsieur D. Togbé est un homme de confiance qui a fait preuve de sa bonne gestion à travers son premier crédit obtenu et remboursé sans incident. Il sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $850 pour aménager son atelier, acquérir une nouvelle machine et des matériels. Ce qui lui permettra de servir au mieux sa clientèle et d’accroître ses activités. Il est tout à fait évident que la réalisation de ce projet augmentera ses revenus et contribuera énormément à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To improve his workshop by acquiring a new machine and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Karisia intends to purchase one more steer and household goods for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Species wants to buy extra stock of cloth (vitengees).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her animal feed business

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.es:
Business Description

Jacobo and his wife have a sewing workshop were they make bedspread sets. Aside from this business, Jacobo sells other kinds of household goods like dust covers, tents, sets of cooking pots, sets of dishes, and others. Jacobo’s workshop is situated in his own house where he takes care of customers from 8 am to 8 pm.

Loan Use

Jacobo is asking for this credit to buy rolls of fabric to make more bedspreads, and the household goods that costumers are looking for. Jacobo comments that he sells products not only in the city, but also travels to sell them outside the city.

Personal Information

Jacobo is 37 years old, married. He has three young children; two of them go to school. Jacobo and his wife are willing to develop their business because it is their source of income. They mention that they would like to keep building their home to make it a safer dwelling and to protect their business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Jacobo junto con su esposa tienen taller de costura su actividad específica es la elaboración de Juegos de Cubre Camas, adicional a este negocio Jacobo tiene la venta de artículos varios para el hogar como: Colchas, Toldos, Juegos de Ollas, Vajillas, y otros. Jacobo tiene taller en su domicilio atiende a sus clientes desde las 8: AM a 20: PM

Uso del Préstamo

Jacobo solicita el crédito para comprar mas rollos de tela para la elaboración de cubre camas y artículos para el hogar que le están solicitando. Jacobo nos dice que no solamente vende dentro de la ciudad sino que sale a vender sus productos fuera de la ciudad.

Información Personal

Jacobo tiene 37 años es casado y 3 hijos menores de edad de los cuales 2 están estudiando. Jacobo junto con su esposa está sacando adelante el negocio ya que lo consideran su fuente generadora de ingresos. Además nos indica que tienen anhelo de seguir construyendo su vivienda asid ara mejor seguridad y bienestar a negocio y hogar.

loans.use: Buying more fabric

loans.name: Jaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Jaya T., a 58- year-old woman, lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She has three members in her family including herself. Her husband, Mr. Mukanda Lal T., died three years ago. Her daughter works in a printing press, and her son is studying in grade 7.
Mrs. T. opened a metal utensil shop six years ago. She sells different types of metal goods such as bells, gagris (water-carrying pots), metal plates and other different traditional metal pots used for worshipping god and goddess. Now she seeks a loan to buy these metal items because demands for these different items are increasing constantly in the local market.

loans.use: To buy metal goods

loans.name: Ni Nengah Tayu

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Tayu is a housewife who is very good at taking care of her family. Not only does she does she raise her children, but she also fulfills her obligation to her husband by helping to increase their family income through her work. To meet her family's needs, she started a business raising sows. Starting with just one sow, she now has two. The sows cost her 800,000 Rupiah a piece, and, tended well, produce 5-10 healthy piglets. The sale of the piglets from both sows can results in revenue of as much as 5,000,000 Rupiah. She has already been in this business for several years, which has paid for her children's primary education and a small amount has helped her to start a small store in front of her house. From all of her hard work she has gained lots of useful experience in growing her business. She now sees a new opportunity to move her business even further forward. She plans to raise fatted pigs, which are in high demand for use in Bali's famous roasted pork dish (babi guling). In fact, restaurants specializing in babi guling are becoming more and more common in Bali. Because of the excellent market for fatted pigs, Ni Nengah Tayu plans to raise additional sows. To help her with the expansion of her business, Ni Nengah Tayu would like to borrow capital to purchase more stock animals and special feed for all of her sows.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Nengah Tayu adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga yang benar-benar memahami bahwa tanggung jawabnya di keluarga tidak hanya mengasuh anak, tetapi juga berkewajiban membantu suami untuk meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarga. Menjalankan usaha ternak babi khususnya penginduk menjadi pilihannya. Berawal dari seekor penginduk saja saat ini Ni Nengah Tayu sudah mampu memelihara dua ekor penginduk. Penginduk ini dibelinya seharga Rp. 800.000,- per ekor dan dipelihara dengan baik dan bisa menghasilkan 5-10 ekor anak yang sehat sehingga kalau dihitung, hasil penjualannya bisa mencapai Rp. 5.000.000 dari ke dua ekor penginduk tersebut. Usaha yang sudah digeluti selama beberapa tahun ini mampu membiayai kebutuhan pendidikan anaknya dan sebagian kecil disisihkannya untuk membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya. Dari kegiatan usahanya ini Ni Nengah Tayu mendapat banyak pengalaman yang bermanfaat dalam pengembangan usahanya. Ni Nengah Tayu melihat adanya peluang untuk mengembangkan usahanya supaya lebih maju yaitu dengan banyaknya permintaan ternak babi penggemukan untuk babi guling, karena Bali sangat terkenal dengan masakan babi gulingnya, sehingga usaha rumah makan babi guling juga semakin banyak. Rencananya adalah selain penginduk Ni Nengah Tayu juga memelihara penggemukan karena pemasarannyapun juga sudah jelas. Dalam hal ini DINARI memberikan dukungan dalam bentuk pimjaman modal usaha dan ini dimanfaatkannya untuk pembelian stok pakan yang bisa mencukupi semua kebutuhan pakan ternaknya.

loans.use: for purchasing sows and feed

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Mrs. Angela O. is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City. Angela sells box speakers, a business she started in 2005. She is requesting a loan of $450 to expand her business.  She is a LAPO client who works hard and enjoys her work. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy materials for production of Electronics Speakers

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Armando Rodrigo C. is 31 years old. He has 3 children. He was born in the district of Chokwe in the Gaza province. He has 6 brothers and 3 sisters. Armando lives with his parents. His family moved to Boane when Armando was 3 months old. He attended primary and secondary school there. Later, he studied at IMAP to become a teacher. In 2001 he returned to Boane to work in a primary school in Mahubo. In 2006, he was transferred to the Fish School in Boane.

In 2002, he was married and moved. Later he returned to Boane and decided to continue his father’s business, which had been abandoned. He saved money to buy a lot in the neighborhood 6. Later he tried to buy construction material. He spoke with his father about where to get funds and was directed to Hluvuku-Adsema.

Armando is requesting a loan of 25.000mt. His dream is to build a home for his family and move from his father’s house. He also wants to grow hiss business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao :Bairro 6 Boane, Maputo. Cliente : Armando Rodrigo C. Actividade: Habitação Valor de empréstimo:25.000,00 MT (1.059.00 USS) Aplicação: compra de Materiais de Construção Data Inicio: 05-02-08 Data Fim: 30-05-09

Armando Rodrigo C., de 31 anos de idade e pai de tres filhos, nasceu no distrito de Chokwe. Província de Gaza. Tem 9 irmãos dos quais três são meninas. Filho de pais casados ainda vivos, estando a viver com eles. No seu terceiro mês de idade vem a boane. Começa a estudar na escola primaria de boane sede e o ensino secundário do primeiro ciclo na escola secundaria Joaquim Alberto Chissano. Depois segue pra IMAP de Chibututuine no Distrito da Manhica pra fazer o curso de professores. Em 2001 volta a boane pra começar a trabalhar tendo ele sido escalado na escola primaria de Mahubo onde trabalhou ate 2005. em2006 é transferido pra escola primaria do Fish em Boane.

Começa a viver maritalmente em 2002 estando a viver na casa do serviço e depois volta a Boane pra casa dos seus pais. Na sua estadia em Mahubo alem de dar aulas realizava uma actividade comercial. Na sua vinda a boane resolve ocupar o estabelecimento comercial do pai que estava parado sem gerar nenhum rendimento. Durante algum tempo desenvolvendo a actividade foi juntando alguns valores monetários pra compra de um terreno no bairro 6. dfepois da compra tentou comprar alguns materiais de construcao não estando a consiguir conversa com seu pai a pedir opinião de como devia proseguir pra construir a construir a sua casa, este aconselhou le a aproximar-se a Hluvuku-Adsema pra fazer empréstimo pra pagar pouco a pouco e mensal. Assim sendo aproxima-se pra saber dos requisitos pra aceder o credito e decide meter seu pedido no valor de 25.000,00MT estando por ser financiado.

Tem como seu maior sonho ter sua casa feita pra estar com seus fihlos no seu próprio teto e não estar sub tutela de seu pai, e sua actividade comercial a caminhar na melhor maneira possível.

loans.use: To buy material to build a house

loans.name: Thi Dan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dần, 39 years old, sells scrap metal and does hired laboring. She wishes she can get some loan to buy some piglets. Her family income, that including her three children’s, is 4.50USD a day. She’s never had a loan, now that she is applying for one of 150USD from Binh Minh. Binh Minh does not require members’ credit and has a easy repayment plan.

Translated from Vietnamese by nguN., Kiva volunteer.


Chị Dần, 39 tuổi làm nghề đi chợ sắt vụn và làm thuê. Chị mong muốn vay vốn để chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập hiện tại gia đình chị là 50000-70000 đồng mặc dù đã tính cả thu nhập của ba con chị (đều bỏ học đi làm từ nhỏ). Vì vậy cuộc sống khá vất vả. Chị chưa vay ở đâu vì thủ tục rắc rối, rườm rà. Nhưng khi biết nếu vay theo chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc chị không cần phải thế chấp sổ đỏ thì chị vui lắm và đã vay 2006000 đồng.

loans.use: Buy piglets

loans.name: Soklin

texts.en:
Mrs. Soklin L., 40, and her husband married in 1991. They have three children; two sons and one daughter. All of them are students. The family lives along National Road Number Two which is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Soklin has been a scarf weaver since she was eighteen years old. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to wholesalers in Phnom Penh.  Her husband is a policeman. She hopes that her business can support her children to study at university.

She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cotton for weaving scarves.

loans.use: to purchase cotton for weaving scarves

loans.name: John

texts.en:
M. John is multi trader who sells all kinds of electrical items. He is married and has 2 children. His wife prepares a native food called bunku to sell. Business is doing very well, and he wants to increase sales. He is running out of stock.

He is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more clothing for sale.

loans.use: To buy electronics

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en: Valelia is a very active woman who puts all of her abilities towards her business, because it is her family's major source of income. She decided to her loan partly for business equipment, such as chemicals, fertilizer and a sprayer, and partly for her home repairs and tools, including an axe, bricks, cement, nails and a hammer.

loans.use: To buy farming and home-repair supplies

loans.name: Rokhyatou

texts.fr:
Rokhyatou D., 40, is a widowed mother of six and is the president of the Kaguitte residents’ village bank. She has a lot of experience in her line of work, which consists of buying cloth (for sheets and outfits) and products to dye them and then selling them. She is very energetic and is well-respected within her group. The income she earns allows her to pay her family members’ daily expenses and improve their quality of life. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Rokhyatou D., 40 ans, veuve, 06 enfants en charge est présidente du banc villageois des Ressortissantes de Kaguitte. Elle a une bonne expérience dans son activité qui consiste à acheter des tissus (pour draps et ensembles) et des produits, faire la teinture et vendre. C’est une femme dynamique et très respectée au sein de son groupe. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la dépense familiale et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of cloth and dying products

loans.name: Neretse

texts.en:
Greetings from Rubona in Rwanda! E. is 47 years old and married with 6 children and two adopted orphans of the 1994 Genocide in Rwanda.

In 2001, E. started his business operating a retail shop. He sells beans, clothes, rice, cassava flour, sorghum, bars of soap, paraffin, and other domestic items needed by in the neighborhood. He earns about $125 every month. He is the sole trader in his shop. He is requesting a loan of 510,490 RWF to increase the stock in his shop.

loans.use: Neretse would like to increase his working capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is a member of the Communal Bank of Ccatarisum, which means "let's rise" in quechua.

Elena is married and is 73 years old. She sells food from a market stall in the Magdalena market. Her stall is located on a corner. She prepares breakfasts and lunches for which she has two helpers. She also provides pension services to some people, an activity that she undertakes Sunday to Friday. In addition, Magdalena rents out her home from which she earns a monthly income. Moreover, Magdalena purchases defective items from people who bring them to her house and, after collecting, she sells them to wholesalers.

Elena needs a loan of 1,500 soles which she will invest in the purchase of defects. Elena dreams of starting a new business selling lubricants and that her children have everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisum que significa Levantémonos en quechua.

Elena es casada, tiene 73 años, Elena venD. comida en una puesto del mercado Magdalena, su puesto esta ubicado en una esquina, Elena prepara, desayunos, almuerzos para lo cual cuenta con 2 ayudantes, también da servicio D. pensión a algunas personas, actividad que realiza D. domingo a viernes. Además Magdalena alquila su casa del cual tiene también una renta mensual. También Magdalena compra tara en su casa D. personas que le traen y luego D. acopiar lo venD. a los mayoristas.

Elena necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. tara. Elena sueña con implementar un nuevo negocio D. venta D. lubricantes y que sus hijos tengan todas las comodidades.

loans.use: Elena needs a loan of 1,500 soles which she will invest in the purchase of defective items.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en: Faafetai O. is 52 years old and married with four children.  She has worked in her vegetable garden and sold the vegetables to people in her village for three years, and earns about $200 per week.  Because microfinance is Faafetai's only access to capital, she has taken out and successfully repaid four previous loans.  In order to further expand her business, however, Faafetai is now requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase gardening tools and seeds.

loans.use: To purchase gardening tools and seeds.

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en: Danijela N. is 23 and lives in Sočkovac, a village near Gračanica. She is not married and lives with her parents. Danijela is employed in a local store as saleswoman earning 300 KM monthly. She helps her mother to produce vegetables in her garden for their own use and in her free time she is busy as a tailor. Danijela does repairs in most cases, but she makes also her own creations and sells them to others. She would like to have a better sewing machine and she requests a loan in WWI in the amount of 1000 KM to purchase a new machine and some materials for her creations.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine and materials for tailoring

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive en casa propia en la calle Alberto Ostria de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz;  trabaja  como chofer con su auto durante la noche y su esposa trabaja como empleada en una limpieza, en la misma limpieza donde trabaja la esposa Juan está contratado durante el día  para dejar la ropa en las diferentes agencias y al mismo tiempo recogerlas; por este trabajo percibe un salario de Bs. 600.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar llantas para su taxi y mantener activa su herramienta de trabajo. 

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2004 y su actividad le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan owns his own home on Alberto Ostria street in the area of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. He works as a chauffeur with his care at night, and his wife works in a dry-cleaning business. This same dry-cleaners hires Juan to deliver and collect clothing to and from the various agencies around town. Juan earns a salary of Bs. 600 from this job. The loan that Juan is requesting will be used to purchase tires for his taxi, and to maintain it. Juan has been working with Impro since 2004, and his job permits him to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheels for a taxi

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is married and has 3 children. She has received no formal education. Cecilia sells food stuffs like plantain, banana, oranges, and others at Atonkwa near Elmina. She has been in business since 1998. Cecilia uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

Cecilia will use the loan to purchase additional capital to buy more food for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to invest towards educating her children.

loans.use: Cecilia will use the loan to purchase additional capital to buy more food stuffs for resale.

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hà Thị N., 35 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 1998 .Gia đình chị có 2 con còn đang đi học. Thu nhập chính của gia đình phụ thuộc vào công việc đi xe ôm của chồng và công việc bán hàng đồ nhựa của chị. Với sự giúp đỡ của chị em trong Cụm và sự nỗ lực của bản thân đến nay  sau 10 năm tham gia Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị Lệ rất ổn định với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn 15.000.000 để đầu tư mua thêm hàng hóa về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ha Thi N. is 35 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 1998. She has two children who are in school. Her main source of income comes from her husband's earning as a motorbike cabbie (instead of a car, motorbike cabbies take passengers on motorbikes for a fee) and her retail business of selling plastic goods. With hard work and the help of other members in her loan group, after 10 years, her family's economy has become stable with the income of 2,500,000 per month. She would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in her retail business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ThienN. Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two grown children. Today she runs a small business selling baked goods and confectionery in a small store. Her business boasts a wide assortment of fresh inventory at reasonable prices. Oksana has been in this trade for 3 years. Her working capital amounts to 60,000 UAH. She makes about 5,000 UAH on the goods she sells every month.

Oksana works long hours to keep her business sustainable and growing. She is a friendly vendor and loves owning her business. Oksana’s customers are always satisfied with the quality of the products she sells in her little store. She manages to keep fresh groceries even when the heat is at its worst and food products can easily spoil. Oksana is requesting a loan of 5,000 UAH to diversify the merchandise in her store. She believes that a more varied inventory will be more of an attraction for her customers and will increase her business income. We think that her natural ability to cheer people up with a word of encouragement or a smile will also help attract potential new clients and boost her sales as a result. One of the long-term plans Oksana and her husband have is to start a second business selling construction supplies in their home town of Kamenka.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Juana Elsa

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Juana es conviviente tiene 36 años, tres hijos de 18 y 8, que están estudiando, y un último hijo de tres años.
Hace diez años se le presento la oportunidad de comprar un  puesto en el mercado, en la sección de carnes,  con los ahorros que tenia lo adquirió, ella vende carne de res, carnicería JHOANNA,  diario vende 20 kilos de carne.    
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de mercadería, mondongo, hígado, bofe.
Desde que está en Finca ha podido invertir más, su economía ha mejorado, su puesto era rustico lo ha mejorado, y se ha podido comprar dos puestos más, y  una maquina exhibidora.
El sueño de Juna es  comprarse una cámara frigorífica y una cortadora de carne.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Community Bank, "Avancemos Juntas" ["We Make Progress Together"]. Juana is a common law wife and is 36 years old. She has three children; two that are studying and are 18 and 8, and one that is 3. Ten years ago, Juana had the opportunity to buy a stand in the market in the meat section. With the savings that she had, she acquired the stand. She sells ground beef at Jhoanna's Butcher Shop and sells 20 kilos of meat daily. Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy merchandise, tripe, liver, and lungs. Since she became a member of Finca, she has been able to invest more and her business has improved. Her stand was rustic and has improved, and she has been able to buy more stands and a display machine. Juana's dream is to buy a refrigerator and a meat slicer.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, tripe, liver, and lung

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is 38 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has four children and her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Mary hopes to be able to continue to pay school fees for her children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is 59 years old with 4 children.  She is married to a farmer and they work together for a good living.  From Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur, she and her husband manage their selling business, which they started from a small capital.  Virginia personally handless the store where their potential customers are their neighbors.  Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing. 

She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 9,000.00 for the purchase of additional inventories to sell.  As much as possible, they have to have all the needed stocks for a good income. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well

loans.use: Expansion

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 38-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Abdallah has owned a bakery since 2003. He makes “mankoucheh.” A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza and the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Abdallah requested a loan of $1,300 from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. Abdallah has been a micro-credit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Abdallah decided on doing his business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on expanding his shop.

loans.use: Abdallah will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
"I am a tenant. Most of our harvest go to the owner of the farm that we are tilling. I am married and have four children. Two of my children were already married. Only one is working and one is still studying," shared Lilia D. C., a 46-year old CEVI client of three years.

She is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 20 liters of diesel and four sacks of fertilizers. She thinks that this will improve their harvest and she will then be able to buy their own farm.

CEVI gives their clients not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 20 liters of diesel and four sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married and has seven children. Her sole activity for this loan will be to buy and sell “dry fish” in the market in Baingo. Here, dry fish is used in many dishes as it is ground up and added in for flavor and protein. Helen will buy 100,000 CFA (about $200) worth of dry fish and use the remaining money to transport it.  

This being nothing new to Helen, she is confident she will be successful with this loan. She knows that the fish always sells in the market due to the high demand for it. This will be Helen’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2008.

In the last three years, Helen has lost three of her children. Although saddened by this unfortunate circumstance, Helen still has to take care of her other children. She plans to use the profits from this loan to pay for food for the family, pay her children’s school fees and increase her business. 

Helen takes out GHAPE loans because the loan conditions are right for her, as she pays back her loan in small installments, instead of all at once. She also benefits from the training on loan management.  

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Dry fish and transport

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., 40, is married and lives with five of her children in the Batambong province. She grows and sells vegetables, making US$5 every day. Her husband runs a moto-taxi making approximately US$3 each day. They are also supported by two of their children who are employed. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation struggles have affected all Cambodians. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, Seng S. included. The country’s economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country’s economic difficulties, Seng S. is seeking to increase her income and reduce her transportation cost. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Weleto

texts.en:
With only Php 3,000.00 starting capital, 48-year-old Weleto C. opened a small store in their area in 2006. His previous livelihood was farming. Although he was happy being a farmer before, he shifted to having a store in order to have an income that will meet the daily needs of the family. He wants to send their only child to school. 

Weleto is an active member of the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), a growing microfinance institution in the Philippines. He is impressed with CEVI’s programs and the variety of services they’re offering to their clients. He is applying for this loan to be used as additional capital for his store. He is also blessed by the institution’s Biblical integration.

loans.use: Additional supplies

loans.name: Cidalia Antonio

texts.pt:
Cidalia Antonio N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 40 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 5 e 14 anos. Estudou ate 6 classe na escola secundaria de Tsalala tendo parado por causa da guerra civil que terminou no ano de 1992. Vive com o seu esposo na casa própria que trabalha para o governo na área de imobiliária.
Casou se há 21 anos e há seis anos começou a fazer o actual negocio (venda de produtos de primeira necessidade).

Vende mais peixe que compra na cidade de Maputo (desloca cerca de 9 km) uma caixa custa 1.050,00MT e vende a 1.500,00MT, consegue uma receita diária no valor de 400,00MT. Algumas vezes tem poupado através de um esquema tradicional de poupança composta por um grupo de cerca de 10 senhoras homologas. Não tem mais pessoas sob sua responsabilidade.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e este é o seu quarto credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de produtos de primeira necessidade. Os primeiros empréstimos foram todos para o comercio, 5.500,00MT; 6.500,00MT e 6.000,00MT, respectivamente.

Conheceu a hluvuku através de sua vizinha, também cliente da mesma instituição. 
Espera ver o seu negocio sempre a crescer e com mais receitas passara a depositar o dinheiro no banco, numa conta por abrir brevemente.

Propõe se a pagar bem o seu credito para poder aceder a mais empréstimos e cumprir o sonho de construir um estabelecimento comercial com material convencional.
texts.en:
Cidalia Antonio N. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children with ages between 5 and 14 years old. She went to school through the 6th grade at the secondary school of Tsalala. She stopped because of the civil war that ended in 1992. She lives with her spouse in their own home, and she works for the government in the real estate area. She was married 21 years ago, and 6 years ago she began her business (selling products of primary necessity). She sells a lot of fish which she buys in the city of Maputo (about 9km away) for 1,050MT per box and sells for 1,500MT. She is able to earn 400MT daily. Some times she has been able to save through a traditional savings schedule composed of a group of about 10 ladies. She is not responsible for any more people. She has never had a loan through other institutions, and this is her 4th loan with Hluvuku-Adsema in the amount of 10,000MT. She will use it to buy products of primary necessity. The first loans were all used for the business, 5,500MT, 6,500MT, and 6,000MT respectively. She came to know Hluvuku through her neighbor who is also a client. She hopes to see her business continually grow and deposit the increased receipts in the bank, in an account she will open soon. She plans on paying back her loan to be able to access more loans to fulfill her dream of constructing a commercial establishment with conventional materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products of primary necessity

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes A. is a 57-year-old mother of six children, with the eldest age 33 years old. Mercedes started with one sow in 2007 and after some months it produced 8 piglets for fattening. Her daughter also bought a half-hectare rice field but due to the pest attack they only got a net income of PHP 18,000. 

Mercedes is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to help finance the needs of her piggery like buying feed and constructing a barn.

She joined CEVI last October 2007. She likes CEVI because she believes they offer nice services, a small interest rate, insurance and savings.

loans.use: To finance the needs of her piggery.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
El Señor Andrés B. es casado con 4 hijos, domiciliado en la ciudad de Caacupé del Barrio San Francisco.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         Don Andrés fue empleado de una chipería, con un pequeño ahorro y un crédito recibido de fundación paraguaya emprendió su propia chipería. La chipa es una comida típica hecha de almidón, grasa animal, huevos y queso.
 Gracias a la buena atención y a la calidad de sus productos hoy día tiene clientela formada. Don Andrés elabora en su domicilio y lleva sus productos en la capital, ofrece sus deliciosas chipas frente a un concurrido Hospital.
 El cliente comenta que sus ingresos son muy buenas y sus ventas cada día aumenta y por ende sus ingresos. Don Andrés agradece a fundación paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo constante que les brinda para fortalecer su microempresa y a la vez espera recibir siempre tan valioso apoyo.
El crédito que solicita es para compra de insumos para chipas: almidón, queso, grasa de cerdo, leche, huevo entre otros.

loans.use: Para la compra de almidón, leche, queso, grasa de cerdo.

loans.name: Women We Trust Group

texts.en:
Women We Trust is a group of 4 borrowers led by Kpana F.. Kpana is a 48-year-old woman who is married, with five children. Her children aged 5-20 years old, and their educational levels from 1st-10th grade. Kpana also cares for two siblings.

Kpana did not have an education because during the early 1960`s the people of Lofa County, where Kpana migrated from, did not believe in educating women. The people believed that men should be responsible for every expense in the home. 

Kpana lives and sells in the Lakpazee community, South of down town Monrovia, Liberia. It is a community that is like a slum, and the rate of poverty is very high. An entire family lives on $2.00 US a day. 

Kpana’s business is buying palm oil in gallons, and sells in bottles to residents of Southern Monrovia, Liberia. Kpana started this business with one gallon of palm oil, but she was serious and  was focused, She now buys eight gallons, and she has been running her business for 20 years. Kpana sells high quality oil, and because of that, her customers do not buy from other vendors.

Kpana caters to the needs of her family from this little busines Therefore, she needs this loan to purchase a barrel of palm oil, so as to serve her customers in Lakpazee. Kpana hopes to establish a large shop were she can supply other vendors. She dreams of being a successful business woman.

loans.use: To purchase a barrel of palm oil so as to serve customers

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal R., age 28 (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Ravy Phork, age 29, have been married since 1999. They have three daughters: Two sons are in school and other one stays at home. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number one about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophal and her husband have been farming for 10 years. They do not have enough capital to use on their farm, so Sophal is requesting her firs loan of $300 to help her capital.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda C. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years-old and married with six adult children. Rosalinda owns and operates a business making and selling chicharon (crackling) in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosalinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S., 62, has been a silk weaver for over 47 year. She has been married Mr. Oeun Kim, 62, since 1973. They have six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, while two sons are in school and one daughter is also a silk weaver. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Saroeun is requesting her second loan of $150 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Genaro Carlos

texts.es: El sr. Carlos es un cliente muy antiguo de la agencia, trabaja con nosotros desde el año 2005, cancelando siempre sus pagos puntualmente. Se dedica a la confección de chamarras, buzos deportivos y chalecos para niños y adultos, lleva ya 11 años en este rubro; tiene también un minibús pequeño con el cual trabaja por la mañana muy temprano y por la tarde casi al anochecer, su esposa viaja a distintos departamentos, como Potosi y Oruro, llevando la mercadería de su esposo, ambos se apoyan mutuamente. Sus hijos le ayudan a costurar y también estudian. El crédito será invertido en la compra de telas para la confección de busos para niños para las fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos is an old client of the agency, he has worked with us since 2005 and always repays his loans promptly. Carlos makes jackets, sport suits and vests for adults and children. He has been in this line of work for 11 years. He also has a minibus with which he works in the early morning as well as in the evening towards nightfall. His wife travels to different departments like Potosi and Oruro, selling her husband’s merchandise, they support each other. His children help him with the sewing and they are also studying. The loan will be invested in the buying of fabrics for children’s sport suits for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn S., 29, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children.

Chorn S. is involved in the business of selling various kinds of soft drinks and clothes, earning a gross income of US$20 per day. The family is also assisted mainly by her husband who is employed as an APSARA authority, the person who looks after the security of the temples and the environment. These sources of incomes help cover the family expenses. He also produces palm sugar for sale. He is able to earn an income of US$5 per day.

S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase souvenirs for selling to the tourists who visit Angkor Wat Temple. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy souvenirs for selling to the tourists

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham N., 49, is a widow and lives with one school-aged-child in Battambong town, Cambodia. N. is engaged in weaving Cambodian traditional mats made from grass. She also grows rice and sells vegetables and groceries. She is able to earn an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family’s expenses. N. and her family members try to work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, N. is requesting a loan of US $700 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase seeds for rice and vegetables to expand her rice and vegetable productions. This is her second loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To purchase rice and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: K. Samuel is a businessman of forty-one years old, married with four children. He owns a drug shop; he has been operating this drug shop for over two years. He is using the loan to purchase drugs in variety. He is purchasing different medicines to cater for customers' needs. His future plan is opening up a clinic to cater for patients.

loans.use: To purchase drugs in variety

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk

loans.name: Ramoni

texts.en:
Ramoni is a business man. He is married with two children. His eldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is 7 years old. His children attend school and this makes him happy. To support her husband, Ramoni’s wife is a teacher.

Ramoni sells drinks and juice at wholesale and retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because he does not sell on credit and so he does not incur debt in his business. He hopes to own a juice company in the future. He would like a loan for NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Theavy Hun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Theavy H. is a 35 year-old married woman who lives in Boeng Leach village in Takeo province. She is a village bank president for a group loan which consists of 14 people and is offered by Kiva partner AMK. The members of the loan will use it to support a variety of purposes. 

Mrs. Theavy H. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. C. Sopheap Phin, is a laborer who earns a small salary to support the family. Although they try to work hard with their different businesses they still earn insufficient income to improve their lifestyle. Therefore, Mrs. Theavy H. is asking for a loan to purchase chickens and ducks for breeding. This couple has two children who are both attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Adelaida's Group

texts.en:
Adelaida D. is from the village of Punta Miray, Baliangao. She is 45 years old. Adeleida is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Adelaida is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living Adelaida harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Adelaida joined PMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Adelaida is requesting her 11th loan from PMPC, for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase a fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 


Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is divorced with six dependents. She has received junior high education. 

Ama sells garden eggs (eggplant) at Jukwa. She goes to the nearby villages to buy in bulk and puts the garden eggs in sacks to sell in the market. She uses the income she gets from the sale of garden eggs to provide food, clothing and shelter for her dependents.

Ama will use the loan to purchase extra garden eggs and slippers which are going to be an additional trade to invest in. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more garden eggs and slippers to sell

loans.name: David Maina

texts.en: David, age 22, is single and lives in the Gitiha area, a Nairobi suburb. David farms in a cold and wet highland in central Kenya and Githurai town. He sells the produce in Githurai market. Githurai is a densely populated area with average income earners. David has been in this business for the last three years. With this loan, he intends to buy seedlings for kale and spinach as well as manure and fertilizer for farming. He has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, he hopes to develop his farming business and start other businesses like selling T-shirts in the nearby markets.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for kale and spinach as well as manure and fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Marina es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Marina vende quesos de manera ambulatoria en los mercados, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes. Además Marina se dedica a la siembra de papa que vende en la ciudad de Lima y Ayacucho.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Marina son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Faith Community Bank. She lives with a man, is 37 years old and has four children. She sells cheese as a roving salesperson in the market. She does this job every afternoon. She also grows potatoes that she sells in Lima and Ayacucho. Marina needs a loan of 600 soles, money that she will use to buy cheese. Marina future dreams include improving her business. She also hopes her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy cheese.

loans.name: Hilda Fidelia

texts.es: Hilda es casada, tiene 58 años y 3 hijos que ya son profesionales y vive con una hija, Hilda tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza hace muchos años. Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal hace 15 años aproximadamente y en todo este tiempo obtuvo varios prestamos que le ayudaron en su negocio, además que le incentivaron al ahorro. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y leche. Hilda desea tener mas capital para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Hilda, 58, is married and has three children who are all professionals; she lives with a daughter. Hilda has a grocery store in her home where she sells general merchandise; she has been in this line of work for many years. Hilda has been a member of the communal bank for about 15 years and has gotten several loans during this time that helped her business and motivated her to save. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar and milk. Hilda hopes to have more capital to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: El solicitante se dedica a la actividad de venta de carne para el camal de Ica, comprando toros e invernando 60 a 90 dias, vende leche a la empresa de lacteos gloria encargandose su esposa netamente del recojo y venta. Solicita financiamiento para compra de alimentos para su ganado.
texts.en:
Carlos makes a living selling meat for the Ica slaughterhouse. He buys cattle and keeps them for two to three months. He sells milk to the dairy company. His wife, Gloria, is in charge of the pickup and sale. He is requesting the loan to purchase feed for his cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for his cattle

loans.name: Tiessiri 1 Group

texts.fr:
