TIESSIRI 1  est un groupe  de femmes mariées du village de NITOLOSSO dans le la préfecture de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, 4 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
SALIMATA D. espère utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants,  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe  comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Tiessiri 1 is a group of married women from the village of Nitolosso in San prefecture, Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional extended families. On average, they are 30 and have four children, and they grow peanuts. Looking to make their farming more profitable, the members of the group decided to join the loan institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After paying off previous loans, they are now asking for their third seasonal loan, Salimata D. plans to use her loan to buy as many peanut seeds as she needs, plus small tools and fertilizer. at the big market in Kimparana. . After the rainy season, she warehouses her harvest long enough for its value to increase, before selling it at the big market in Kimparana. and other nearby markets, retail (or often wholesale) for cash to customers who mostly come from big towns. After their produce is sold, the members of the group hope to make a profit of 35,000 FCFA each to pay the interest on the loan and ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seeds and tools.

loans.name: Wayna Ccapac Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “WAYNA CCAPAC”; La  socia vive en la provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Yessica, tiene 28 años D. edad y es madre soltera, ella tiene una pequeña botica, la socia estudió farmacia en la universidad y con mucho esfuerzo pudo reunir un capital para abrir su botica, ella venD. todo tipo D. productos relacionados a la salud; tiene 1 año con este su negocio y le está yendo muy bien, el papá D. su hijo trabaja en la municipalidad D. Maras y le envía dinero para que su pequeño pueda tener su alimentación diaria, la socia sueña con agrandar su negocio y por esta razón ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería (medicamentos) a cuenta ella pagará una primera inicial que poco a poco irá pagando. 

Los otros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como venta D. productos secos, mozos en restaurantes, crianza D. animales, los mismos que son vendidos a los mercados, tienda D. abarrotes.
 
Los socios valoran y agradecen infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este les permite crecer con sus negocios y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “WAYNA CCAPAC” communal bank. She lives in Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. Her name is Yessica, and she is 28 years old and a single mother. She runs a small pharmacy; she studied pharmacy at the university, and with much effort, she was able to assemble enough capital to open her pharmacy. She sells all types of health-related products. She has operated this business for 1 year, and it is going very well for her. The father of her child works in the municipality of Maras, and he sends her money for the little one's daily sustenance. Yessica dreams of expanding her business, and for this reason she is requesting the loan, so that she can buy merchandise (medicines) on credit; she will make an initial deposit and gradually pay off the rest. The other group members pursue a range of activities, such as selling dry goods, working as a waiter in a restaurant, raising animals to sell in the market, or operating a grocery store. The members infinitely value and appreciate the loan granted to them, since it will allow them to expand their businesses and improve their quality of life; accordingly, they are committed to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise (medicines)

loans.name: George Ngigi

texts.en:
George has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for thirteen years.  He is 35 years old, married to Eunice Wangeci, and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 2nd loan.  He paid his first loan of 40,000 KES well and on time.  He wants to use the funds from this loan to buy more clothes to sell.  

George plans to move to a more permanent place from which to sell his clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Loy

texts.en:
Loy N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children. Two of her children are currently in school. Loy has been running a tailoring business for the past 2 years.          

To help expand her business, Loy has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials like cloth for sewing. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Loy hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a tailoring school. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her to become a good leader and learning how to be confident. 

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills. Afterwards, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses. These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: B. est âgée de 32 ans et vit avec son époux dans le quartier de gblinkomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle fait comme activité le commerce de charbons de bois et autres. elle a une ancienneté de plus de 10 ans dans ce commerce. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans les villes de Kanté et adjingré. son stock est en baisse, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de d'une trentaine de sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Mrs. B. is 32 years old and lives with her husband in the Gblinkomé neighborhood, which is one of Lomé's outer neighborhoods. She sells various kinds of charcoal. She has more than 10 years of experience in this trade. She buys her stock from within the country in the cities of Kanté and Adjingré. Her stock is low, and she would like to buy more. She is requesting a loan through WAGES so she can buy approximately 30 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok C. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She sells jewelry (jewelry that is not real) at the market and also works as a nail decorator. On average, she is able to make about $4 of profit a day, while her husband (pictured here) is a construction foreman and makes $6 a day. 

Sok C. is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap D. (pictured here), and her husband, Mr. Cheng-ean Hean, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1984 and have seven children: two sons and five daughters. Both sons are construction workers, one daughter is a garment factory worker, three attend school and the other one is still very young.

Sopheap has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a farmer and raises cows at home.

Sopheap has been working in the silk weaving business for long time, so she doesn’t want to change to another business. She has asked for a Kiva loan several times. She is now requesting another loan of $1,000 to continue her weaving business by purchasing silk materials. She will use part of the loan towards capital for her husband’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials

loans.name: Modesto Efrain

texts.es:
Modesto  de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa quien se encarga de cuidar a su niña de 8 meses y de los quehaceres del hogar; el Sr. B. F.  labora como conductor desde hace 6 años para el ceta INATEC en la colonia Yolaina a 15 km de Nueva Guinea, ademas es taxista en el turno de la noche, sabado y Domingo; ya que en INATEC trabaja de lunes a viernes, por lo que cuenta con estos otros ingresos.  

Este prestamo lo requiere para construir una habitación  y asi tener mejor comodidad  en el hogar. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener estabilidad laboral y darle lo mejor a su familia y mejorar poco a poco su vivienda para lograr mayor comodidad de vida.
texts.en:
Modesto is 33 years old and married. His wife is in charge of looking after their eight month old daughter and handling the household chores. Sr. Modesto has worked the past six years as a driver for INATEC (the National Technological Institute) in the district of Yolaina, which 15 kilometers outside of Nueva Guinea. In addition he works as a taxi driver at night and on Saturdays and Sundays. He works for INATEC from Monday to Friday, so he needs the additional income.

This loan will be used to build a room so that his home will be more comfortable. His greatest wish in life is to have job stability, provide the best for his family, and gradually improve his home so that they will be more comfortable.

loans.use: Add a room to his house

loans.name: Sok-Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok-heang K. (in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Porn Khut, have been married since 1981 and have nine children--four sons and five daughters. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sok-heang and her husband are rice and vegetable farmers. When she is not at the farm, she also supplements her income with a new business selling fish to earn additional income to support her family. 

Sok-heang hopes to buy more fish for resale, so she is requesting her second loan of US$ 300.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en:
Franciscah is a 58-year-old business woman who runs a cafeteria and a grocery shop.  She is able to employ two people in her business.  She has been running her business for five years and she hopes to own a restaurant in the future.  

With the loan of 20, 000 KES, she will buy ingredients such as maize flour, maize, cooking fat, beans, sugar and firewood.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as maize flour, maize, cooking fat, beans, sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.en:
K. Muslima is 35 years-old. She is married with two children. For three years she has been working in a beauty salon. In the salon, she provides various services such as hair styling and cutting, manicures and the services of a cosmetologist. Her business is successful and generates a stable income for her family. Now Muslima is planning to purchase cosmetics and other accessories for her beauty salon.  For this purpose she is requesting a loan of 7500 Somoni. Muslima thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum S. earns her living by cultivating rice  as well as raising a few pigs for extra income in order to meet her family's daily expenses. She and her husband work all together in their farming business. They have three children, and all of them are single and still living under their roof. In the past, she and her husband always traveled anywhere by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Prum S. has requested a loan in the amount of $700 to  buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi

loans.name: Am

texts.en:
Am S. A., 35, has a business running a moto-taxi in the Takeo province. He has been operating this business since 2008 and is able to make about $5 of profit each day. His wife sells groceries at home, typically making $2 per day. 

This couple has five young children; two are in school and three are too young to attend. 

To earn more, Am S. A. will purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning a profit. He is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase his income and raise his family’s standard of living. 

Am S. A. is pictured with his wife and his youngest daughter at home.

loans.use: To purchase rice to resell

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.fr: Sylvestre H. est aide technicien et travailleur de construction, et il est client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il est né à Kigali, marie, et il a 6 enfants.  Il a une éducation primaire, et 3 de ses enfants vont a l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des tôles, sables, et ciments pour la construction des maisons.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de continuer à construire pour avoir des maisons à louer.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Sylvestre H. is a technician's aide and a construction worker. He is has been a client of ACB (Kiva Field Partner) since 2007. He was born in Kigali, he is married, and he has 6 children. He has a primary school education, and 3 of his children attend school. He will use his loan to purchase tiles, sand, and cement used to build houses. His strategy to expand his business is to keep building in order to build houses destined for rental. As for his family, he would like to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase tiling, sand, and cement.

loans.name: Philipina

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Philipina is a married mother of 5 school-aged children, who are all attending school. She is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya.  She has been in the farming business for 15 years and produces eggs, bananas, and milk, which are all sold locally.

She has requested a loan for 60,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry farm. The extra income from this loan investment will help her pay school fees for her children. She would like to have more than 3,000 chickens in the next five years.  In her business, she faces the challenge of diseases,  which affects her production.

loans.use: To expand poultry farm

loans.name: Camlita

texts.en:
Camlita is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a food vending business for the past seven years, her potential customers are neighbours and passerby. In addition she has real estate houses which contributes to her other source of income. She hopes to expand and build a permanent stall in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Edith has a small restaurant that sells cooked food, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Edith has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to stock more food to cook for sale.   With the help of the loan from BRAC, Edith hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Edith hopes to open another branch of her restaurant. Edith is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to be hard-working so as to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase more raw food to stock for resale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is 35 years old, married, with four children.  She does dairy farming for a living.  She has been farming for the past four years.  She also does crop farming together with her husband.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has managed to educate her children because her business has improved.  She hopes to become a prosperous farmer in the future.  She has requested 30,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Guiselle

texts.es:
Guíselle B. C. es una joven artista vecina de Puerto Jimenez Puntarenas.
Ella es conocida por sus hermosas pinturas que vende a los turistas que visitan la zona. Además de eso ella fue invitada a participar de diferentes galerías Internacionales en Italia.
Guiselle necesita un préstamo  de    ₡594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para la compra  de lienzo, pinceles, pinturas y demás herramientas que ella necesita para realizar su trabajo. Ella también  esta en la universidad, y necesita mejorar su negocio para pagarse la universidad. 
Ella forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Raíces Capitales una de las  110 organizaciones socias de EDESA
texts.en:
Guíselle B. C. is a young artist who lives in Puerto Jimenez Puntarenas.

She is known for her beautiful paintings which she sells to the tourists who visit the area.  She also has been invited to participate in different international galleries in Italy.

Guíselle needs a loan in the amount of 594,000 CRC to buy canvas, brushes, paint and other utensils for her job.  She is also studying at the university and needs to improve her business in order to pay for tuition.

She is a member of the "Raíces Capitales" communal bank which is one of the 110 organizations belonging to EDESA.

loans.use: To buy painting utensils

loans.name: Aníbal

texts.es:
El señor Aníbal de 55 años de edad, es soltero, y cuenta con un taller propio de chapería y pintura en su casa, es uno de los pioneros de la ciudad reconocido por su buen servicio y cuenta con clientes de toda la zona.
El empezó trabajando para terceros, luego de mucho esfuerzo se independizo y hace mas de 25 años trabaja por su  cuenta realizando todo tipo de trabajos de chapería y pintura de automotores, ya sea chocados o trabajos de retoque.
Por los años de trabajo constantemente necesita renovar sus herramientas laborales, a eso obedece el pedido de la ayuda crediticia a la  Fundación  Paraguaya, necesita una nueva soldadora pues de esa manera no fallará con sus exigentes clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Aníbal is 55 years old, single, and manages an auto paint and body shop in his home. He is one of the pioneers of the city and is known for providing good service. His customers come from every area.

Aníbal started working for other people, but after much effort he later became independent. He has performed all types of paint and body work on automobiles for more than 25 years. Aníbal repairs vehicles that have been in accidents or are in need of retouching.

After years of constantly working, he needs to replace the equipment he uses for his job. For this reason, he is requesting assistance by accessing a loan through Fundación Paraguaya. He needs a new soldering machine so that he can complete the work for his existing customers.

loans.use: To purchase a soldering machine.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca R., 62, is a married woman from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has two children aged 34 and 27.

Francisca has been in the business of raising hogs for 12 years. Each month, Francisca earns 3,500 PHP by doing the hog-raising business. Francisca works hard to improve her income. 

In the future, Francisca hopes for her business to be stable.

She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Magaly de 21 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Magaly, es una mujer muy laboriosa, con su arduo trabajo trata de sobresalir. Ella es comerciante tiene un puesto de ventas en el mercado, ubicado en su comunidad. Su tienda es muy concurrida por sus compradores, y esta abierta a partir de las 06 de la mañana y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar los productos indicados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes  ya que es una de sus estrategias que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores, lleva 03 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el tiempo piensa invertir sus ganancias en otro tipo de negocio e incursionarse en la venta de ropa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho con el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesta a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más víveres para su negocio y así abastecerse de mercadería.
texts.en: Magaly, who is 21 years old, is a happy and hardworking single, young woman with a desire to be successful in life.  She lives at home with her parents, and her greatest desire to earn better wages in order to provide financial stability to her future family.  Magaly is a very hardworking woman; she strives to excel in her arduous work.  She is a shopkeeper with a sales post in her community market.  Her store is very busy with shoppers who know that Magaly has a variety of merchandise in her store.  They don't hesitate in purchasing from her because they have the security of knowing that in Magaly's store, they are going to find the products they are looking for.  What Magaly likes most about her work is conversing with her customers.  In fact, it's one of the strategies she employs to earn more costumers.  Magaly has been in this business for 3 years, and she feels that the hardest part is staying on her feet all day.  With time, she plans to invest her earnings in another type of business and enter into clothing sales. This is Magaly's first loan with MFP.  She feels that this investment will greatly help the progress of her work, and she is prepared to punctually comply with her repayment schedule.  With the requested loan, Magaly will purchase more supplies for her business and stock up on merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase more products to stock up her store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is 46 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business in the local community.Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Josefina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials for her furniture making business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Josefina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her  furniture making business

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie  was born in 1958. She has eight children who are aged 15-30 years. Five of them are in school while the other three have accomplished school. Her husband is a farmer.

Pelagie sells sorghum and this business has enabled her to feed her family with no difficulties. She has done this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and make a locally produced non-alcoholic drink called "ubushera". She plans to renovate her house with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy sorghum to make a non-alcoholic drink called "ubushera".

loans.name: Kafa

texts.en:
Kafa is a 51-year-old mother, and as she is a conservative woman her husband Mustafa appears in the photograph in her place. Kafa has two daughters and one son. Her children are college students. Kafa's husband is a worker in a tailoring workshop and responsible for the family expenses. 

Kafa's daughter is a brilliant student: she graduated with A+ grades from her BA program. Kafa's daughter Majeda wants to start an MA program but the family doesn't have the tuition fees, therefore Kafa took out a loan from FATEN to pay them. 

kafa's daughter hopes to finish school and start working to help her father take care of the family.

loans.use: To pay master's program tuition fees for her eldest daughter

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Monica has a retail shop that sells prepaid phone credits, also known as electronic loads, for different networks, such as Globe and Smart. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional prepaid phone credits to sell.

Monica is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Monica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid phone credits to sell

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Desde los 14 años Gloria aprendió de su madre el arte de confeccionar y cuando creció compra dos maquinas para empezar a trabajar como maquiladora.

Ella con su trabajo ha podido darle estudio y darles una buena vida a sus 7 hijos y a ella como tal, ya que ha podido también estudiar.

Gloria quiere comprar una maquina plana que le permita generar un empleo además de poder incrementar su producción y poderle entregar a los clientes cumplidamente.
texts.en:
Gloria learned to sew from her mother when she was 14.  When she grew up she bought two machines to begin working as a manufacturer.

Through her work she’s been able to give herself and her children a good life and pay for their education.  She has also been able to go to school.

Gloria wants to buy a sewing machine that will help her win work, be able to increase her production, and be able to deliver to her customers on time.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Herbert Mauricio

texts.es:
Herbert, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 4 años de edad, son dependientes directamente de él. Herbert tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura inicio el negocio hace 12 años, aprendió trabajando en otros talleres, y decidió instalar su propio taller trabajando de lunes a sábado.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales como lijas y pintura de diferentes colores, este préstamo le ayudara para que su taller cuente con  lo necesario para realizar las reparaciones y modificaciones en los vehículos de los clientes.
El sueño de Herbert es que sus dos hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar y cuando estén grandes puedan accesar a la universidad y culminar una carrera.
texts.en:
Herbert lives with his family; he has two children who are 7 and 4 years old that depend directly on him.  Herbert has an auto body and paint shop, a business he started 12 years ago having learned the trade working in other shops, eventually deciding to open his own shop.  He works Monday through Saturday.

At present, he’s asking for a loan to buy supplies like sandpaper and paint in assorted colors.  This loan will help him so that his shop will have all that’s needed to do repairs and modifications to his customers’ cars.

Herbert’s dream is that his two children will have the opportunity to go to school and that when they are older that they will be able to go to university and finish a career.

loans.use: to buy sandpaper and paint in assorted colors.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 47 years old and married with 3 children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane.

Rosalie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es: Jimmy, de 32 años vive en casa propia junto a su pareja con quien aun no tiene hijos ya que espera poder consolidarse en su economía para poder recién empezar a pensar en ello.El trabajo de Jimmy es el de salir a las calles de la ciudad en busca de los pasajeros con necesidad de movilizarse ya que el realiza el transporte de pasajeros, lleva con este trabajo ya casi 10 años, con los años pudo comprarse una unidad propia ya que antes solo trabajaba en uno que lo tenia en alquiler.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre tiene disponibilidad de su tiempo, además de poder realizar algunas otras actividades junto a su pareja ya que juntos también están en el negocio de la venta de ropa que les envían desde Lima para vender entre sus vecinos y amigos, Espera poder mas adelante comprarse una mototaxi mas ya que quisiera ampliar su flota.Este es el tercer préstamo entre Jimmy y la institución, Esta contento con el grupo que tiene ya que todos son muy responsables, espera poder seguir trabajando con la institución ya que se siente bien trabajando con interés tan bajos.Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, Jimmy comprara algunas piezas para su unidad móvil.
texts.en:
Jimmy, 32, lives in his own house with his partner; they don’t have any children yet because he wants to become established economically before starting to think about that.  Jimmy’s work consists in going out into the streets looking for passengers who need to be transported because he provides passenger transportation service.   He’s been in this business for almost 10 years.  As years passed he was able to buy a vehicle because prior to that he worked with a leased one.  What he enjoys about his work is always having time available to carry out other activities since he and his partner also are in the business of selling clothes that they are sent from the city of Lima to sell among their friends and neighbors.  He hopes later on to be able to buy himself an additional mototaxi because he’d like to expand his fleet.

This is Jimmy’s third loan with the institution.  He’s happy with the group he has because they are all very responsible.  He hopes to continue working with the institution because he feels good working with such low interest rates.  He will use the requested 2000 soles to buy some replacement parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy some parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is 37 years old and married with 2 children, 1 of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Dolores runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 25,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy additional items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store. Dolores has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, spices, etc. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Özlem

texts.en:
Özlem, married and working as a chef for two years, was previously a housewife who was struggling financially. A very ambitious and consistent woman, she decided to learn how to cook and bake from his husband.

Ozlem is now requesting a loan from Maya to take a cooking course to improve her culinary skills. She will then be a master cook, in demand by many restaurants. Ozlem's future plan is to open her own bakery in order to support her family financially. Her family is of paramount importance in her life, and all of her efforts are directed toward supplying them, especially her children, with a good life.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Özlem Hanım evli ve iki yıldır şef olarak çalışıyor. Bu işe başlamadan önce ev hanımıydı ve maddi sorunlar yaşıyordu. Bu yüzden, yemek ve pasta ustası olan eşimden işi öğrenmeye kara verdim ve başladım. Maya'dan aldığım kredi ile kurslara ve seminerlere katılarak, kendimi daha fazla geliştirmek istiyorum. Maya'dan almış olduğum kredi, ustalığımda ilerlememe ve aranılan bir usta olmamı sağlayacak. Gelecek için planlarım ise kendimi çok fazla geliştirip aranılan bir usta olmak istiyorum, daha sonrası ise kendime ait küçük bir pastane açıp çocuklarm ve eşime her anlamda faydalı olmayı planlıyorum. Biliyorumki benim bu planlarımı hayata geçirmek için Maya'nın her zaman yanımda bana büyük desteği olacaktır. Ailem benim için çok önemlidir benim bütün bu çabalarım ise çocukları daha iyi şartlarda yaşatabilmek ve okutabilmek için.

loans.use: to take a courser to improve her cooking skills.

loans.name: C2179 Umucyo Group

texts.en:
Aisha is 25 years old and single. Aisha is the leader of a group called "Umucyo" and this group is commonly known for selling clothes. In addition to that, some of these group members sell clothes in the center of their area. Aisha and her team have been in this business for about two years and the business hours are from 6 am until 8 pm every day. Aisha is in the middle.

Aisha and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by purchasing different styles of clothes to sell. If successful, Aisha and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. They will continue improving their families' lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jose Victorino

texts.es:
Jose tiene 55 años, esta acompañado, y tiene tres hijos.  Jose aprendió el oficio de la agricultura desde sus doce años, fue su papá quien le enseñó. Jose cultiva yuca en un terreno de 7,000 metros cuadrados.

Jose ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Campo para la compra de agroquímicos los cuales aplicará a su cultivo de yuca. Con la ayuda del préstamo Jose podra comprar todos los insumos de una vez, y asi ahorrar tiempo y dinero. De ésta forma Jose podrá aplicar el abono oportunamente, teniendo mejor producción.

En un futuro Jose planea cultivar un terreno más grande. Así el podra tener mayor producción y podra darle a sus hijos una educación profesional.
texts.en:
Jose is 55 and has a common-law partner and three children.  He learned agriculture from his father when he was 12 years old.  He has 7,000 square meters of land where he grows yucca.

Jose has requested a loan through Fundación Campo to buy agrochemicals for his yucca crop.  With the help of the loan Jose will buy all the supplies at the same time, saving him time and money.  This will allow him to apply the fertilizer at the right time, improving production.

In the future Jose wants to expand his plantation and increase production so he can give his children a professional education.

loans.use: To buy agrochemicals for his yucca crop.

loans.name: Zoumba Group

texts.fr:
Mme Foudailatou est la représentante du groupe Z.. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 17mois. Les 03 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des habits (pagnes) depuis 03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.

Mme veut ajouter de l’argent pour s’acheter une balle de pagnes.

Mme avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et épargner. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin de pagne et aider à la construction de leur maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Foudailatou is the representative of the Z. Group. She is married and the mother of four children ranging from 19 years to 17 months of age. Three of her children  are in school, and she has five dependents. 

She has been selling clothing (traditional color “pagnes” fabric) for the last three years. She stocks up at the Sector 10 market. Her clients are both men and women. She would like to increase her working capital to buy a bale of “pagnes” fabric. She would like to use her savings to help pay for her children’s education and to put money away. Her goal is to open a big store selling “pagnes” and help with the construction of the family home.

loans.use: to buy a bale of "pagnes" fabric

loans.name: 03.07.110. Thiệu Long Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Huệ is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.
Mrs Huệ works in agriculture dealing with farm food. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Huệ faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle feed. This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Huệ hopes to buy land of her own, for her business to do well, and to provide for her kids.
Huệ is the group leader of the 03.07.110.Thiệu Long solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.

loans.use: to purchase cattle feed

loans.name: Mali

texts.en:
Mali is a widowed woman with seven children who are enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mali has operated a retail shop for the past year, and her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is 34 years old and engages in farming as a source of income. He has a responsibility to support his wife and one child, so he is being patient, working in the field every day to provide for their needs. He has been doing this for six years and has experienced different setbacks in the course of making progress.

He has lost earnings because of a typhoon, and had his plants destroyed by pests. But in spite of these failures, he strives harder to continue his business. He is asking for assistance through a loan of PHP 15,000 from Alalay sa kaunlaran Inc. This will be used to buy seed corn, fertilizer, and pesticides to avoid disastrous infestations of pests.

loans.use: to buy seed corn, fertilizer, and pesticides to avoid disastrous infestations of pests.

loans.name: Tonui

texts.en:
Tonui is a farmer and a resident in his home area of  Litein, South Rift Kenya where he also provides veterinary services to the local farmers. He has been in farming for five years and currently provides pineapple, tea, banana, and milk for the local market. He is married with two children aged three and four years. He is 31 years old.

Tonui has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase artificial insemination containers to help in providing artificial insemination services to other farmers in the area. He adds that this will help boost his farming income through reinvesting the income from his services in farming and raise the living standards of his family. He hopes to increase the number of dairy cows in his farming business.

He says unreliability of produce prices and high costs of feed has made farming difficult.

loans.use: To buy artificial insemination containers for his farming business

loans.name: María Corina

texts.es: María Corina de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive con su familia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad frijoles, leche, cereales entre otros, es muy conocida en la localidad, pues en su tienda siempre tiene lo que el cliente necesita con productos de excelente calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es muy bueno María siempre tiene una sonrisa para las personas que compran en su negocio; Ella es una mujer dedicada al trabajo muy activa y dispuesta a cumplir todos sus sueños y metas a futuro, piensa que su más grande secreto para  llegar al éxito es la constancia, quiere ver crecer el negocio y está dispuesta a no darse por vencida, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones etc. María Corina tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
María Corina, 54 years old, lives with her family. She has a store where she sells staple items such as beans, milk, and cereal, among other things. She is very well-known in the area, since in her store she always has what the customer needs and stocks products of excellent quality at accessible prices. Also, her service is very good. María always has a smile for the people who shop in her store. 

She is dedicated to work, very active, and prepared to achieve all her dreams and future goals. She thinks the biggest secret for success is perseverance. 

She wants to see her business grow, and she is prepared to not give up. This is why she is asking Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy staple grains, sweets, instant products, drinks, soap, etc. María Corina is confident that in this way she will be able to bring financial security to her home.

loans.use: staple grains, sweets, instant products, drinks, soaps

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther de 37 años, convive con Alberto de 35 años de edad; viven en su propia casa junto a sus 04 hijos a quienes brinda lo mejor. Esther, a su edad es una persona de negocio, que sabe como administrar entre las labores de sus casa y su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Es por eso que atiende a su familia muy temprano para así disponer de tiempo en su quiosco, con  el apoyo de su pareja se esmera para seguir adelante y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Para Esther su bodega le es muy  rentable porque vende su mercadería a precios cómodos y sabe como atender  a sus consumidores. En su negocio trabaja hace 08 años en su propia casa situada en el distrito de Kimbiri, con el tiempo que lleva en el negocio ya obtuvo buenos ingresos, razón por la cual piensa ampliar su negocio y disponer mayor cantidad de productos. Este es crédito numero 01 con MFP, esta comprometida para pagar sus cuotas, ya que no quiere ocasionar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, mejorará su quiosco, a la vez comprará más mercaderías.
texts.en:
Esther is 37 years old, and lives with Alberto who is 35 years old. They live in their own house together with her 4 children to whom she gives her best.

Esther, at her age, is a business person who knows how to balance her household work and her little grocery store. This is why she takes care of her family very early so that she has the time for her kiosk. With the support of her partner she does her best to get ahead and provide for her children.

For Esther her store is very profitable because she sells her merchandise at affordable prices and she knows how to care for her buyers. She has been in business for 8 years in her own house located in the district of Kimbiri. From the time she has been in business she has made good income, and this is the reason she is thinking of expanding her business and displaying a larger number of products.

This is her first loan through MFP, and she is committed to making her payments, because she does not want to bring about problems for the members of her communal bank, where she feels very happy.

With the 1500 soles, she will improve her kiosk by buying more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand and stock her kiosk

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golosinas y tambien ahora esta vendiendo comida,ella lleva a las personas que estan construyendo casas,ella tambien la socia lleva gaseosas,ella vende en forma ambulatoria,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las golosinas,gaseosas y comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas y gaseosas al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working in the business of selling candy and now she is also selling food.  She delivers to people who are building houses.  She also delivers sodas.  She sells on foot.  With this business the member wants to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a place where she can sell the candy, sodas, and food.

The member is requesting the loan to buy candy and sodas wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy candy and sodas wholesale.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Libertad 1 Group

texts.es:
Doña   María  es  una   persona  muy  emprendedora,  dedicada  a su  negocio actualmente  tiene  su  vivienda  cerca   con  su madre  y tres hijas. Ella vive en el departamento de Choluteca al sur de Honduras.
Doña María es panadera elabora y vende de pan. Ella necesita el préstamo para la compra harina, huevos, azúcar, leña y manteca. Doña María espera que con este préstamo tener más pan en variedad con esto aumentar sus ventas.   Doña María Sueña con educar a sus hijas y poner una panadería grande y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes para que sus panes se vendan en mas lugares. 
La joven Lesly se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de una empresa, ella se dedica a este rubro desde hace más de 5 años y vive con sus padres.
La Señora Deysi se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en su caserío. Desde  hace mas de 10 años, ella madre de 2 hijos los que tiene de corta edad cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres y actualmente vive con ellos.

Choluteca, Honduras - Marzo  del 2012
texts.en:
Maria is a very entrepreneurial person and dedicates herself to her current business that she has near her home with her mother and three daughters. She lives in the south of Honduras. Maria is a baker and she produces and sells bread. She needs the loan to buy flour, eggs, sugar, wood and lard. Maria hopes that with this loan she will have a larger variety of bread and that this will increase her sales. Maria dreams of educating her daughters, of running a larger bakery and of satisfying the needs of her clients so that she can sell her bread in more places. 

The youngster Lesly dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetics as a business. She has dedicated herself to this task for more than 5 years and she lives with her parents.

Deysi dedicates herself to the sale of consigned clothing in her hamlet and has done so for more than 10 years. She is the mother of two sons that she had when she was very young and she counts on the support of her parents with whom she lives with today.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, sugar, wood and lard for their business.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a forty-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children and building a permanent home. He has been operating a retail shop for six years now, and his main hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase enough stock. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and hiring employees to help expand his business. Vicent wants a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar for sale.

Vicent needs a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar for sale.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Geidy Chantal

texts.es:
Geidy Chantal es estudiante de Negocios Internacionales, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos. Esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Geidy Chantal, tengo 21 años de edad, nací en la ciudad de Monte Plata el 17, de febrero de 1994, tengo 3 hermanas y actualmente vivo con mi madre, una de mis hermanas y mi sobrina.
A la edad de 8 años me mude junto a mi madre y hermanas a la ciudad de Santo Domingo, gracias a que un familiar de mi madre nos prestó una casa, allí duramos alrededor de 12 años. Estudie en la escuela Celina Pellier de los Mameyes y luego concluí los estudios médicos en el Politécnico Pilar Constanzo en Villa Duarte, donde me gradué de Bachiller Técnico en Contabilidad y Gestión Administrativa.
Mi madre realizaba trabajos domésticos, de los cuales nos beneficiábamos mis hermanas y yo, luego le fue diagnosticada una enfermedad, lo cual impidió que siguiera con su labor. Mi padre se fue a Estados Unidos cuando tenía 2 años, y lo volví a ver a la edad de 13 años, y desde entonces no he recibido ayuda o apoyo alguno de parte de él.
Actualmente estudio en la Universidad APEC, la carrera de Negocios Internacionales, la cual me gustaría ejercer con toda pasión y lo más importante poder llegar a terminarla, ya que desde el 2012, cuando finalice mis estudios medios, me ha sido difícil este proceso, he tenido que parar en muchas ocasiones y ya quisiera terminar mi carrera.
Este préstamo estaría cambiando mi vida, no solo en lo académico, sino también en lo personal, porque debido a mi situación en la universidad muchas veces sufro de baja autoestima y desanimo, por creer que no me será posible terminar la universidad, que es mi prioridad ahora mismo. En caso de no recibir la ayuda, pues la historia que ha venido pasando desde el 2012 hasta la fecha, se estaría repitiendo, debido a que he buscado otras formas y no logro encontrar una manera de poder continuar mis estudios.
Una vez termine mis estudios, mi deseo es poder poner en práctica todo lo aprendido y comenzar con estudios de post-grado, quiero hacer un master en Derecho Internacional. Pues esto me gusta muchísimo. En la universidad que estudio tienen un programa de doble titulación, me gustaría participar en el para poder ejercer en el exterior, también ayudar a mi madre y mis hermanas igual como lo han hecho hasta ahora,  de la misma manera poder servir de ejemplo a mis sobrinas y que mi familia sienta orgullo de mí.

loans.use: PARA CUBRIR GASTOS DE EDUCACION SUPERIOR

loans.name: Koffi

texts.en:
Mr. Koffi A. was born in 1973. His got his school diploma in 1997, however he could not continue his education because of the death of his older brother, who was the only one supporting him. Realizing that he must support himself, as well as the five children of his deceased older brother, he took the job of motorbike taxi driver under these very difficult conditions. Since he does not own his own motorbike, he ultimately earns very little for all his work. He feels defeated by this harsh reality and is at the end of his wits, particularly since he is married and the father of three children of his own. His greatest wish now is to be able to have his own motorbike, so that he can make more money and provide for his extended family.

To do this, he is applying for a $1,000 loan for a motorbike and the insurance for it. He can then make a secure living as a taxi driver in the city of Aného. This plan will certainly allow him to improve the living conditions of the many family members who depend on him.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY

Monsieur A. Koffi est né en 1973. Titulaire du diplôme de Baccalauréat depuis 1997, il n’a pu continuer les études parce qu’il a perdu son grand frère qui était son seul soutien. Conscient qu’il devrait désormais se prendre en charge et aussi assurer les besoins des cinq (05) enfants de son grand frère décédé, il devient conducteur de taxi moto dans des conditions très pénibles. N’étant pas propriétaire de la moto, il n’en tire pas réellement profit des fruits de son labeur. Il se trouve pratiquement écrasé par les difficultés et ne sait plus à quel sain se vouer car il est maintenant marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Le plus grand souhait exprimé aujourd’hui est de pouvoir conduire sa propre moto pour avoir un revenu plus modeste au besoin de sa nombreuse famille. Pour ce faire, Monsieur A. sollicite un crédit de $ 1000 qui va lui permettre d’acheter la moto et de l’assurer en vue de faire le taxi moto en toute sécurité à travers la ville d’Aného. Ce projet lui permettra à coup sûr d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ces nombreuses personnes à sa charge.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Aigbe

texts.en: A 46-year-old woman, Mrs. Aigbe A. has five children. She specializes in the sale of ice cream for the public. She is willing and hoping for the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream for sale

loans.name: Preab

texts.en: A 37-year-old mother of 5 children, Phreab S. lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a head of family and sells fruit at the local market, while her husband works in Thailand. S. typically makes around $3.5/day in revenue, which is not sufficient to support her 5 children. In order to keep sustaining the family, S. is asking for a $1000 loan to generate additional income by purchasing more fruit to sell, to meet the great demand of her clients. She very much hopes to provide her children a better quality of life from her business one day.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell at the local market

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Bakhtiyor is an invalid. A car crash resulted in serious injuries that caused his disability. In spite of this Bakhtiyor helps his wife in her business. His wife, Ulfat, buys dried apricots of lower quality on the market and after sorting them out resells them for better price. This is how she makes a profit. Bakhtiyor has four children and he also looks after them at home.

In order to develop their business, Bakhtiyor needed additional funds. Two years ago he received a loan from Microinvest that helped to increase his business activities for quite a while. At the present time, Bakhtiyor would like to get a second loan to expand their business further. You can see his wife Ulfat in the picture.

loans.use: to further expand their business

loans.name: Sorangel García

texts.en:
Sorangel is an experienced person in doing business. She is living with her husband and their beloved one-year-old daughter. For the sake of sustaining the family, her husband has a lottery bank and offers his services as a barber to the men of the township. Sorangel attends to the drink store of the couple. The store has its key activities at night, even though it’s open in the morning. The atmosphere is very pleasant, because there is good sound equipment, and almost all types of drinks are sold. Customers seize upon that time to play dominos and cards there.

Generally, Sorangel has to go to Santo Domingo, the capital, every weekend to buy wholesale drinks. Since the terrain is pretty rough, the delivery service of the drinks companies can’t easily take the goods to her business. So she’s obliged to rent an expensive truck and take the supplies to her.

Up until now, the business has been profitable. In fact, when we visited her store, we could observe that there was nothing left to sell. People in the township consume a lot of alcohol, especially during the weekends, and the demand continues growing.

Sorangel has applied to borrow US $375 that will help her buy more drinks in order to face the growing demand from the population. This way, she will be able to increase her income and use part of that additional to buy fuel for the two motorcycles of the business. She’ll also be able to save some money for other needs of the family.

loans.use: The entrepreneur will use the money to buy more products in order to reach more customers; and bear expenses for transportation.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
A. Ilham is a 37-year-old farmer who lives with his family in the southern Azerbaijani region of Bilasuvar. Ilham is an internally displaced person who fled to Bilasuvar from the Jabrail region in the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993.

Ilham is a farmer who owns a small herd of sheep and sells sheep to the local bazaar traders. Ilham has six years of experience in sheep breeding, and all that time it brought him good income. For the last two years, Ilham feels that it is not enough to keep a small herd. He is going to expand his business, so he applied for 1000 USD to purchase an additional 15 sheep and fodder for the winter season. The estimated cost for sheep is 50-60 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase 15 sheep

loans.name: Onih

texts.en: Onih is 20 years old and is the mother of a 1 year old child. She sells sandals on credit and usually earns US $7 per week. Her husband, Y., is a driver who earns US $2 per day.  Therefore, she has to work hard to earn extra income for the family. She needs a IDR 900,000 loan to expand her business and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Rissala

texts.en: Rissala is a 43 year old woman and the mother of a young girl. The two of them live in Beirut, where Rissala works as a tailor. Rissala is a very competent tailor and has a large number of clients. Rissala's work is much appreciated. This is the second time Rissala is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to purchase material to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Magret

texts.pt:
Magrete Maria B. was born in the Namaacha district of Maputo province on July 27, 1979. She is now 28 years old. She has 5 brothers and sisters. She studied until 8th grade, and due to circumstances, stopped studying early. She married at the early age of 17, and had her first child at the age of 18. She now has two children.

She started her business when she was still living with her parents, because the business helped support her family. Her first experience with credit was with HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, which she became aware of through her sister-in-law. She approached HLUVUKU and requested a loan of 20,000 MT for her business. She repaid the loan without difficulty.

With the loan of 30,000 MT, she plans to buy chicks and feed, which are acquired in the city of Maputo, 35 km from the capital. The growth period for the chicks varies from 35-45 days, after which they are placed in the local market for sale, creating a positive impact for Magrete's family and the community, which is supplied with meat locally at accessible prices.

Her future plan is to have an increasing loan size, in order to be able to keep growing her business more and more.

Translated from Portuguese by Steve Fogel, Kiva volunteer.

Localização : Bairro 07
Cliente: Magrete Maria Bande
Actividade: Comercio
Valor de empréstimo: 30.000,00 MT ( 1.200 USD )
Aplicação: Compra de pintos e Ração
Inicio: 31-01-08
Fim: 25-05-09

Magrete Maria Bande, nasceu na Província de Maputo Distrito de Namaacha ao 27 de Julho de 1979, tem actualmente 28 anos de idade. Tem 5 irmãos legitimos. Estudou ate a 8ª classe e devido a falta de condições deixou de estudar cedo e, consequentemente, teve um casamento precoce tendo casado maritalmente com 17 anos de idade. Teve o seu primeiro filho com 18 anos e actualmente tem 2 filhos. Começou a praticar o comercio quando estava ainda a viver com os seu pais ,porque sustentavam a família com o comercio. O seu primeiro contacto com o credito fui com a HLUVUKU- ADSEMA. Conhece a HLUVUKU graças a sua cunhada, dai aproximou se e pediu um credito no valor de 20.000,00 para o comercio, tendo pago o credito sem dificuldades. Com o emprestimo de 30.000,00MT pretende comprar pintos e racao, que sao adquiridos na cidade de Maputo que dista 35 Kms da capital. O periodo de crescimento dos pintos varia entre 35-45 dias, depois do qual sao colocados no mercado local para venda, criando um impacto positivo para a familia da Magrete e na comunidade que abastece-se de carne localmente a precos acessiveis. A sua perspectiva futura e ter um credito cada vez maior de modo a fazer crescer o seu cada vez mais o negocio.

loans.use: To increase her business ( to buy chickens for retail and to buy feed)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing two new cattle and additional fodder.

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
I am Tahira A., wife of Abdul Ghafoor. I am married and a mother of an only son who is three and half years old. He attends kindergarten. My husband works abroad and I have been operating a beauty parlor from my house for the last three years. I need a loan to buy items for my parlor.

I have been joined in my loan group by a few other women. They are: Naseem B., who runs a boutique; Jameela B., who sews clothes on order; Fazeelat B.’s husband, who is a blacksmith; and Sajida P., who wants to start a stitching training centre in her community.

loans.use: To buy required items for the beauty salon and to fund the other businesses

loans.name: De La Buena Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
The women of De La Buena Esperanza #2 are also in the livestock industry. In the community of Barranche, the business is very profitable being that despite many of them working in it, they continue to invest in their respective businesses due to the demand in their products.

They believe that the loans they receive are of utmost importance being that without said injection of funds, their businesses would be unable to prosper. Fortunately, they were able to pay their past loans easily. One important detail worth mentioning is that previously, in rural communities, those that offered the loans charged up to 10% interest per day. For this reason, institutions like Friendship Bridge are of vital importance to microfinance being that now the women can have dependable access to loans.

These ladies are currently working in the livestock breeding industry. Many of them are breeding chickens, pigs and bulls. The animals they breed depend on the demand in the market. However, the dream of some of them is to learn to make cakes, finger foods and handicrafts. This is because they want to diversify their businesses so that they do not have to depend on one sole source of income. The dream of some others is to pay off their loan, then take out another one that allows them to purchase more livestock.

This group of women is very enthusiastic, and for that reason we must give them wings in the form of a loan. They have the disposition to work hard, since they have been doing it their whole lives to survive the harsh conditions of poverty. Please support them in this development process so that they may progress.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn G., Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres de la Buena Esperanza #2 también pertenecen a la industria de la ganadería. En la comunidad de Barranche el negocio es muy rentable, ya que a pesar de que muchas señoras trabajan en ganadería ellas siguen invirtiendo en su mismo negocio debido a la demanda que tienen por sus productos.

Ellas creen que los préstamos que ellas reciben le son de suma utilidad ya que sin dicha infusión de dinero sus negocios no podrían prosperar. Por suerte, ellas pudieron pagar las cuotas de sus préstamos pasados con comodidad. Un detalle importante es que en las comunidades rurales anteriormente las personas que daban créditos cobraban hasta un 10% al día. Es por eso que instituciones como Friendship Bridge ayuda mucho al desarrollo de la micro empresa ya que ahora las mujeres pueden tener acceso confiable al crédito.

Estas señoras por el momento están trabajando en el área de crianza de animales. Muchas de ellas están criando pollos, cerdos y toros. Los animales que crían depende de la demanda del mercado. Sin embargo el sueño de algunas es de aprender a elaborar pasteles y bocadillos y hacer manualidades. Esto se debe a que ellas quieren diversificar sus negocios para que así no tengan que depender de una fuente de ingresos. El sueño de otras es de pagar su crédito y poder sacar un préstamo que les ayude a comprar más ganado.

Este grupo de mujeres es muy entusiasta. Es por eso que le debemos de darles alas por medio de un préstamo. Ellas tienen la disposición de trabajar duro, ya que lo han hecho toda su vida para sobrevivir las duras condiciones de la pobreza. Apóyenlas en este proceso de desarrollo para que puedan salir adelante.

loans.use: Breeding of animals such as chickens, pigs and bulls.

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Mr. Sokheang K., 27, and his wife, Mrs. Nara Sem, 37, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have two sons, who are in school.

Sokheang has been raising pigs since 2005, a skill he learned from his neighbor. Besides raising pigs, he also does construction work. His wife Nara has been a silk weaver since 2000, a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sokheang is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase feed for raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase feed for raising pigs

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria is married, she is 56 years old; she didn’t finish school, has 9 kids, although only 3 live with her. She lives in the district of La Esperanza, Province of Trujillo, La Libertad. She sells groceries. Her partner buys products at the Hermelinda’s market and sells them at the Bellavista market. The first loan she received of S/.300.00 (Soles), she invested it on buying spices. She Belongs to the Community Bank called “Bellavista II” recently she received a loan of $1,200, which will be paid on 4 months; with this loan she will buy rice, sugar, oil, pasta and some of it will be invested on the construction of her store. She is looking to request a S/.1,500 (Soles) loan to supply better her business. Her personal challenge is to increase her savings to have access to larger credit. Mrs. Maria is willing to keep on working with Manuela Ramos (Feminist Peruvian organization), but she is requesting a larger loan, because previous loans were not enough. The profit she gets per unit of product is S/.0.10 (Soles), getting a daily profit of approximately S/ 5.00 to S/.10.00 Soles. She decided to solicit the loan because of lack of her own economic resources. One of obstacles she has faced is higher prices of products. Her goal is to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María está casada, tiene 56 años; no tiene grado D. instrucción, tiene 09 hijos, solo 03 son dependientes. Vive en el distrito D. La Esperanza Provincia D. Trujillo, La Libertad. Su actividad principal es vender abarrotes. La socia compra los productos en el mercado La Hermelinda y los venD. en el mercado Bellavista. El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. S/.300.00, el cual invirtió en la compra D. condimentos, ajino moto, etc. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “BELLAVISTA II ”, recientemente ha recibido un préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00, el cual será pagado en un plazo D. 04 meses; con este préstamo comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, tallarín, y una parte la invertirá en la construcción del local. Piensa solicitar S/. 1,500.00 para surtir mejor el negocio. El desafío personal que la empresaria hace frente, es incrementar el ahorro para acceder a un mayor crédito. La señora María, sí, estaría dispuesta a seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos, pero solicita que le otorguen un préstamo mayor, porque los créditos no son suficientes. El beneficio que logra por unidad D. producto es D. S/.0.10, obteniendo una ganancia diaria aproximadamente D. S/ 5.00 a S/.10.00 soles. Por falta D. recursos económicos, decidió solicitar el préstamo. Una D. las dificultades que se han presentado es el alza D. precios. Tiene como meta, construir un puesto que sea propio.

loans.use: To buy diverse grocery products at wholesale prices / Compra al por mayor de artículos diversos (abarrotes).

loans.name: Mwanahamina

texts.en: Mwanahamina A. is a married business woman who lives in Tanzania. She has a retail shop in Makangarawe in Temeke District. She sells a variety of commodities including serial crop products. Her business is two years old and her customers are local families. She purchases the items from Kariakoo city market and from wholesale shops. Her income is used to feed her family. Mwanahamina is requesting a loan of $550 so she can expand her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Odinakhon

texts.en:
Odinakhon S. is 55 years old. She is married with three children.

Odinakhon bakes the national bread which is called “lepeshka”. She is in this business for 10 years already. Her bakery is located in her house.

As a rule Odinakhon bakes about 120 “lepeshkas” per day and sells them the same day. The “lepeshka” of Odinakhon is very popular in her neighborhood, so that this stable business generates the main income for the family.

Now Odinakhon is planning to open another bakery, and she also needs to increase her working capital in order to purchase input materials like flour, salt, and charcoal for baking. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting 1200 US Dollars for a term of 3 months. Odinakhon plans to spend the generated income on improving the living conditions of the family. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Odinakhon would like to express her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing input materials and opening another bakery

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en:
Feruza K. has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007. She applied to MicroInvest when her sister told her about MicroInvest's loan procedure and loan program. Thanks to her previous loans she was able to open a stall selling children's wear and toys. She has a good assortment and low prices that give her repeat customers.

Mrs. Feruza K. is applying to KIVA with the request for a business support loan of 4000 STJ for 4 months to improve her assortment of goods for sale.

loans.use: to improve her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Djiguissèmè Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguissèmè est composé de 6 femmes (une veuve et 5 mariées) ayant en moyenne 48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent à majorité dans des grandes familles élargies du bozokin (quartier de Bozo une ethnie spécialisée dans la pêche de poissons d’eau douce) de Kirango de la sous-préfecture de Markala région de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Unies par des liens de parenté, de voisinage et professionnel, elles mènent toutes la même activité génératrice de revenu à savoir la vente du poisson (sous toutes ses formes). En plus de la vente du poisson, elles font le petit commerce de bois de chauffe et du savon pendant la période de crue où les poissons sont rares. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs affaires, les membres du groupe intégrèrent le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel ils sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 450 kilogrammes de poisson et 70 barres de glace. Une partie du poisson est fumée à la maison sur des fours traditionnels conçus spécialement pour cette activité et l’autre partie est vendue en etat frais. Elles s’approvisionnent en poisson à l’entrée du barrage de Markala avec les pêcheurs. Une partie de leur marchandise est vendue en ambulant aux fonctionnaires domiciliés dans le quartier servicekin (quartier administratif) et au marché de Kirango tant disque l’autre moitié est vendue à Ségou à des clientes fidèles qui achètent en gros pour les revendre.
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé généralement pour la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants et aider les époux à subvenir aux charges familiales. Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter chacune une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Djiguissèmè group is composed of 6 women (a widow and 5 married women) with an average age of 48 and 5 children. Most of them live in big, extended families in the Bozokin (in a neighborhood of Bozo, an ethnicity specialized in fresh-water fishing) in Kirango, Sous-prefecture of Markala, Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Linked by bonds of kinship, neighborhood, and professional ties, they all work at the same business, i.e., selling fish (in all forms). Besides selling fish, they sell firewood and soap on a small scale during the periods when there are not many fish to be found.

In order to increase the size of their businesses, the members of the group joined the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans were reimbursed correctly.

This third loan will be used to buy 450 kg of fish and 70 blocks of ice. Some of the fish is smoked at their homes on traditional fireplaces specially designed for this activity and the rest is sold fresh. They buy their fish at the entrance to the Markala dam from fishermen. Some of their merchandise is sold door-to-door to bureaucrats who live in the Servicekin neighborhood (the administrative district) and at the market of Kirango, whereas the other half is sold in Ségou to faithful customers who buy wholesale in order to re-sell the fish.

They hope to make an average profit of 35,000 F CFA each month, using the money in general to pay school fees for their children and to help their husbands pay living expenses for their families. Their ambition is to each be able to buy a house to live in.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish to smoke or re-sell fresh

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
EL Sr. Moisés M., vive en la localidad de El Torno, en el departamento de Santa Cruz, Bolivia, vive en una pequeña casa en alquiler desde que enviudó hace algunos años. Es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante para poder seguir progresando económicamente.  
Se dedica al transporte en motocicleta, trabajando de lunes a domingo, paralelamente en sus tiempos libres se dedica al comercio de ganado vacuno; actividades que le dan el suficiente sustento para poder sobrevivir.
El monto solicitado en esta ocsión, servirá para la compra de una motocicleta nueva con la cual podrá trabajar más comodamente puesto que la anterior ya presentaba problemas mecánicos.
texts.en:
Senor Moisés M. lives in El Torno, Santa Cruz Department, Bolivia. He has lived in a small rented house since he became a widower some years ago. He is a young man eager to get ahead and continue to progress economically. He works in motorcycle transport, working from Monday to Sunday. In addition, in his free time he also engages in the cattle business. These activities provide him sufficient support to be able to survive. The amount requested this time is to buy a new motorcycle, with which he will be able to work more comfortably since his old one is already having mechanical problems.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 32 years old, married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in Tema, where she has worked as a seamstress for five years. She specializes in women's clothing, and makes a wide range of garments that can be worn at weddings, funerals and other occasions. She also sells bottled water as a source of extra income.
