Cecelia has applied for a loan to buy additional supplies such as linen, threads and thimbles. Her goal is to increase her income by improving her output and efficiency. She plans to use the increased income to provide her children with high-quality education. She is a member of the “Nyame ye” (or God is Good) Group. Members help each other secure and repay loans.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as linen, threads and thimbles

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov S., age 35, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community for profit. He is currently earning an average of $4 a day and has been running his service for a long time. He is married and the father of three children, all of whom are teenagers and attend school. His wife, Mout Saveun, is a local rice farmer. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious meals for family. The family lives in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia.

Mr. S. works hard every day to earn an income to buy food for his family and especially make sure his children receive the highest education. Recently, he can't attract his customers as before because his motorcycle is always broken. Because of this obstacle, S. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle to replace his old one.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle to replace an old one for his taxi motorcycle service

loans.name: Juana Felicitas

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedoras.
Juana es casada y tiene 7 hijos, Juana venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara, Juana venD. desayunos que reparte a los comerciantes del mercado. Además Juana venD. cereales que compra D. las feriantes. Juana tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, aceite, fideos.
Los sueños D. Juana son progresar mas, que sus hijos estudien y surtir su tienda con mas productos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "Emprendedoras" community bank. Juana is married and has seven children. Juana is a street vendor, selling food at the Santa Clara market: Juana sells breakfasts which she distributes to merchants in the market. Juana also sells cereals which she buys from the merchants. Juana also has a grocery store in her home. Juana needs a 600 soles loan to buy rice, oil, and noodles. Juana dreams of progressing more, that her children get their education and of stocking her store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and noodles

loans.name: Jose Edgar

texts.es: Don josé nació Cochabamba, una pequeña ciudad ubicada en el ra gión central del país, desde hace más de 15 años que radica en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Bolivia. Actualmente lleva unos 10 años en el rubro del transporte público de pasajeros, durante los primeros años como chofer asalariado y desde los dos ultimos años como chofer propietario de un microbus y no hace mas de un año que ha adquirido la accion como socio del sindicato de transportes, casi todo su patrimonio lo a hecho con la ayuda de creditos en otras instituciones. Vive con su familia, tiene una hija y todos viven en la casa de su madre, es cliente nuevo en la institucion con muchas ganas de superacion.
texts.en:
José was born in Cochabamba, a small city located in the central region of the country. For more than 15 years, he has settled in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Bolivia. Currently, he has 10 years of experience in the area of public transportation of passengers. For the first few years, he worked as a salaried driver. For the past two years, however, he is the proprietor of a microbus. It’s been only one year since he acquired membership in a transportation syndicate. Almost all his personal assets have been obtained with the help of loans with other institutions. He lives with his family, has a daughter, and they all live in his mother’s house. He is a new client of the institution who has a great desire to supersede.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent T. sells groceries like milk, Milo, canned products, soap and other goods near the Graphic house in Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Millicent has been selling groceries since 2004. She is responsible for assisting her husband with housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase sales and meet her customers' growing demands. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Faapo

texts.en: Faapo K., 33, is married with two children. She has three years of experience in the general store business and sells to the general public seven days per week. She requested this loan in order to purchase mutton flaps, Drumsticks, Twisties, tinned fish, and a freezer. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1000 Tala (about $416). SPBD loans are Faapo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This is her first SPBD loan.

loans.use: To purchase mutton flaps, Drumsticks, Twisties, tinned fish, and a freezer.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida has owned a small charcoal and firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to the Salmina group loan (Group code 2019). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day, she works at her business from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Saida is 35 years old, married, and has three children: ages 12, 11 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has been selling fish for more than two years. Her husband, a farmer, assists her by taking the fish around their village from house-to-house with his motorcycle. Their income is not enough to meet their needs. Mary Jane is planning to open a store in front of their house to earn more profit. She wants to expand her business into a typical village store. She is willing to increase her efforts in order to expand her business.

Mary Jane is just 22 years old and married to Rex. They are blessed with two children. The older, Camil Joy, is 5 years old and she will be starting nursery school next year. Ejay is just 10 months old. Mary Jane is happy that there is cooperation in her family. They always give a helping hand to each other, especially in times of crisis.

Mary Jane is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP to have enough capital for her business plan. She aims to provide her children with higher education some day; thus, she is working diligently to attain her desires in life and to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To open a store

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario vive en casa de su madre en la calle Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; en la casa donde vive instaló una tienda donde vende llantas y repuestos de automóvil, este negocio lo inició con su esposa y ambos trabajan en el mismo. El crédito que solicitan es para aumentar su capital, comprar más llantas y repuestos y poder mantener esta fuente de ingresos con la cual mantienen a su familia.

Mario es cliente de Impro desde el año 2007 y su historial de pagos tiene calificación 1, lo cual significa muy buena, razón por la cual puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mario lives in his mother’s house on Jaimes Freyre Street in the Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz. He has set up a store in his house where he sells tires and replacement parts for automobiles. He started this business with his wife, and they both work in it. The loan is to buy more tires and replacement parts to be able to maintain this source of income with which he supports his family. Mario has been a client of Impro since 2007. His payment history is rated 1, which is very good. For that reason he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires and vehicle replacement parts for his business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
General store is the business managed by Anita D. of Barangay Sta. Rosa Gamu, Isabela. She has been managing the business for about ten years.  With the need to have an alternative source of income, she engaged in this business aside from farming.  She is thankful that the business is still doing better and helps them to support the needs of their family.  Anita would like to ask for support from lenders who could help her improve her business more. She needs additional capital amounting to PHP7,000. 

Anita belongs to a happy family and they live a harmonious life in the village of Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Isabela. She is married to Ramonito, a farmer, and blessed with four children; three of them are studying.  Their eldest has already finished her education course; the second and third children are currently studying in college and their youngest is studying in the primary school. 

Anita always wanted the best for her children. She was glad that she made it all start right and she always believed that “success started from humble beginnings”.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica es una mujer muy alegre de 40 años, vive con su pareja en la casa de sus padres, donde habita en compañía de sus seres queridos. Sus ganas de trabajar la llevaron a aprender la elaboración de panecillos y con mucha práctica y dedicación pudo conocer nuevas formas para producir diversos bocaditos. Al principio fue difícil, sobre todo venderlos de forma ambulante, ya que la mayoría de las personas tienen desconfianza de comer en la calle, pero al probar el dulce sabor de sus pasteles comenzaron a ser muy demandados y Verónica aprovechó esta oportunidad atendiendo todos los pedidos que le hacían. Ahora es muy conocida en su localidad y su empeño de salir adelante la sigue llevando cada fin de semana al mercado central de su ciudad donde obtiene mayores ganancias. Esta dinámica de trabajo le da la oportunidad de ahorrar con el fin de instalar una panadería y una fuente de soda donde pueda atender a sus clientes y seguir distribuyendo sus pedidos. Ella se encuentra en su treceavo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y aprecia mucho el trabajo dentro del banco comunal que conforma, pues todas las actividades son realizadas con interacción de todos los miembros. Los 2500 soles que viene solicitando los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes y utensilios para seguir elaborando sus deliciosos pasteles.
texts.en:
Verónica is 40 years old and a very cheerful woman. She lives with her partner in her parents' home in the company of their loved ones. Due to her willingness to work, she learned how to make bread rolls, and through lots of practice and dedication, started to find new ways to produce various snacks. She found it difficult being a traveling saleswoman because most people have a distrust of eating food sold on the street. Once customers sampled the taste of her sweet pastries, demand for her products increased and Verónica took advantage of this opportunity. She is now well known in her community and her commitment to success continues. She sells her products in the central market every weekend in order to maximize her profits. Her work provides her with the opportunity to save towards starting a bakery and installing a soda fountain where she can continue fulfilling her customers’ orders.

Verónica is now on her thirteenth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She appreciates the work of her communal bank group because the activities require the interaction of all members. Her loan of 2500 soles will be used to purchase ingredients and utensils needed to make her delicious pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Lidia es viuda, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Lidia vende helados, chupetes de manera ambulatoria en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Lidia hace papa seca en su casa y luego lo comercializa a los mayoristas.
Lidia necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Lidia son comprar un terreno para construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Dos Mil Communal Bank. She is a 45 year old widow and has 7 children. She is a traveling merchant selling ice cream and lollipops in the Ayacucho central market. In addition to her daily market sales, Lidia also makes dried potatoes at home and then sells them to wholesalers.

Lidia needs a loan of 1400 soles to purchase more potatoes. She hopes to buy a plot of land on which she can build a house and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Reggie

texts.en:
Reggie B. is a 52-year-old mother of four children ages from 17 to 24 years old. Her husband is a farmer and has been a paid farm laborer in most of his life. From being a plain housewife, Reggie emerged as a business partner of her husband in farming business when she joined ASHI in 2005 where she was able to make a loan. Business started small covering small area of farm land. After making several loans from ASHI Reggie and her husband can finance wide area of rice farm and can harvest rice of up to 500 sacks every cropping (four to five months). In a year, Reggie can finance two cropping however, she wanted to make bigger amount of loan to enhance further her business and to purchase equipments and machines needed thus avoiding renting from other people.

Reggie is not only dreaming about the success of her business. Most of all, she dreamed about all of her children graduating from college. Through her profits, she could make this happen. Presently three of her children are in college and one in high school. Reggie hoped that through her loan she will be able to make her business successful and her children. By then, she will be happier and contented about her life as mother a business partner of her husband and as wife for she had performed her productive role very well.

loans.use: The farm inputs such as rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides she needs to purchase for her rice planting business.

loans.name: Diego Manuel

texts.es: Diego Manuel S. Gutiérrez tiene 44 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. Tiene 3 hijos que dependen de él y asisten a clases. La actividad económica de Diego es la venta de helados, gaseosas y hot- dog. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica por lo que su negocio surgió por la falta de empleo con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos familiar y así ayudar a su esposa. Los propósitos de Don Diego son de obtener  cada día el ingreso diario para su familia, ya que él ha luchado mucho para que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que con esto podría comprar los productos  necesarios. Los deseos más grandes de Don Diego son de establecer una pulpería.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 40 year old trader who sells garment clothes, shoes, slippers and lace materials at the community market center. Lace material is very useful in room and office decoration. Mary treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, she buys few goods because of inadequate funds. She started her business seven years ago.

Mary is married and the mother of five children. Currently all her children attend school in the community where they live. Mary is a very hardworking young woman who strives to sustain her family and her business. For this reason, she requests support to make her business progress. She believes this loan will enable her to grow her business to the desired level. It is her wish to see her children educated to the university level.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Teotimo

texts.en: Mr. Teotimo C., 40 years old, is happily married to Mercy. They are blessed with 5 kids; the eldest is 18 years old. Teotimo works hard for his family. His harvest differs in quantity every time; on occasion, his farm produces less. He joined CEV in the hopes of finding help via their financial services. Fortunately, he qualified to be a member. Teotimo is now applying for a loan of PHP 10,000. Hopefully, this loan will help him produce quality harvests.

loans.use: farm financing

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un Y. is a 45-year-old widowed villager who lives in Kampong Chhnang province. She is the mother of four children; two are employed, one works driving a taxi and another one is a garment worker. Her husband died of senility years ago. Although a widow, she is a determined woman who tries to earn money from making clay stoves. She waits till she has a lot of stoves before selling to her customers.

Recently, her stock of the raw materials she needs has run out. Therefore, Un Y. is applying for a loan in order to purchase clay to make stoves for sale.

loans.use: To purchase clay to make stoves for sale

loans.name: Carot Group

texts.en:
Isabella I., age 25, is unmarried. She has a daughter who is three years old named Beatrice. Isabella owns and operates a beauty salon in the Tegeta area of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She has been working in the beauty salon business since 2003, beginning when she was just 19!

The salon is open from 8:30 am until 9 pm daily, and Isabella makes a monthly profit of about $250. This is her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. The first loan was repaid successfully and helped Isabella to maintain her salon.

With this loan, she hopes to invest in salon equipment like scissors and combs, hair weaves, shampoos and conditioners, and other products to increase the operating capacity of the salon. In the picture, Isabella is in the back row wearing red. Isabella will share this loan with the members of her group, Carot. They will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: Salon equipment, hair weaves, and hair products for her salon

loans.name: Nasanjargal

texts.en: Nasanjargal M. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Uvs province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. She has three daughters and two sons, ranging in age from eight to 22. Her oldest daughter is 22 years old and a fourth-year-student in a local pedagogical university. The other four children all go to secondary schools in town. Nasanjargal has a small shoe-making business with her husband. Her husband is a talented sewer and makes traditional warm winter shoes. She used to work in a local shoe factory until 1995. After she quit her job, she started her own small business with her husband. Many of their customers are herders who need very warm shoes during harsh winter in which temperature can drop to -40 Celsius easily. In early winter, the demand for winter shoes spikes and they hire temporary employees to meet the local demand for shoes. Nasanjargal requests a loan to purchase shoe materials for their business.

loans.use: To purchase shoe materials

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia, de 40 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha luchado mucho por salir adelante, vive en al casa de uno de sus familiares y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
El tejido artesanal es la actividad que ella realiza para ganarse la vida, en su vivienda tiene su taller de tejidos, cuenta con 2 máquinas de tejer, las cuales utiliza para realizar distintos tipos de acabados a sus prendas. Eusebia vende de forma ambulatoria en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Juliaca, ya que siente que así abarca una mayor cantidad de clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. 
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera tener un puesto estable donde vender sus prendas con más tranquilidad.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Eusebia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y espera poder hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas artesanales que produce.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 40 years of age, is a woman who throughout her life has fought to get ahead. She lives in a relative’s house, and what she wishes for most is to live out her old age in peace. Knitting handicrafts is the activity by which she earns a living, and she has a workshop in the residence where she lives. She has 2 knitting machines that she uses to make different finishes for her clothes. Eusebia sells as a street vendor in the various markets of the city of Juliaca because she feels this method allows her to approach a greater number of customers. What she enjoys most about her work is chatting with patrons, which helps pass the time during her long workdays. She has been carrying out this activity for 10 years, and finds the most difficult aspect of her work to be walking all day long in search of potential buyers. In the future, she hopes to establish a stationary site where she could sell her wares more comfortably. This is Eusebia’s fifth loan with MFP, and she knows that she must pay her installments on time. She hopes to do this, as she doesn’t want to cause any problems for the other members of her cooperative bank, where she is very well liked. She will use the 1,000.00 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more yarn so she can increase the production of her handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yarn.

loans.name: Pedirama

texts.en:
Pedirama B. is from the city of Gango ozamiz City. She is 34 years old. Pedirama is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Pedirama owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling snacks like rice cake "puto" and hot halo-halo "benignit" in the community. Pedirama has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pedirama joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Pedirama has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. Pedirama is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Pedirama from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products that she sells.

loans.name: Rohnie

texts.en:
Rohnie T. is a 55-year old, married woman who lives in Brgy 2, Himamaylan City, Negros, Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store and selling rice.

Rohnie’s husband, Nemerio T., is helping his wife run the business. They have five children. The four older ones are already gainfully employed and only one is left in school. All the children do their part by helping their parents run the family business.

Rohnie T. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store and selling rice. Now she earns an average monthly income of P 50,000 from her business activities.

Rohnie T. is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 was used to fund operations of her general store and rice retailing business. It has had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing P 19,500 for her 11th loan, which she intends to use for her general store and rice retailing businesses. She also plans to buy a tricycle and a rice farm in the near future. Rohnie T. is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Nkeachi

texts.en: Nkeachi specializes in the sales of electronics and cooking utensils. This is the business she's been in for a remarkable four years. However, she is itching for a significant expansion of her business. With a loan of NGN 100,000, she will purchase more electronics and cooking utensils to sell. She is married to a plumber and they have four lovely children. Her children are excelling in their schoolwork. Her youngest child is standing besides her in the picture. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics and cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 60 years old and married, with eight children between 16 and 34 years old. All of her children go to school. Justine owns and lives in a four-room house where she stays with five other people, taking care of additional family members. 

The family has three meals a day, but has no access to electricity or piped water at home.  Justine's greatest monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for children, medication and food for the family. 

Justine makes a living by selling charcoal at her home, a business she has been in for more than 15 years. She buys sacks of charcoal at home, avoiding transportation expenses.  She receives an average of 50 customers a day. Her main challenges are defaulters, the ever-increasing price of charcoal, and the rainy season -- her workplace can become muddy. She sells on a retail basis, to all categories of people. 

Justine has been with MCDT for more than 13 years.  She is servicing her 29th loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.  Her goal is to expand the business and switch to selling wholesale, rather than retail.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel G. is 48 years old and he lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area, with his wife and a son.

For about five years Samvel worked in soft drink production; for the last seventeen years he has been engaged in cattle breeding. With the profits from his stock farming, he provides for his family needs and increases the number of his cows. His wife and his son help him in his business.

Samvel needs a 1,100,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 40 years old and is married with four children who are doing well in school. She hopes to give them a quality education.

Joy sells drinks, groceries and tailoring materials at retail prices to her customers in Ibadan, Oyo State. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She is also happy because during the high season her sales will increase. She hopes to own a supermarket in her community in the future.

Joy is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Everline Kashuru

texts.en:
Everline is a 26-year-old woman married to 30-year-old Mtawali with whom she has three children aged between 7 years and 10 months.

Everline’s business is selling food in the Kibaoni area in Malindi where she targets her customers, especially in the morning for breakfast. She also practices some farming on the side and sells makuti (traditional palm-leaf roofing). 

Everline earns a monthly profit of Ksh 5,000 from her business. She plans to utilize this loan by buying farm seeds and fertilizer with Ksh 10,000, Ksh 5,000 for food supplies like flour, Ksh 2,000 for charcoal and Ksh 3,000 sauce for fish.

Everline was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is her second loan. She plans to buy a plot at Kibaoni center with the extra profits from this loan. Her dream is to be able to educate her children and invest for their future.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer plus supplies like flour, charcoal and sauce for fish

loans.name: Ferida

texts.en:
Ferida M. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts and simsim (sesame seeds) from her home and is requesting a loan to stock maize flour to sell.  Ferida is 30 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock maize flour to sell

loans.name: Bou Ndiaye

texts.fr: Bou Ndiaye S. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDOUCOURA depuis le 08 avril 2008. Elle est vendeuse de poisson frais, son lieu d'approvisionnement est Mboro un village de pêcheurs situé à une trentaine de kilomètre de chez elle. Avec son nouveau prêt elle pourra s'approvisionner en grande quantité en poisson pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle locale. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Bou Ndiaye S. is 36 years old, married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of the NDOUCOURA “Banc Villageois” loan group since 8 April 2008. She sells fresh fish, and she gets her supplies from Mboro, a fishing village located 30 kilometers from where she lives. Her new loan will enable her to bring in a large supply of fish to satisfy her local customers. Her objective is to assist her husband with the various family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her business selling fresh fish

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Elizabeth tiene una papelería y regalos llamada “La Victoria” apenas tiene un año pero tiene variedad de mercancía para vender a sus clientes. Pues ella para obtener más ingresos pone en la venta  ropa usada y también abarrotes, para ofrecer a sus 3 hijos una buena educación. 
La señora necesita de su apoyo para poder comprar mercancía para así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth has had a stationery and gift shop called “La Victoria” ("The Victory") for barely a year, but she has a variety of merchandise to sell to her customers. To increase her profits she sells used clothing as well as grocery items, so she can provide her three children with good education. Sandra is requesting the loan to purchase more merchandise and thus increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store with more merchandise

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana, de 42 años, es una mujer honesta que vive con su esposo Daniel (38), ambos tienen 4 hijos y juntos habitan  en la casa de su cuñado, pues cuidan  la infraestructura.Anteriormente vendía combustible (petróleo), en un espacio de su casa, pero al no ofrecer medidas de seguridad para su familia y sus clientes, por ser inflamable, decidió cambiar de negocio. Es así que desde hace un año vende golosinas, cervezas y bebidas gasificadas, mientras su esposo labora en el terminal terrestre de la ciudad brindando el servicio de transporte. Lo que más le gusta es atender de manera esmerada a su clientela, que siempre la visita, ya que su establecimiento está ubicado en una zona bastante turística, que empieza a promocionarse y sabe que más adelante contará con mayores utilidades de las que percibe en la actualidad, por eso quiere complementar su negocio ampliándolo hasta instalar un restaurante.Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está contenta de seguir contando con la confianza de los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son personas muy responsables y colaboradoras.Liliana tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  varias cajas de cerveza y gaseosa que necesita para surtir su negocio, pues  tiene mayores ingresos durante los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Liliana is 42 years old. She is an honest women who lives with her husband Daniel (aged 38). They both have 4 children and live together in her brother-in-law's house, in exchange for taking care of its maintenance. She used to sell fuel (petrol) from a space in her house, but since this was dangerous for her family and customers due to it being flammable, she decided to change business. She has now been selling sweets, beers and soft drinks for the past year, whilst her husband works in the city's bus terminal, in the transport industry. What she most enjoys is offering a very attentive service to her regular customers who continue to visit her, since her establishment is located in quite a tourist area. She is starting to promote herself and she knows that in the future she will make more profit than she is currently seeing, so she wants to complement and expand her business by setting up a restaurant. This is the second time she has had a MFP loan and she is happy that the members of her communal bank continue to put their trust in her, as they are very responsible and collaborative people. Liliana plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of several crates of beer and soft drinks, which she needs in order to supply her business and increase her weekend income.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer to stock her business

loans.name: Nueva Alternativa Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA”

La Sra. Rosa es una D. las participantes D. la alcancía “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA” que tiene trabajando tres años con EDAPROSPO PROSPERIDAD, cuenta con ocho personas que pertenecen a un mismo barrio. El grupo se formó gracias a una vecina del mismo barrio que sugirió a las demás vecinas sobre la organización D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD.

El nombre D. la alcancía comunal “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA” surgió con la idea D. la Sra. Maria, ella decidió proponer este nombre debido a que le trajo buenos resultados en el pasado, ella es la tesorera del grupo.

La Sra. Rosa es la presidenta tiene un año con ese cargo en la alcancía comunal y se siente muy a gusto en el puesto que tiene, siendo uno D. sus pilares D. mando la puntualidad y honestidad.

Rosa esta casada y tiene un niño D. un año D. edad, su negocio es tener una bodega. La idea D. bodega, surgió por que en la zona en donD. vive, recién se esta urbanizando y no había lugares D. compra inmediata por el cual decidió invertir en la bodega convirtiéndose en corto plazo en el monopolio D. la zona, también posee una pequeña librería, ubicado en el mismo local, anteriormente se dedicaba ha alquilar computadoras con Internet pero no le fue muy bien, con el tiempo decidió cerrar las cabinas D. Internet. A su vez se dedica a alquilar sus celulares, locutorio ambulante, para que el público haga llamadas y en su casa saca tiene una fotocopiadora con la que ofrece el servicio D. copias. 

Rosa y su esposo están pagando la construcción del segundo piso, su madre le ha regalado los aires D. su casa para que construyan el segundo piso, aparte rosa participa en una asociación para obtener su carro que es uno D. sus sueños que quiere cumplir ya desD. hace mucho tiempo. Rosa ahorra para los estudios D. sus hijos y su esposo se encarga D. pagar los gastos D. la casa como luz, agua, teléfono, etc. 
“Si tuviera una gran suma D. dinero a la mano pondría una pastelería  por que mi madre me enseñó desD. pequeña a como preparar tortas, kekes, pasteles, etc. este es uno D. sus sueños principales.

El préstamo que se la sido otorgado lo usará para comprar mas mercadería para su bodega y recargar con mas línea D. llamada sus celulares para poder alquilarlos.
texts.en:
Communal Bank “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA” Rosa is one of the participants of the communal bank “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA”, which has been working with EDAPROSPO PROSPERIDAD for three years. It has eight members who belong to the same neighborhood. The group was formed thanks to a resident of the same neighborhood who told the other residents about the EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD organization. The name of the communal bank, “NUEVA ALTERNATIVA”, was the idea of Maria. She decided to propose this name because it has brought her good results in the past. She is the group's treasurer. Rosa is the president. She has been in this position for a year in the communal bank and she is very happy with it, since punctuality and honesty are some of her basic principles. Rosa is married and has a one year old child. Her business is a small store. The idea for the store came about because the area she lives in is only reently becoming developed and there were no places to shop nearby. She decided to invest in a store and for a short time had a monopoly in the area. She also has a small bookstore in the same locale. Previously, she rented out computers with the internet but it didn't go so well for her and after a time she decided to close her internet booths. She also rents out cell phones as a street vendor, so that the puiblic can make calls and at her house she has a copier with which she offers a copying service. Rosa and her husband are paying for the construction of a second floor. Her mother has given them the space above her house so that they can build it. Rosa also participates in an association to obtain a car, which she has dreamt of for a long time. Rosa is saving for her children's studies and her husband takes care of paying the household expenses such as electricity, water, telephone, etc. “If I had a large quantity of money on hand I would open a pastry shop because my mother taught me how to make cakes, pastries, etc." This is one of her biggest dreams. . The loan has been granted to be used to buy more merchandise for her store and to purchase more time for her cell phones to be able to rent them out.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy oil, milk, rice, sugar, etc. to fill her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement to finish her house and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina S., from the village of Carinugan, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City, is 40 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business providing recycling services. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling junk and other recycled materials in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional scrap metal to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap metal to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita F. is from the town of Rizal West, San Isidro. She is 59 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she sells vegetables. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $100 a month for this activity.

In 2009, Anita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. 

Anita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials needed to provide service. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 39 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su pequeño hijo Jesús de10 años, juntos habitan en una morada ubicada en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Desde muy joven le gusto el arte, es por eso que cuando tuvo que mantener a su pequeño hijo sola, no se le ocurrió mejor idea que fabricar artesanías en vidrio. Y hace 1 año instaló su puesto de venta de todo tipo de artesanías en un mercado, en una zona bastante comercial de la ciudad, visitado por turistas;  y comparte su labor de comercialización junto a una ayudante, y así  se turnan en los horarios de atención. Dice con mucho orgullo, que atiende su negocio de lunes a viernes y durante los fines de semana se dedica por completo a producir  las artesanías en vidrio, pues le gusta darle forma al vidrio, para luego pintarlo y acabar dándole forma para que adornen las salas de diferentes partes del mundo. La buena atención que proporciona a sus clientes, le genera ganancias, que le permiten criar a su hijo sin dificultad. Como es una mujer bastante emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio ya que desea surtirlo con diversidad de mercadería para ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente para no defraudar a todas las personas que depositaron su confianza, al otorgarle el dinero que le permitirá continuar progresando. Dora tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en variada artesanía que necesita para surtir mejor su tienda y así ofrecer lo mejor a los turistas que la visitan seguido.
texts.en:
Dora, 39, lives in her own house with her 10-year-old son Jesús. They live in a dwelling located in a populous neighborhod north of the city. From an early age she liked art, which is why when she had to support her young son alone, she could not think of a better idea than making glass handicrafts. A year ago, Dora set up her stall selling all kinds of crafts in a market in a very commercial area of the city visited by tourists. She shares the work of managing the stall with an assistant so that they can take turns opening up shop. She says proudly that her stall is open for business from Monday to Friday, and weekends are devoted entirely to producing glass handicrafts. Dora enjoys shaping the glass, painting it, and finishing shaping it to produce a product that decorates rooms around the world. Her excellent customer service skills generate a good income, which allows her to raise her child without difficulty. Because Dora is such an enterprising woman, she plans to expand her business by stocking her stall with a variety of merchandise in order to offer the best to her customers. This is her first loan with Kiva Partner MFP and she promises to complete her payments on time so as not to disappoint all the people who have put their trust in her. Dora plans to invest the requested loan in buying more merchandise of varied crafts to better stock her store and offer the best to the tourists who often visit it.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more handmade crafts to improve her business

loans.name: Nazar Mai Muhammad Shafee's Group

texts.en:
N. Mai lives in Vehari, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan. She owns a house of two rooms there and has been living in it with her family for over 10 years. 

She is a seamstress by profession. She supports her family by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is a very active businesswoman and keeps herself up to date about new and coming fashions. The advantage of keeping up to date herself about new fashions is she easily understands her customers' demand for dressing and designs. Her business is going well and making her a good income every month. 

Her husband's name is M. S.. He operates a grocery shop in a nearby market, where he sells the usual grocery items to his clients. As the days are passing, he is facing tough competition with other shopkeepers because of their variety of products.  

Therefore, N. has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy grocery items such as lentils, cooking oil, spices and rice for his grocery shop and increase his sales.
   
N. is hopeful that her husband will be able to re-establish his business on a large scale and fulfill the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Alice Njeri

texts.en:
Alice, aged 40, is married with one child and lives in Uthiru, which is on the outskirts of Nairobi. Her husband John operates a butcher shop. Alice operates several businesses to earn some income for her family. Primarily she sells shoes both for ladies and men. She is also practicing farming, rearing pigs for sale, and in addition to all this she has constructed some rental houses for extra income. Alice has been in business for the last twelve years.

She has applied for a loan with which she plans to buy more shoes for sale and also purchase feed for the pigs. Her customers are mainly residents and hotels within the area. She has never borrowed from another financial institution. In the future, she hopes to run a wholesale shoe supply shop for the schools around the area.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 7 Group

texts.en:
Monette is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor 7 (Faith and Love). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children. She said her most difficult challenge is to work in a foreign country. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying attending church and singing to the Lord.

Monette is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around six years, starting with her savings of $500. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing like dozens of skirts, pants, shirts and shoes for women, men and children. She will use the profits to buy more products. She is dreaming to have more merchandise and improve her business

This Esperanza associate is one of a group formed by Haitian citizens who live in the Bateyes area around Romana's sugarcane field. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area where the economy is dominated by sugarcane and upscale tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes, miscellaneous products

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a very young man from Jabalia refugee camp. He is married and has one son. Islam started his project two years ago – he established a sheep farm in the refugee camp. Islam wants to secure his family life by enlarging the project. He came to Kiva's partner, FATEN, and took out a loan to purchase sheep to raise for sale, especially now that Al-Adha feast is around the corner and he expects demand to increase.

Islam appears in his farm in the photo.

Important information about this loan:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's FAQs.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad es una madre muy dedicada a su  familia, casada, siendo su esposo comerciante de granos básicos y albañil.
Hoy en día tiene dos trabajo uno fijo y otro la venta de tortilla que hace cuando llega de su trabajo como conserje,  ya que trabaja en turno en una cotran de buses, lo que se beneficia para palmear sus tortillas y lograr equilibrarse con su dinero.
Las mejoras la ha venido haciendo atreves de los prestamos en Afodenic, siendo una gran ayuda económica para una mejor vivienda.
Con el crédito anterior logro levantar un muro pero no lo concluyo por falta de materiales. Lo que con este nuevo préstamo seguirá con la construcción del muro en donde comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a very dedicated mother; she is married and her husband is a trader in basic grains and a construction worker.

She currently has two jobs, one is a permanent job and the other is selling tortillas, which she does when she gets home from her job where she works shifts as a janitor in a bus station, and then she starts making her tortillas. This allows her to balance out her expenses.  

Through her loans from Kiva Field Partner, Afodenic, she has received the financial help required to make improvements to her home. 

With her last loan, she was able to start building a wall, but she was unable to finish it due to lack of materials. So with this new loan, she will continue with the construction of the wall, for which she will buy: stone, sand, cement and iron.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to continue building a wall that she was unable to finish due to lack of materials

loans.name: Patronala

texts.en:
Patronala is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a clothing business, selling at the market and to neighbors. Seasonality is a major challenge Patronala faces in her business. She hopes to be self-reliant in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase three bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase three bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia R. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Amalia is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Amalia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Amalia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amalia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like bread & instant noodles. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Amalia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like bread & instant noodles

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor T. is from the town of Surallah. He is 47 years old. Nestor is married and has a 9-year-old child. To make a living, Nestor raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nestor works hard to have a stable business so he can provide for his family's needs.

Nestor joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Nestor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand it.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Simiren

texts.en:
Simiren M. N., 41 years old, is married and blessed with three children. Simiren has been farming maize in the Narok area, which is very conducive for maize farming, for the last five years. 

Simiren learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his third loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and to educate his children. Simiren's hope is to become a large scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. He says that he is a diligent man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gédéon

texts.fr: Gédéon H. est magasiner, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il a 26 ans, et célibataire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour payer les frais scolaires pour son petit frère, et louer une maison d’habitation.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de continuer à bien exercice son travail, et avoir la discipline de travail pour ne pas perdre son boulot.  Il voudrait épargner pour réserver l’argent qui peut l’aider en case d’un problème improvisé. Il voudrait aussi se marier pour fonder sa propre famille, et aider ses parents à réhabiliter leur maison.
texts.en: Gédéon H. is a warehouseman and a client of ACB since 2009.  He is 26 years old and single. He is going to use his loan to pay the tuition fees for his younger brother and to rent a house to live in. His business strategy is to continue doing his work well and have high work discipline in order to avoid losing his job. He would to put money away as savings for emergencies. He would like to be able to marry and start his own family and help his parents furnish their house.

loans.use: Pay tuition   for his younger brother and rental fees on a house

loans.name: Group Abizerana

texts.en:
Emile is 43 years old and married with four children between 2 and 8 years old. Emile is the president of a group loan called "Abizerana." The group is composed of two gentlemen and four ladies. In the photo, he is the third from the left (in the brown overall outfit). 

Emile owns a boutique and sells sugar, rice, bread, cooking oil, etc. He has been in this business for about two years and his boutique is open from 5 AM until 9 PM every day. 

He will use his portion of the loan to purchase more goods like maize flour and drinks on top of what he is selling now. Emile and his group plan to use the profits from their loans for reinvesting in their businesses.

loans.use: To expand his boutique

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, D. 64 años,  vive en su casa que es propia en compañía D. su madre, su esposo Edgar (60),  D. su hijo mayor, su nuera y su nieta, todos muy unidos habitan en un populoso barrio al norte D. la ciudad.

DesD. hace dos años esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta D. muebles D. madera como estantes, vitrinas, camas, y están ubicados en la parte D. afuera D. su casa. Dice que se le ocurrió instalar este negocio, pues la zona por donD. vive es muy comercial en este rubro, lo que le ha permitido captar buenos clientes en poco tiempo. Y  le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues lo considera tranquilo y rentable, porque aunque atienD. sola cuenta con la ayuda D. su hijo o nuera. Cada vez tiene mayor variedad D. muebles que ofrece a su clientela que la visita con frecuencia, por el buen acabado y calidad D. su mercadería. Además como es una mujer emprendedora que tiene muchos planes en mente, para más adelante quiere comprar un motocarro más aparte del que tiene para  ampliar su negocio. 

Dolores tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. materiales para producir varios juegos D. comedor (mesas y sillas), ya que tiene varios pedidos por cumplir, y así calcula que mejorara sus  ganancias.

Es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere defraudar la confianza que depositaron en ella todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero  que le permitirá continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Dolores is 64 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her mother, her husband Edgar (60), her eldest son, her daughter-in-law and her granddaughter.  They are very close and live in a populous neighborhood in the north of the city.

For two years, this enterprising woman has been selling wooden furniture such as shelves, display cases and beds which are located outsiD. her home.  She says that she had the idea of starting this business since the area where she lives is very commercial which has allowed her to attract good customers over a short period of time.  Dolores really enjoys her work as she considers it relaxed and profitable.  Although she works alone in her business, she has help from her son and her daughter-in-law.  She is gradually increasing the range of furniture that she sells to her customers who visit her frequently owing to the good finish and quality of her merchandise.  As she is an enterprising woman who has many plans, in the future Dolores would like to buy an additional three-wheeler van in order to expand her business.

Dolores plans to invest the money she is requesting in purchasing a larger quantity of materials so that she can produce dining room sets (tables and chairs) since she has several orders to fill.  In this way, she calculates that she will improve her profits.

This is Dolores' 10th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time since she doesn't want to let down all the people who have placed their trust in her and maD. possible this money that will allow her to continue working.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, tiene 65 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a una hija de 30 años de edad, tiene un negocio de venta de comida desde hace 14 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana de 5:00am a 6:00pm, este negocio viene de familia y hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades para realizarlo.
Ella está actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en compra de materiales para preparar más alimentos, esta ayuda fortalecerá el negocio manteniendo de aquellos productos como pollo, carnes, condimentos, aceite y bebidas, ya que por ellos se realiza cada día los diferentes menús.
Doña Rosa, aspira continuar en el negocio, que le provea los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos cotidianos.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa is 65 years old, she lives in El Transito, in the San Miguel department, with one daughter aged 30. She has been engaging in selling meals for 14 years, and she works every day of the week form 5 am to 6 pm. This is a family activity, and up to now she has not encountered any difficulties in her job.
She is currently requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare more meals. Her activity will be strengthened because she will restock her shop with products such as chicken, meat, dressings, oil and drinks, that she uses daily to prepare her various menus.
Doña Rosa wishes to keep on running her activity, as this provides her with the necessary income to pay for her daily expenses.
.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Hilda Mabel

texts.es:
Hilda, de 31 años de edad, reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo don Manuel y dos hijos  Maribel de 2 años y Kelvin de 6 años de edad, Hilda se dedica a la venta de Tamales, Tortillas, y también a la costura de prendas de vestir.
Ella actualmente solicita un préstamo para compra de materia prima, serian los ingredientes para hacer los tamales: maíz, leña, pollo y condimentos, esta compra mejorara su negocio y tendrá a disponibilidad los materiales para la preparación de la venta.
La aspiración de ella es poder mejorar la condición de su vivienda, por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo, para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda is 31 years old and lives in San Carlos, in Morazán department, with her husband Manuel and her two children: 2 year-old Maribel and 6 year-old Kelvin.  Hilda's business is selling tamales and tortillas, and also dressmaking.

Hilda is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies and ingredients for making her tamales: corn, firewood, chicken and condiments.  This purchase will improve her business and she will have available the materials that she needs to make her products to sell.

Hilda's goal is to improve the condition of her home, through her work and effort, so that she and her family can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, chicken and condiments

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis tiene 42 años, este es el primer financiamiento que el realiza, por lo que ha sido una gran experiencia. El se dedica a brindar servicio en un bar y comedor. Por lo que todos los días sabe que tiene que levantarse temprano y comprar los diferentes productos que son necesarios para la elaboración de los platillos que ofrece.  A pesar de ser un negocio agotador y cansado sabe que tiene que seguir luchando para sus 3 hijos, el es un buen Padre  desea que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ser personas de bien. Actualmente el solicita un financiamiento que le ayude para la compra grano básicos, verduras, frutas, utensilios de cocina entre otros.
texts.en: Jorge Luis is 42 years old.  This is his first loan and he has had a good experience with the process.  He works at his bar and restaurant and every day must get up early to buy the different products he needs to prepare the foods he offers.  Even though it is a very tiring business, he knows he must keep fighting for his three children.  He is a good father and desires that his children can study and be successful.  He is currently asking for a loan to buy basic grains, vegetables, fruits, kitchen utensils, and other items.

loans.use: To buy grains, vegetables, fruits, kitchen utensils, etc.

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Barbra has a business selling clothes, which she has had for 2 years.  She also has a second business selling shoes  

To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Barbra hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Barbra hopes to own a small retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Lorena De Los Angeles

texts.es: Lorena de los tiene su negocio que es un kiosco y está ubicado en el colegio Inatec. Hace más de 18 años que tiene este negocio, ha sido una persona  muy responsable y dedicada. Las ganas de salir adelante le han brindado la ayuda necesaria para proporcionarle a su hijo la educación necesaria. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, jugos entre otros. Su mayor desafío es mantener su negocio, pues tiene cierta competencia que son las pulperías cercanas del colegio.
texts.en:
Lorena’s business is a kiosk located at the Inatec School.  She’s had the business for over 18 years.  She’s been a very responsible and dedicated person.  The drive to get ahead has provided her with the necessary help to provide her son with an education.

The reason for the loan is to buy snacks, beverages, bread, cookies and juice, among others.  Her greatest challenge is staying in business because she faces some competition from grocery stores near the school.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, bread, cookies and juices, among others.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en: As a widowed mother of three children, Maria Elena works hard to support her family by selling used clothing and ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. Maria Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and is now requesting a new loan of  PHP 25000 to purchase more bundles of used clothes. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Wolale Bamana 5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe WOLALE BAMANA 5 est compose de femmes mariées du village de CINZARA dans la préfecture de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39  ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide du fonio et du sésame. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
BATOMA, la première à droite en écharpe jaune, compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, des semences de fonio d’arachide  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles  pour la culture, au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN et DAH et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 18000 à 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wolale Bamana 5 group consists of married women from the village of Cinzara in the San prefecture of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and are on average 39 years old with at least six children.

They grow peanuts, fonio (a West-African cereal) and sesame. To make their crop-farming profitable, group members decided three years ago to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. Having successfully repaid previous loans, they are now on their third agricultural loan cycle.

Batoma, first on the right with a yellow scarf, wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fonio seeds and peanuts for planting, small farming equipment and agricultural inputs for crop-growing, from the general market in San.

After the rainy season, crops are stored for a while so that they can gain value before being resold at the general market in San, Dah and in surrounding markets, retail (often in bulk) against cash mainly to customers coming from large towns.

After selling their agricultural products each member of the group hopes to achieve profits between 18,000 and 75,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay loan interests and cover ongoing family expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 57-year-old businessman who does quarry mining.  He is a widower with three children. He has been in the business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES.10,000 which he uses to meet all the basic needs of his family. 

He is applying for a second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Peter will use the loan to pay laborers.  With the anticipated profit he will purchase fertile land for farming. 

His hope and dream is to relocate his family to a better place.

loans.use: To pay laborers

loans.name: Erneste

texts.en:
Erneste is 30 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 8 years old. He sells sorghum, Irish potatoes and beans from 8 am until 9 pm every day. He has two years of experience in his business and he currently employs one person to help him.


Erneste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more sorghum, Irish potatoes and beans that will allow him to expand his business. With his profits, he will reinvest in his business and pay his children's school fees and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more sorghum, Irish potatoes. and beans for resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has 8 children. She makes kenkey to sell at Abura.  In the picture, she is showing the soaked corn to be washed and milled into dough for the kenkey.

Ekua's husband is a driver.  She uses her income to assist him in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase more corn to prepare kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further educate her children.

loans.use: buy more corn to prepare kenkey for sale

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a la venta de frutas, es casado y vive con su esposa y una nieta, él tiene 12 años de estar en la venta de frutas dedicándose a tiempo completo, realiza las ventas de forma ambulante ofreciendo cocos, sandia, naranjas y bananos.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cocos y sandia, este préstamo le ayudara para incrementar el negocio, y por consecuencia aumentar las ventas y sus ingresos.
Su aspiración es mantener el negocio en buenas condiciones, apoyar a su nieta para que pueda prepararse profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Juan makes his living selling fruit.  He is married and lives with his wife and a granddaughter.  Juan has been in the fruit selling business for 12 years, full-time.  He sells his fruit on the street offering coconuts, watermelons, oranges and bananas.
Juan is requesting the current loan to purchase coconuts and watermelons.  This loan will help him to expand his business, and to consequently increase his sales and earnings.
Juan's aspirations are to keep his business in good condition and to support his granddaughter in her professional preparations.

loans.use: to stock up his business with the purchase of coconuts and watermelons.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
To earn a living, Anita owns and manages a general store in the village while her husband cultivates their rice field. She is 29 years old and has one school-ages child. 

Despite the hardships of life, Anita works hard and strive for more. She aims to improve her general store to make it a stable source of income to support their family needs. She is asking for a loan of P 15,000 to buy bread, soft drinks, beverages, candies and frozen foods to sell in the village. She hopes that her patience and hard work will help her to achieve her business goal someday.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, beverages, candies and frozen foods to sell in the village.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candies, snacks and manure for her gladiolas.

loans.name: Lhamhuu

texts.en: Lhamhuu is 48 years old and lives with her children and husband in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a pastor at the local Christian church. Her eldest daughter is a college student and the others are in high school. She started her business in 2009 by selling second-hand clothes. She used to rent a small commercial space at the local market but now she has extended the commercial space. She plans to continue her business in the future. She is a diligent woman who says, "Having a bigger commercial space really helps your business and increases your profits." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 27 years old, a married lady blessed with one child. She sells used clothes in Malindi. The lady has been in this business for the past two years now and she earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000 which she uses to support  her small family as well as using some of it to run her business. 

Margaret has applied  for a loan of KES 30,000 through KADET LTD and this serves as her first loan from KADET LTD .She intends to use the loan  amount to buy additional stock of used clothes for sale due to the rise in her clientèle in the region. 

The client wishes to use some of her anticipated profit to continue running her business as well as continue saving a portion of it so as she will be able to run her own boutique in future.

loans.use: To buy additional  stock of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Miriam Laura

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Miriam Laura; ella tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, chompas, polos, blusas entre otras prendas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, casacas, polos y blusas al por mayor.   
                                                                                     
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Miriam Laura belongs to the communal bank "Banco de Desarrollo."  This bank is located in the Cusco district, in the province and department of Cusco.

Miriam Laura is 42 years old, married, and has a child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling clothing.  She sells pants, sweaters, polo shirts, blouses, and other garments.  She works from 8am until 7pm, and through this work she provides for her children.  Miriam Laura wants to expand her business selling clothing.  She requests a loan to buy pants, jackets, polo shirts and blouses at wholesale.

Miriam Laura is pleased to have this loan, and is committed to making all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy pants, jackets, polo shirts and blouses at wholesale

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is from the village of Didi Jikhaishi in West Georgia. He is 39 years old, unmarried, and lives with his family –  his parents, 2 orphan nieces (17 and 14 years old) and a 7-year-old nephew.    His elder niece is a student and the younger children also go to school.  All three of them receive orphans’ pensions from the Georgian Government. Koba’s parents are retired and also receive pensions. 

Koba is leading the agricultural business for his family. He works hard on the family farm. They have 3 milk cows and 2 calves. Koba sells on average 60 kg of cheese per month at the local market.  They also have a pig and sell 8-9 piglets per year. Along with the abovementioned, the family members grow maize on 1.25 hectare of family-owned land.  The harvested crop is used for feeding domestic animals.  The total average monthly income for the family (including the pensions from Koba’s parents and the orphan children) is 675 Laris (approximately 400 USD).
