Koba requested credit to purchase a milk cow. He will produce and sell approximately 35% more cheese and increase the income for his family. He will use the increased income to improve the living conditions of his orphan nieces and nephew.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: El Limoncito Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El limoncito” esta integrado por nueve mejeres emprendedoras y responsables, el grupo volvi a renovar su credito, el cual la señora Maria Elena ya no prticipo sin embargo tienen una nueva integrante la señora Maribel.
Maribel  tiene 35 años D. edad está casada con el señor José quien trabaja en el campo, juntos han procreado 5 hijos, Miriam D. 15 años D. edad ya no pudo seguir estudiando por falta D. dinero, Luis Manuel D. 13 años que esta en la secundaria, Álvaro D. 11 años esta en sexto año, Isaac D. 9 años pero se encuentra en cuarto grado D. primaria y Maribel D. 8 años segundo D. primaria.
La señora Maribel es ama D. casa, su actividad ganadera es criar borregos en la actividad lleva ya 2 años D. experiencia por el momento en casa tiene 5 borregos esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 2 o 3 borregos mas ya que quiere llegara tener mas también comenta que si le sobra comprara pastura, desparacitantes y vitaminas.
Su único problema que tiene es cuando los animales legan a enfermar ya que se llegan a morir pero esta  vez hará todo lo posible para que no le vuelva a pasar.
Una meta que tiene doña Maribel es que sus hijos terminen D. estudiar y que su hija Miriam vuelva a estudiar la prepa, también desea llegar a tener su propia casa propia.
"Gracias al crédito hemos podido salir adelante y mas que nada nuestra calidad D. vida ha mejorado y todo gracias a FRAC y KIVA"
texts.en:
The “El Limoncito” [The Little Lemon Tree] group is maD. up of nine enterprising and responsible women. The group renewed its loan again. Maria Elena didn't participate this time but there is a new member named Maribel.

Maribel is 35 years old and married to José, who works in the fields. They have 5 children. Miriam is 15, and couldn't go to school anymore due to a lack of money. Luis Manuel is 13 and in high school, Álvaro is 11 and in sixth graD., Isaac is 9 and in fourth graD., and Maribel is 8 and in second graD.. 

Maribel is a housewife and her activity is raising sheep. She has 2 years experience doing this and at this time has 5 sheep at her house. This time she has asked for the loan to buy 2 or 3 more sheep, since she wants to have more. She also remarks that is there is enough, she will also buy fodder, D.-worming medicine and vitamins.

Her only problem is when the animals get sick because they can die but this time she will do everything to avoid that happening again. One goal that Maribel has is for her children to finish their studies and for her daughter Miriam to go back to high school. She also wants to own her own house. 

"Thanks to the loan, we have been able to get ahead and more than anything, our quality of life has improved and it's all thanks to FRAC and KIVA"

loans.use: to buy 2 or 3 sheep, fodder, grass cuttings, corn and de-worming medicine.

loans.name: Kenzhekan

texts.ru: Кенжекан 37 лет, замужем и имеет четырех детей, старшая дочь замужем, остальные - школьники . Ее муж Алтынбек  работает строителем, а в свободное время помогает Кенжекан по бизнесу. В 2001 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Кенжекан начала заниматься торговлей женской одеждой на местном рынке. Хороший ассортимент товара Кенжекан, приветливое обслуживание, практичные советы при подборе одежды привлекают  все больше и больше клиенток. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кенжекан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров за счет закупа женской одежды осенне-зимнего периода.   Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на ремонт своей квартиры.
texts.en: Kenzhekan is 37 years old, married and has four children.  Her oldest daughter is married, and the rest of the children are in school.  Her husband Altynbek is a construction worker and helps Kenzhekan with the business in his spare time.  In search of finding an additional source of income, Kenzhekan became involved in selling women's clothing at the local market in 2001.  Her wide assortment of merchandise, friendly service, practical advise with clothing selection attract more and more clients.  In order to further grow her business, Kenzhekan requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her merchandise assortment by buying women's autumn and winter clothing.  She plans to use the profits from this loan to make repairs to her apartment.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, a 35-year-old married mother of two children, has been operating a small retail shop for the last four years, earning a monthly profit of KES 4,000.

Introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, she is applying for her second loan of KES. 30,000 to purchase additional stocks of tea leaves, sweets, and maize flour for sale. Lydia will save the anticipated profit and help pay her children's school fees. In future, she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, sweets, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shell crafts business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafts business.

Lolita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell crafts business.

loans.name: Twisakilala Group

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Mwajabu has been involved in poultry and pig husbandry for the past ten years. This happy-go-lucky mother of eight makes a weekly income to the tune of UGX 180,000.

Mwajabu's first business undertaking was tailoring. She is now casting her mind to the future, with hopes of expanding her business in terms of sales to Kampala, which is a far bigger market for what she sells. She is hoping this Kiva loan will come in handy in this regard. She plans to use her loan to purchase more poultry and pigs to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and pigs to resell

loans.name: Meldante

texts.en: Meldante is 26 years-old, married and has two children. For the last five years, he has had a hog-raising business. He earns about P2,500 per piglet. At present,  Meldante wants to borrow a loan with a total amount of P10,000 in order to purchase feed, vaccine and vitamins for his hogs. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further growth of his business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Assiba Irène Théodora

texts.fr: Mariée, Assiba vit en location avec son enfant. Coiffeuse de profession, elle y associe la vente des mêches, défrisants et autres dans une boutique de sa localité. Pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et maximiser son profit, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro-crédit à Finadev afin de satisfaire la demande de ses clients et de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Assiba is a married woman who rents a place with her child. A hairdresser by trade, she has included the sale of hair extensions, hair straightener, and other products in her salon in town. 

To increase her sales and to maximize her profit, Assiba requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev to meet the demands of her customers and to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 hair extensions, 20 lengths of cloth, and 10 cosmetic items

loans.name: Eva Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Eva Maribel tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 5 hijos.
Eva Maribel se dedica a la produccion y venta de nacatamales y golosinas, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, El credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de los nacatamales.  
Tiene muchos clientes ya que sus ventas las realiza en una empacadora de camarones. 
Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en: Eva Maribel, 35, is married and has five children.  She works making and selling "nacatamales" [tamales wrapped in banana leaf] and sweets.  She has been doing this type of work for two years.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make the nacatamales.  She has a lot of customers because she makes her sales in a shrimp packer.  Her goal is to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, meat, vegetables, firewood, and condiments.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a fifty-six-year-old married man with twelve children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling fish for six years. He started with 200,000 shillings and now has 3,800,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are unseasonable weather, taxes and inadequate capital to purchase enough stock. His personal goal is educating his children while his business goals are diversifying his business and expanding his business into new markets.The sacks contain dried fish that is transported from lake Victoria to Kasese.
Samuel wants money to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald will use this loan to do general repairs of his motorcycle. He is twenty five years old and married with one child. He is involved in a motorcycle transport business which he started two years ago with an aim of taking good care of his family and his aging mother. He was inspired to start this business by his friends and seeing how they were developing themselves from this type of business.

He decided to leave formal employment and engage in this business to develop himself too. Since he works for himself, Gerald usually loses out when he falls sick or loses his relative because he parks his motorcycle to be there for his people.

He is thankful to Kiva for the funds availed to him which allowed him buy a sofa set for his sitting room.

loans.use: to do general repairs of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Gafio

texts.en:
Mr. A. Gafio lives in Glidji with his family. Married and the father of four (4) children who are all in school, he works in agriculture because he inherited land from his parents. As an illiterate, he practices subsistence agriculture for survival. His wife and sometimes his children help him in the fields. For the coming harvest seasons, he has requested a credit of $500 to buy jute bags for storing his produce, and plant health products to better conserve his produce. This will help him to better enjoy the fruits of his labor and to produce more income resources for the education of his children.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Gafio vit à Glidji avec sa famille. Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants tous scolarisés, il a pour profession l’agriculture car ayant hérité de la terre de ses parents. Analphabète, il s’adonne à une agriculture rudimentaire de subsistance. Sa femme et parfois ses enfants l’aident dans les travaux champêtres. Pour les prochaines campagnes agricoles, il sollicite un crédit de $500 pour acheter des sacs de jutes pour stocker sa production, des produits phytosanitaire pour une meilleure conservation de ses produits. Ce faisant, il pourra mieux jouir des fruits de son labeur et dégager un revenu conséquent pour assurer une meilleure éducation de ses enfants.

loans.use: to buy jute bags for stocking his production, plant health products

loans.name: Desislava

texts.en: Desislava P. is 34 years old and lives in Ihtiman, Sofia district. She is divorced and has a 7 year old boy. She started her business in the middle of 2003 when she has lost her job. She founded a small confectionary workshop in her grandmother’s house. During the first six months the business was going well but later because of the competition in the region Desislava has to quit this kind of business. In the summer of 2006 she started business again and opened a gift shop on the main street of Ihtiman. This shop has benn open for four months.  Now Desislava P. needs a $1200 loan for working capital – for new variety of gifts that she offers in her shop.

loans.use: For working capital – for new variety of gifts for her shop

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Rosa María is 40 years old, she has three children, and her husband works as a bus driver in the city. She embroiders pillow cases, small decorative cloths, napkins, scarves, and sweaters. Also, in order to increase her income, she works as a maid for a family. She also plans to buy shoes to sell to people in her community. She is part of the “Morning Flower Group 2”.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

RASA MARIA TIENE 40 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS, SU ESPOSO COMO CHOFER DE TRANSPORTE COLECTIVO DE LA CIUDAD. ELLA SE DEDICA A BORDAR FUNDAS PARA ALMOHADA, TAPETES DECORATIVOS, SERVILLETAS, BUFANDAS, SWEATERS. TAMBIEN PARA INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS TRABAJA EN UNA CASA PARTICULAR COMO SIRVIENTA. ADEMAS TIENE COMO PERSPECTIVA COMPRAR CALZADO Y VENDER CON LA GENTE DE SU LOCALIDAD. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO FLOR DEL AMANECER 2.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials and to buy shoes to sell in her community

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is a woman who has been working in salons for most of her life. She wants this loan  to increase her income and expand the business. She plans on buying larger amounts of product for her to be able to sell more on a single trip. Her son helps her by buying the products for her in the city. She sells to her neighbors and the people in her community called La Cola. Amelia is married and has 8 children.

loans.use: To buy hair products for her to resell

texts.en: M. is member of Yamida. She is 38 years old and married with two children. She lives in Bogor, Indonesia with her husband. To supplement her husband's earnings, she began running a  small business selling food and beverages. From her business, M. gets a profit $5-$10. She has handled the business for 18 years and now she needs $125 loan to expand the business.

loans.use:
$50 will be used to buy more goods
$50 will be used to buy more food products
$25 will be used to buy beverages

loans.name: Ni Ketut Rahayu

texts.id:
In her older age, Ni Ketut Rahayu and her husband Nengah Wiriyana still work hard to make the ends meet. All their children are married. With loan from Dinari, Ni Ketut Rahayu can buy items for her food mart. She buys rice, sugar, spices, snacks and beverages. Everyday, Ni Ketut Rahayu starts at 7AM. She starts with cleaning up the shop, arranging the items and managing the stock. If she ever runs out of supply she then go to the market and buy. Before getting the loan, Ni Ketut Rahayu's profit was 25,000-30,000 IDR. After getting the loan she could earn 30,000-50,000 IDR (1USD~9,000 IDR)

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dalam usia yang sudah tua, Ni Ketut Rahayu dan suaminya Nengah Wiriyana tetap bekerja keras untuk mencukupi kebutuhan hidupnya. Semua anak-anaknya sudah berumah tangga. Dengan modal yang di pinjam dari Dinari, Ni Ketut Rahayu bisa melengkapi kebutuhan warungnya. Adapun barang yang dibeli seperti beras, gula pasir, bermacam bumbu dapur, makanan ringan dan minuman. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Rahayu memulai pekerjaannya jam 7 pagi. Hal pertama yang dilakukannya adalah membersihkan warung, menata barang dagangan dan mencatat stok barang sehingga kalau ada barang yang habis bisa segera baru kepasar. Sebelum mendapat pinjaman, keuntungan Ni Ketut Rahayu Rp.25.000,- sd Rp.30,000,-. Setelah mendapat pinjaman modal, keuntungan yang diterima Rp. 30.000,- sd Rp.50,000,-.

loans.use: To add working capital for more variety such as rice, oil, spices and snacks

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: I am Rubina B. from a small semi-urban Raiwind, around 50 kilometers away from Lahore, second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four children: three boys and one girl. My eldest son attends school and is in grade two. The others are not school age yet.  I sew clothes on order from neighborhood clients, and my husband operates a grocery store. He started this store with the loan we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. Our store does well and therefore we managed to offer PCO services at our store. We need to further expand our business for which we would like a loan of $350. My husband plans to buy stock of various items with this money.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Balli

texts.en: Khanikishiyeva Balli is 35-year-old woman who has been selling dairy products for five years in her IDP settlement in Bilasuvar region . She sells milk and yogurt to the local bazaar traders and sometimes to neighbors. Her business is the only income source in her poor family. She tries very hard to cover her family's needs. She is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase on milk cow and two calves so she can improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase two baby calves and one milk cow

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs Prom N E., 57, is a farmer and earns around two dollars a day. Her husband, Mr. Pen Horm, 62, is also a farmer. He earns about two dollars per day by selling the crops to a nearby market. They have four children. Two of the children work in the factory and their salaries are between $80 to $90 each a month. The other two are students.

This couple will use the loan to purchase fertilizer to improve the rice crop quality and increase the yield of their soybean plants.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for rice crops and soybean plants to improve quality and yield.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 23 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, 1 1/2 years old. Farida is a timber seller, she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Farida has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more timber for her business.

loans.use: To buy more timber for her business.

loans.name: Masaidi

texts.en:
Masiadi is 40 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 12, 8, and 3 years old. Masaidi has been a cloth seller (Khanga) since 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business.

loans.name: Irma's Group

texts.es:
Marleni, Irma and Maribel are members of the Ccatun Sacha Community Bank, meaning «Great Tree» in the quechua language.

Marlenis lives with her common law spouse, is 24 years old and has 2 kids. Marleni sells fruits from house to house in her neighbourhood, a job that she keeps from Monday to Friday. Marleni also sells clothing, and school bags on Saturdays and Sundays in the San Juan market.

Irma is married, she is 24 years old and has 2 kids. Irma sells prepared foods at the final stop of a transport company, and she also sells clothing on credit to clients that she knows well.

Maribel is a single mom, is 27 years old and has 1 child. Maribel sells cosmetics by catalogue and she also works in a drug store.

Marleni, Irma and Maribel request loans in the amounts of 800 soles, 1600 soles, and 200 soles to invest in the purchase of school bags, fruits, kids clothing, slacks, soft drinks, cosmetics and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Marleni, Irma y Maribel son socias del Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha que significa “Árbol Grande” en quechua.

Marleni es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Marleni vende frutas de manera ambulatoria cerca de su casa, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes. Además Marleni vende ropa, mochilas los días sábados y domingos en la feria de San Juan.

Por otro lado Irma es casada, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Irma vende comida en el ultimo paradero de una empresa de transportes, además Irma vende ropa a crédito que reparte a clientes ya establecidos.

Mientras que Maribel es madre soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Maribel vende cosméticos por catalogo y además Maribel trabaja en una botica.

Marleni, Irma y Maribel necesitan préstamos de 800 soles, 1600 soles, 200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de mochilas, frutas, conjuntos para niños, pantalones, gaseosas, cosméticos y perfumes.

Los sueños de Marleni, Irma y Maribel son tener un negocio grande, una vidriería, una tienda de ropa y sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Marleni, Irma and Maribel  request loans in the amount o 800 soles, 1600 soles, and 200 soles, monies that will be invested in the purchase of school bags, fruits, children's clothing, slacks, soft drinks, cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo is 46 years old and lives in the Jonathan Gonzalez neighborhood. He is married and has three children, only one of whom is independent while the others are in his care. His wife washes and irons clothes so that she can help her husband with the living expenses. Leonardo has five years experience working as a security guard for a private company. His dream is to be able to give his children a better quality of life, as well as provide them with a university education, which they will need. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase construction materials to build a wall behind his home, which will provide greater security to his belongings.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Leonardo tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Jonathan González, es casado y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales uno es independiente a ellos, y tiene a su cargo a los dos menores. Su esposa se dedica a lavar y planchar ropa, para poder apoyar a su marido en los gastos del hogar. Don Leonardo tiene 5 años de desempeñarse como guarda de seguridad en una empresa privada. Sus sueño es poder darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, así como también poder darles la educación universitaria que van a necesitar. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro, necesario para la parte delantera de su vivienda, para darle mayor seguridad a sus pertenencias.

loans.use: Build a wall behind his home.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha belongs to the Tulipanes Village Bank.

She is married, is 37 and has 3 children. She has a clothes workshop in a rented place. She makes and mends clothes. Martha changed of place 2 months ago and thus improved her sales. She also sells spare parts she purchases in Lima and then sells in her store. She began doing this because her husband is a mechanic. She realizes both activities in the same place.

Martha needs a 1600 soles loan to buy different types of spare parts.

She would like to extend her business, to have a bigger store and hire people to help her.

Click here to see Martha's first loan.

loans.use: Martha needs a 1600 soles loan to buy different types of spare parts.

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Mrs. Ton P., 24, a farmer who lives in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province, grows rice on her farmland and earns approximately $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Nov Khoeurn, 26, sells pieces of wood that he finds in the forest to customers in and around his village. A hard worker, he earns approximately $2 per day. They have two children, both of preschool age. Because of transportation difficulties, Mrs. P. is now requesting a loan of $500 to purchase two buffaloes to transport the wood to her husband’s customers with the remainder of the funds being used to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop. This loan will help to increase the family's income and raise their standard of living.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase two buffaloes to transport wood as well as buy fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana baji is the wife of S. A. and lives in Gujranwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last 15 years. She has three children, and the two oldest are enrolled in a school in her neighborhood.

Rehana baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). With the first loan, she bought a sewing machine to stitch clothes and her husband started a furniture-making business. At that time, their monthly income was $118. Her husband saved almost $790 from his furniture-making business. He decided to invest this amount to become a partner in his uncle's lathe business. S. A. started earning almost $80 per month from the lathe business.

Rehana baji is a housewife and she continues sewing clothes because her children attend school, and she wants to give her children a better education and a good future. Therefore, she is applying for another loan to buy material (wood, glue, tools) to expand her husband's furniture-making business.

loans.use: Buy materials for furniture-making business

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip D. is 48 years old, married and has 5 children.  He has been involved in fish farming for the past ten years, and says that this business is a very lucrative one. Some of his children are currently in secondary school while the other children are getting admission to university. 

Due to the capital-intensive nature of fish farming, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $450 to buy more fish food and more fish for rearing purposes. He says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more fish food and fish stock to rear

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Edoh K. est un revendeur des produits phytosanitaire âgé de 47 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. C’est un commerce florissant pour lui car la concurrence n’est pas aussi rude dans ce secteur. Il veut contribuer à la prospérité de son affaire en gagnant la confiance de ses clients  et désire par ce crédit renforcer son  fonds de roulement .Avec cette chance de Kiva, il pourrait désormais faire face à la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus exigeante, gagner plus d’argent et par conséquent améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Edoh est celui habillé en chemise bleu du côté gauche. La seconde personne est un client.
texts.en:
Edoh K. sells phyto-chemicals for farms. He is 47, married, and the father of 4 children. His business is booming since the competition is not bad in this sector. He would like to contribute to the prosperity of his business by gaining the confidence of his customers and with this loan, he wants to bolster his working capital. With the good fortune to be able to post on Kiva, he will from now on be able to meet the needs of his clientele who are more and more demanding. He will earn more money and thus be able to improve living conditions for his family. Edoh is the one wearing a blue shirt on the left in the photo. The other person is a customer.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing phyto-chemicals for farmers

loans.name: Kiri Ewala Group

texts.en:
K. Mastula is the chairperson of Kiri Ewala loan group in Katwe, Uganda. She is a very hard-working lady who has a business selling mattresses and beds, both metallic and wooden, to her customers from her rented space in Katwe. She has had the business for over 25 years. Ever since she joined her lending group in 1978, the loans have pulled her through, and this time around, she wants to buy more mattresses from the factory for sale. 

Mastula is a single mother of 4 children who are all in school. She is also the caretaker for her late sister's child. Her lending group is so good that she says she has no plan of ever deserting it.

loans.use: Mastula will buy more mattresses to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
“I dream of having a chain of bakeries someday. In this way I will be able to send all of my children to any college they choose to attend," says Marissa A., a 34-year-old mother from Trento, Agusan Del Sur. Her husband helps her manage their business and joyfully fulfills whatever dreams she has for the family.

Marissa and her husband started the bakery business in 1992.  Now, they need additional capital to increase their production to compete well with other bakeries. She needs a loan of $150 to purchase ingredients for making bread, to accommodate the increase in customer orders.

CEVI has always supported Marissa in her business and provides her with the credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage she needs.

loans.use: Purchase flour and other ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Ramazan

texts.en:
Ramazan Q. is 42 years old and is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, tea, and many others in his grocery store, which he built five years ago. 

Currently, Ramazan has about $1000 USD of goods in inventory. His monthly net profit is about $150. Ramazan is requesting a loan of $1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, sacrifice, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. 

One of his dreams is that his children progress in their studies. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Madame Djeneba Traoré est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mère de (3) trois enfants et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux et  ses enfants. Cette femme est  installée au quartier Guegneka dans la ville de Fana relevant de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.
Madame Djeneba Traoré na pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons d’ordre familiale. Elle aidait sa maman dans les activités domestiques et économiques. Après plus de 13 ans au service de sa mère, elle décida de s’installer  à son propre compte et cela dans la vente de poisson fumé (qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa belle mère) et du miel. Elle est installée sous un grand hangar dans le grand marché de Fana.
 Pour obtenir des ressources financières complémentaires et supporter la concurrence de plus en plus rude, elle a décidé d’intégrer le programme de microfinance   Soro Yiriwaso.   
Après  8 prêts  de groupe avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle se propose d’acheter avec ce prêt : 400 kg de poisson fumé  à partir de Mopti pour être revendu à Fana au comptant ou en crédit, en gros ou en détail à une clientèle  constituée d’hommes et de femmes. 
En partance pour Mopti pour son réapprovisionnement elle achète du miel à Fana pour le revendre au comptant à Mopti aux grossistes. Cela lui permet non seulement d’éviter le transport de l’argent liquide mais aussi de diversifier son activité afin d’avoir plus de bénéfice.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 40 000F CFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour  aider son mari.
texts.en:
Mrs.Djeneba Traoré is 47 years old. She is the mother of three (3) children and lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children. Djeneba is located in the Guegneka neighborhood of the city of Fana, prefecture of Dioila, in the region of Kouilikoro, Republic of Mali. Mrs.Djeneba Traoré did not have the opportunity to attend school due to reasons of priority, within her family. She assisted her mother in domestic and business activities. After 13 years of assisting her mother, she decided to set up her own business selling smoked fish (an activity she learned from her mother-in-law) and selling honey. She set herself up in the large open hanger at the central market in Fana. Facing increased competition and to secure additional financial resources, she decided to join the micro-finance program at Soro Yiriwaso. After completing eight group loans, with a neighborhood loan group, she is now on her fourth individual loan. All these loans have been duly repaid. With this loan she wants to buy; 400 kg of smoked fish to be purchased at Mopti and resold in Fana for cash or credit. She will sell in either wholesale or retail lots, to a clientele of both men and women. When she travels to Mopti to replenish her provisions, she buys honey in Fana to be resold for cash to the wholesales in Mopti. This allows her to carry less cash during the trip and also diversifies her business activity to earn additional profit. She expects to realize a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA which she will use to assist her husband.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of smoked fish

loans.name: Nancy Edith

texts.es:
Nancy tiene tan solo treinta y cinco años pero todo un proyecto de vida casi realizado. Ella es madre de tres hijos, uno de diecinueve, el segundo dieciséis y el ultimo de ocho años. Hace un tiempo se encuentra separada de su esposo pero eso no es un obstáculo para el cumplimiento de sus metas personales.
Con la venta de quesos y carnes empezó adquirir cierta experiencia en el comercio. Luego de un par de años decidió asociarse con su hermano para abrir un taller de repuestos de carro. Ella Nancy tenia ahorrado un pequeño capital y su hermano aporto la experiencia en el rubro de mecánica. Hoy en día ya han cumplido tres años vendiendo repuestos. 
Con el fin de obtener un ingreso a aparte para solventar los estudios de Electricidad mecánica del mayor de sus hijos, Nancy no dudó en emprender un nuevo negocio, pero esta vez por su cuenta. Hace un año y medio ambientó un espacio de su casa  para abrir una pequeña bodega donde hoy vende todo tipo de abarrotes.
Más adelante, su meta es abrir junto con su hijo un a tienda de mecánica propia, para independizarse de su hermano y progresar más.
texts.en:
Nancy is only 35 years old, but has almost completed her entire life plan. She is the mother of three children--a 19-year-old, a 16-year-old and an eight-year-old. She separated from her husband some time ago, but this is not an obstacle to achieving her personal goals. By selling cheese and meat, she began to acquire some business experience. After a couple of years, she decided to partner with her brother to open a car repair shop. Nancy had saved a bit of capital and her brother contributed his experience in mechanics. Now, they have been selling replacements for three whole years. In order to obtain the funds to send her eldest son to school for electrical mechanics, Nancy did not hesitate to start a new business, this time on her own. A year and a half ago, she set aside a space in her house to open a small shop where she now sells all kinds of groceries. Later on, her goal is to partner with her son in their own mechanic shop to become independent from her brother and progress even further.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is engaged in hog raising and direct selling businesses. Since her income from hog raising is only every four months, her income from direct selling is used for an allowance for her daughter and to feed her hogs.

Her eldest child had to stop studying due to lack of financial resources. She and her husband are doing their best to provide a better life for their family. This is the reason why she wants to borrow PHP5,000 in order to increase her business capital to improve her small businesses. She is hoping that through her businesses, she could send her son to school to pursue his studies for a better future.

Cecilia J. is 44 years old and married to Simon, a farmer. Their two children are: Ferdinand - 18, high school graduate and Nancy - 15 years old, a fourth year high school student.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Мардонов Олимджон проживает  в районе Варзоб. Возраст 42 года, женат и имеет семерых детей.В семье работает один и приходится работать очень много, для того, чтобы обеспечить такую большую семью.Работает таксистом по маршруту Душанбе_ Варзоб. Кроме того, уже три года работает с пчелами. Имеет хозяйство и несколько семей пчел. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить сахар и дополнительную семью пчел. Это поможет ему увеличить хозяйство и таким образом увеличить получаемый урожай меда.
texts.en:
Olimjon lives in the Varzob region. He is 42 years old, married and has seven children. He is the sole support of his family and has to work a lot to support such a large one. He drives a taxi on the Dushanbe-Varzob route. In addition, for the past three years he has kept bees. He has a farm and several swarms of bees. He turned to us for a loan in order to purchase sugar and additional swarms. This will help him to expand his farm and thus increase his honey harvest.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar and additional swarms of bees

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married. She sells clothing at a market located close to the city bus station. Ludmila has been in this business for four years and is a hardworking person. She has been able to develop the business well and it has become a stable source of income for her family.

Ludmila would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to increase her assortment. She hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothes for sale

loans.name: Munhzaya

texts.en:
Munhzaya D. lives with her husband and three teenage children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All three of her children are local high school students.

Munhzaya has a small retail business selling clothing. She rents a small stall in the local market and sells various women’s and men's clothes. She usually buys clothes from Beijing, China. She started her business in 2000, and since then has done very well. Her business capital has increased from 500,000 MNT to 4,000,000 MNT ($1  is approximately 1,400 MNT). She has been running her business for almost a decade and is great at picking clothes that are in demand.

In the future, she would like to own her shop, instead of renting a stall in the market. She requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime tiene 50 años, y aunque el tiempo ha pasado, no ha perdido las ganas de salir adelante, vive solo en su propia casa, ya que sus hijos se hicieron independientes rápidamente. El trabajo que realiza actualmente le brinda muchas comodidades, se dedica a repartir licores a tiendas y bodegas en los distintos distritos de Puno, sus productos los compra de una distribuidora local, es por eso que siempre tiene mercadería para llevar y cubrir los pedidos que le hacen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite viajar por toda la región de Puno, conociendo nuevos lugares. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y espera en el futuro comprar su propio auto para trasladar sus productos, ya que la que usa actualmente es alquilado, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es subir y bajar las cajas de la movilidad, ya que esto le resulta muy cansado. Este es el quinto préstamo de Jaime con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy responsable. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería, para así tener más productos para vender.
texts.en:
Jaime is 50 years old, and although time has passed, he has not lost his determination to get ahead. He lives alone in his own house, as his children became independent very quickly. The work he does now brings him many comforts. He distributes liquors to stores and warehouses in different districts of Puno. He buys his products from a local distributor, so he always has merchandise on hand to fill his orders. What he likes most about his job is that it allows him to travel all around Puno, getting to know new places. He has been doing this work for four years, and hopes to buy his own car in the future to move his products, as the one he uses now is rented. The most difficult part of his job is loading and unloading the boxes from the vehicle, as it leaves him very tired. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He hopes to be punctual in his repayments so he doesn't cause any problems for his communal bank, in which he is very responsible. With this loan of 3,000 soles, he will purchase more merchandise so he can sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S., 29, a motor-taxi driver, has one young child and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife, Chea Sophy, a garment factory worker. Their combined income of around $8 each day supports both their household and their parents.  Bun is asking for a loan of $1000 to repair his house as the roof leaks during the rainy season.

loans.use: To repair leaking roof.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: Marcos Tulio es soltero, de 42 años de edad, tiene 3 niñas las que estudian la secundaria, es trabajador del Hospital La Esperanza, Rama, como agente de seguridad con 15 años de servicio, habita en su casa con sus 3 hijas, ya que su compalera trabaja en el Tortuguero y casi no llega a casa por la lejania, el asume los gastos de sus hijas. Esta solicitando su credito# 8 que utilizara para la construccion de un anexo (cuarto) cuyas medidas son: 6x9 con el objetivo de dar mas privacidad a sus hijas, el credito anterior tambien fue utilizado para mejora de vivienda, pero no logro hacer mucho porque el credito fue de C$.15,000.00, con este piensa realizar la construccion. Este cliente se ha destacado por su responsabilidad y su buen record crediticio, pues sus creditos siempre los paga por adelantado.
texts.en:
Marcos Tulio is single, 42 years old and has three daughters studying in high school. He works as a security guard at La Esperanza Hospital in Rama and has 15 years experience. He lives in his home with his three daughters, and since his former partner works in Tortuguero and almost never comes home because of the distance, he is responsible for providing for the girls. He is requesting his eighth loan, which he plans to use for the construction of a 6-by-9 room to give more privacy to his daughters. His previous loan was also used to improve his dwelling, but he was no able to achieve much because it was for C$15,000. With this one, he thinks he can carry out the construction. Marcos Tulio has stood out for his responsibility and his strong credit record, so his loan are always paid in advance.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room in his home

loans.name: Diama

texts.fr: Diama K. est une mariée de 37ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de charbon de bois et d’huile en détail. Elle voudrait assurer une bonne scolarité et une meilleure santé à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Diama K., age 37, is a married woman and the mother of six. She does commerce in charcoal and in oil at the retail level. She would like to ensure that her children have the right schooling and better health.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in charcoal and oil

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru: Махмудова Нури , женщина торгует 1001 мелочами на Панчшанбе базаре. Товар она закупает на оптовом рынке Афганбазар.  В период кредитования она увеличила свой товарооборот и улучшила финансовое положении семьи. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить полиэтиленовые пакеты и благодарит инвесторов за поддержку.
texts.en:
M. Nuri is a woman who sells one thousand and one things on the Panschabe market. She buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Afganbazar. She has increased her turnover during her credit history and improved the financial situation of her family. She wants to use the loan to buy plastic bags and is thanking all the lenders for their support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic bags

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Tania Morrobelo (fourth from left) is a mother of three who runs a beauty salon business from her home in the Dominican Republic. She has found her business to be quite successful, and is now taking out her 10th loan with Esperanza. She loves her business and is able to support her children, ages 18, 15 and 13. The 18-year-old is currently attending classes at the local university, and Tania hopes that her other children will want to follow this example.

With the profits from her business, Tania has been able to buy new equipment such as extra seats – and has also been able to make critical home improvements. With the help of the growth from previous loans, she has bought plates and decorations, and put in a bathroom.

Tania hopes in the future to have her own beauty salon outside of her house in its own location – and would love to see her one salon spread into several others in the area.

Thank you for this Kiva loan!

loans.use: scissors, shampoo, and other beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 31 years old, married and the mother with no children. She had a child but died when she was a kid and since then she is been expecting one but has been very difficult for her to conceive. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of assorted fishes and chicken and a refrigerator to stock her goods. 

She started her fresh fish business two years ago in the community where she lives. She serves her customers with very tasty and good quality  of fish and frozen chicken and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She runs a mini cold store where she sells fresh fish and chicken. She has a high customer base; some of her customers travel from the nearby villages to buy her fish. She takes delivery of fish from Dwinase, which is a nearby busy market. 

It is her dream to be a larger supplier of frozen food in the community and its environs. She has a strong belief that when she is fully resourced, her dream will be fulfilled.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fresh fish and a refrigerator

loans.name: Veronica De Los Angeles

texts.es: Verónica de los Ángeles B. está casada con su esposo Mario por lo que juntos tienen 3 hijos a su cargo, ambos con muchos esfuerzos tratan de salir adelante para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día. Verónica se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 9 años que trabaja en este negocio, por lo que le ha ido muy bien y ha sido muy beneficioso. El sueño de Verónica es tener un restaurante ya que a ella le gusta mucho cocinar, además este sería un gran negocio en su comarca. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas en general, refrescos naturales, pan, jugos y gaseosas.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire B. is 31 years old and is married with five children aged 3 through 12 years. She lives in Burera district, Northern Province, Rwanda.

Marie Claire has been in the potato business for three years and she employs four people from her local community in her shop. Work begins at her business at 4 a.m. each day, lasting until 4:30 in the evening.

Marie Claire is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company so that she can buy larger quantities of potatoes and, she hopes, secure better pricing. This will allow her to serve her existing clients better and to attract new customers as well.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of potatoes

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long P. is a 48-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang province. She is married to Mr. Bunthoeun, age 39, who works with her in the farming business.

This couple owns a cultivating machine that they use for their farming. In addition, they use their machine to plow a nearby farmer’s farmland for profit.

Unfortunately the machine has often broken down during the plowing process.

Because of this problem, Long P. would like a loan to purchase spare parts in order to replace a part of the cultivating machine.

Long P. was not available on this day so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for their cultivating machine.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam M. N. is a married, Tanzanian, small-business woman with three school children. She runs a foodstuffs shop at Yombo Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of foodstuffs including maize flour, wheat flour, beans, sugar and cooking oil.

Mariam purchases her business goods from the wholesale shops and from the foodstuffs suppliers. She has been in the business for seven years and she needs a loan of Tsh 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio H. P. de 41 años de edad, reside en San Martín, departamento de San Salvador, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad. El tiene un taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir, negocio el cual es la única fuente de ingresos para sostener a su familia. Julio solícita un préstamo través del cual pueda comprar tela, hilo, botones y  todo tipo de productos para la elaboración y venta de ropa. Julio es un hombre muy honrado el cual anhela ver mejor a su familia y ver a sus hijos superarse, es por ello que tiene todas las intenciones de sacar adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
Julio Hernandez P. of 41 years of age, lives in San Martin, in the province of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and two sons, aged 11 and 8. He has a clothing shop business, which is the only source of income to support his family. Julio is requesting a loan through so he can buy fabric, thread, buttons and all kinds of products for making and selling clothes. Julio is a good man who yearns to improve the livelihood of his family and wants to see his children succeed. That is why he has every intention of succeeding in his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make clothing for sale

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en: Edwina M. is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Edwina owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Edwina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Edwina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Teressa

texts.en:
Teressa C. is from Gango Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old. Teressa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teressa makes and sells snack food like hot cakes, ice candy, and candies in the community. Teressa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Teressa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teressa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Teressa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Teressa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Buta

texts.en:
Buta E. is currently in the business of selling maize flour, sim sim (sesame seeds) and other products, and is requesting a loan to purchase dried cassava flour to sell.  Buta is 40 years old and is married to a peasant. She has eight children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to purchase dried cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia se dedica a  comercializar ropa en la comunidad de Caranavi, zona tropical de  los Yungas, a cinco horas de la ciudad de La Paz; su esposo es transportista Inter provincial; así consiguen sus ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de su familia, tienen 2  hijos con las edades de 7 y 4 años  .Viven en alquiler en Ciudad Satélite de la  ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de más ropa para continuar su negocio.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio-económico le permite acceder a dicho préstamo.
texts.en:
Lucia sells clothing in the town of Caranavi which is located in the tropical area of Los yungas. It's five hours from the city of La Paz. Her husband is an inter-state truck driver. This is how they earn a living to maintain their family. They have two children ages seven and four and live in a rented place in the Ciudad Satelite neighborhood of El Alto. The loan is meant for the purchase of clothing to keep her business going. Her first loan with Impro, and a socio-economic analysis, allow her access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing at wholesale to sell in  the communiy of Caranavi, 5 hours from La Paz.

loans.name: Productoras Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal de “Productoras”, está en su primer ciclo en el centro focal de Panamericana, son ocho mujeres que se dedican a trabajos como: venta de comida, mantillas, zapatos, pescado,ventanas metálicas, costura de todo tipo de prendas. 

Rosemery Q. T., socia de 25 años de edad, casada con una pequeña niña, lleva adelante el negocio de elaboración de chamarras, poleras y cargadores de bebés. Ella comparte el negocio con su esposo, que se encarga de vender lo producido.  Ahora ella está trabajando con la ayuda de un par de personas.  Sus materiales son comprados de los distribuidores de la “Ceja”, Ciudad de El Alto o de Galerías de Tela que se encuentran en la Ciudad de La Paz.

Cuando se le preguntó que le gustaría aprender, ella dijo sonriendo:  “quiero aprender a  hacer polleras”, las que usan las cholitas
texts.en:
The "Productoras" communal bank is in its first loan cycle within Panamericana focal center; they are 8 women who are involved in various lines of work like: food sales, sale of mantillas, shoe sales, fish sales, aluminum window sales and clothes-making. Rosemery Q. T., 25, is married and has a small daughter. She makes jackets, skirts and baby carriers. She shares the work with her husband who is the one in charge of sales. She now has a couple of assistants to help her, too. She buys her supplies from distributors in La Ceja, in El Alto or in Galerias de Tela, in La Paz. When she was asked what she would like to learn, she said with a smile: "I want to learn how to make skirts like the ones the native women wear."

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, clasps.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He has been working as a farmer raising cattle for the past 12 years. He learned this occupation from his father. In 2004, he opened his own cattle farm and started producing dairy products such as milk, yoghurt, cheese and labneh, a special Lebanese food product. He delivers his products to the food market and also directly on customer request.
Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $800 USD to buy a special milk machine in order to improve his services and increase the liquidity of his business.

loans.use: To buy a special milk machine

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Née en 1964 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, M. Antoinette est mariée à ASSOTO Théophile et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais parmi les trois enfants, un n'est plus à la charge de Antoinette. La famille vit au quartier Abokicodji à Cotonou. Antoinette vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les différentes charges des enfants. Pour y arriver, Antoinette vend du pain et divers produits (conserves, lait, pâtes alimentaires, papiers hygiéniques, etc.)à son domicile. Antoinette se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits, qu'elle a bien remboursés. Antoinette voudrait renforcer son activité et augmenter le stock de ses produits, afin de mieux répondre à la demande des clients et se faire plus de revenu pouvant l'aider à soutenir son mari dans le ménage. C'est pour cette raison que Antoinette sollicite un cinquième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Antoinette M. is married to Théophile ASSOTO and is mother of three children, all having attended (or still attending) school. One of the three children is no longer under her care. The family lives in the Abokicodji neighborhood of Cotonou, and Antoinette assists her husband with the various children-related expenses. To make ends meet, Antoinette sells bread and various products from her home (canned goods, milk, pasta, toilet paper, etc.). She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. She is a regular client of ALIDé, having already been granted four previous loans, all reimbursed in full. She would like to strengthen her activity and increase her stock supply, in reaction to customer demand. She also wants to generate more income to help her husband with household expenses. This is why she is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bread and various products (canned goods, milk, pasta, toilet paper, etc.)

loans.name: Koinet Ole

texts.en:
Koinet Ole N. is 29 years old. He is married to Nalotuesha N. and he is the father of one child aged 2 years. Koinet owns a piece of land that he has farmed for the last five years now.

Koinet learned about KADET from other members within his area who are already registered as clients. This will be his first loan. He is planning to plant more wheat on a bigger farm than the one he is currently farming because wheat has proved to do well in his area. With the profits he hopes to make, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

Koinet’s future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more wheat and other farm produce on a large scale.

Koinet believes he is hardworking and he only needs resources to attain his goals.

loans.use: To increase his wheat farming by hiring an extra piece of land

loans.name: Deri

texts.en:
Deri R. is currently in the business of selling bread, ice cream, mangoes, etc.,  and is requesting a loan to stock onions and tomatoes to sell.  Deri is a 19-year-old single woman.  She has children who go to school.  With the extra profits that she could earn from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a restaurant and a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Hou

texts.en: Hou L. is a 41-year-old mother blessed with two teenage kids, one of whom works sewing clothes in industry, while the other one attends school. Hou L. was married, but divorced her husband when her kids were young. To pursue a daily income, Hou L. works as a requirement laborer. She is always hired by people to do things to help their needs. Hou L. and her employed child always find it hard traveling to work or anywhere else, because they don’t have their own vehicle. Thus, Hou L. has requested a loan to buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida D. is from the village of Boyogon, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Aida is widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the buying and selling of copra in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase more copra and as additional working capital. Aida is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Aida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of 3 fields of manioc.

loans.name: Sayie Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group, Mohamed S., is a 47-year-old and is married with seven children. He was born in Port Loko, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Mohamed is a businessman who sells shoes and ready-to-wear clothes. He has been running this business for twenty years now. 

Mohamed and his colleagues in the group have come together to form a group in order to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, each of these entrepreneurs will be able to add more goods to his/her business, make more sales, more profit and consequently improve their living conditions.  Mohamed will use his share of the loan to buy shoes and ready-to-wear-clothes wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: Buy shoes and ready-to-wear clothes for resale

loans.name: Valentin Vidal

texts.es:
Valentín tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito pesquero de San José, ubicado dentro de la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas diez años a la comercialización de pescado seco – salado, el adquiere pescado fresco a los pescadores de la zona y luego la procesa en la playa, cuando el producto ya se encuentra listo lo vende a los diversos comerciantes que ofrecen este producto en los mercados de la zona, a veces también sus vecinos llegan a su casa para adquirir su mercadería.

Valentín nos cuenta que esta actividad le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su familia durante las temporadas de veda ya que su actividad principal es la pesca industrial. 

El desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas pescado para procesar y de ese modo aumentar sus ventas y sus ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Valentín siempre está buscando la manera de obtener ingresos para hacer progresar a su familia. El ya ha tenido préstamos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Valentin is 53 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives with his family in the fishing district of San José, located in the province of Lambayeque, some 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years, he has sold salted dried fish, acquiring fresh fish from the zone's fishermen and then processing them on the beach. When the product is ready, he sells it to diverse merchants who offer his fish in regional markets, At times, his neighbors also come to his house to acquire his merchandise. Valentin says that selling salted dried fish helps to pay the family's expenses, including during the closed season, even though his principal activity is industrial fishing. He wants to expand his business by buying more fish to process and in this way, to augment his sales and earnings. To reach this objective, he has thought it pertinent to request a loan of 2,000 new sols from EDPYME Alternativa. Valentin is always looking for a means of obtaining income to help his family progress. He has already had loans with our Institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FRESH FISH FOR PROCESSING AND SALE AS SALTED DRIED FISH

loans.name: Elijah Tama

texts.en:
Elijah has been offering haircut and hairdressing services in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  He is 38 years old, married to Esther Njeri and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He paid his previous loans of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) and Kshs 50,000 well and on time. He plans to use the proceeds from this new loan to re-stock his shop with cosmetics.  He will use some and sell some.

Elijah hopes to grow in this industry and open a training institute in hairdressing.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for his shop

loans.name: John Mukhono

texts.en:
John L. is 45 years old and is married to Everline Mukhono who is 42 years old. They have four children: the first born is Fexil, 25 years old; then Agnes, 20 years old; Benson, 18 years old; and the last born is Ephaim, 16 years old. John and his family live in the Morongiot area of Vihiga. His wife owns a retail maize shop and the profits made are mostly used to support the family.

John is a carpenter and has been in this business for the past eleven years.His workshop is in Vihiga town and he currently has some orders from his clients that he needs to work on.

John needs money to purchase wood for his carpentry work and he is applying for his 3rd loan from KADET after successfully completing his second one. He intends to use the profit made, to expand his business and be comfortably able to pay his children’s school fees. 

John’s main hope is to establish a carpentry training workshop. He also has a desire to buy a piece of land that he will use to build a permanent home for his family.

loans.use: To purchase wood for his carpentry work

loans.name: Julia Silvania

texts.es:
Julia de 54 años, tiene una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierras y montañas.     

Tiene 21 años con su papelería para solventar los gastos familiares ya que es viuda y poder pasar tiempo con sus dos hijos. comenzó a vender papelería en su casa a sus vecinos, poco a poco construyo la parte delantera de su casa en un local. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am. 

Pero para continuar trabajando en su negocio ella necesita comprar con el préstamo una papelería. En el futuro quiere ampliar mas su negocio para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia , 54, has a paper goods store in the front part of her house. She lives in a periurban zone in El Paraíso, Guayaquil, an area noted for its unpaved, hilly streets. She’s had the store for 21 years to help meet family expenses since she’s a widow and wants to be able to spend time with her two children. She started out selling paper goods from home to her neighbors and gradually built a space for it in the front part of her house; she opens for business at 8am. To continue working she needs a loan to buy stock items. In the future she’d like to expand her business still more to insure a good future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For stationery items, notebooks.

loans.name: Dilaram's Group

texts.en:
Dilaram J. is the leader of the group. She is 38 and married. She has a daughter and two sons. All the children are at school.  Dilaram works as a cashier and her husband is a truck driver. Dilaram applied for the loan because they need money to repair the truck. With money received from the loan she will purchase truck tires and a battery. In the future Dilaram wants to build a shop near the house and start selling convenience goods.

Nazgul K. is the treasurer of the group.  She is 35 and married. She has a daughter and two sons. All the children study at school. A year ago, with the initial investment of 3000 soms, Nazgul started to sell shoes at the market. In this way she makes 3000 soms per month. Her husband works as a taxi driver and when he is free he helps Nazgul with her activity. Nazgul hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase more shoes in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the near future she plans to purchase a container and then start repairing the house.

Zumrad K., 39, is married.  He has a daughter and a son. The son is at school and the daughter is not yet at school.  Zumrad works as a driver and his wife is a teacher at school. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase cement, windows, and paint in order to repair the house.  In the future he wants to open an auto repair center.

Almazbek A., 22, is married. In order to make money, he works in construction. He is also engaged in livestock breeding. He started to breed livestock two years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms, and now is selling some animals after fattening, making 5000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan he wants to purchase two farm animals for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase truck tires and a battery.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married woman living in Lebanon. Since 2008, after finding it hard to satisfy the family's needs, she decided to open her own business to help her husband. She opened a mini market in addition to adding a corner where she sells gifts and gadgets. She is thankful for her decision to start a business. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new merchandise to increase her sales and therefore her income. In the future, she is planning to open a formal gadget store to sell her products.

loans.use: purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos en el sector Huaca Partida, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Pítipo y que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de cuarenta y cino minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, ella cría ovejas en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio y las alimenta de pastos naturales. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive y al publico en general. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Susana desea adquirir mas ovejas para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los que piensa lograr su objetivo.

Ella ya ha tenido créditos anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas. Susana es una mujer tranquila y responsable. En la imagen aparece junto con un cerdo que cria adicionalmente, sus ovejas salen a pastar por la mañana.
texts.en:
Susana is a Mom, she is 50 years old and she lives together with her husband and one of their children in the Huaca Partida region. It is a rural region belonging to the district of Pitipo and it is located in the province of Ferrenafe. It is located more than forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

For more than ten years she has been a sheep farmer. She raises sheep in a corral near her home and she feeds them natural grasses. When the livestock has reached a certain level in their development she sells them to the merchants who visit the region and to the general population.  With the income that she earns from this business she is able to contribute with her husband to the financial support of their family. 

Susana wishes to purchase more sheep in order to expand her business. To this end she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles. 

She has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa and she has demonstrated her commitment and responsibility towards her payments. Susana is a calm and responsible woman. In the photo she appears together with one of the pigs she raises too. The sheep go to the pastures in the morning to feed.

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Wan Word Women Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Wan Word Movement” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 400,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Kadiatu N. K. is the leader of this group. The forty-year-old is married to a trader and they have two children. Kadiatu sells palm wine and cigarettes. With her share of the loan, she will buy gallons of palm oil to sell.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Leida

texts.es: Leida Nubia M. T., tiene 29 años de edad, se dedica a la distribución de comida criolla hace 10 años en  la excelente Soda Tapia, ubicada en Upala de Alajuela. Al obtener este primer crédito invertirá en un congelador y una urna que mejorara la disposición de los alimentos y beneficiara la calidad y el servicio de su negocio. Para lo anterior, solicita un préstamo es de ₡604.000 (seiscientos cuatro mil colones). Es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 empresas asociadas por EDESA, por lo que desea ser responsable con la misma.
texts.en:
Leida Nubia M. T. is 29 years old and has been selling food for ten years at Soda Tapia, which is located in Upala de Alajuela. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of 604,000 CRC to invest in a freezer and a storage case to help her preserve the quality of her food and provide better service.

Leida is part of the Canalete Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA. She wants to be a responsible member.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer & a storage case

loans.name: Tuinuane Group

texts.fr: Katungu S. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Tuinuane,  âgée de 42 ans, mère de 5 enfants Son mari est infirmier.
