Elle fait le petit commerce de vente des épices, tomates, arachides, oignons, tangausi.  Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari, il ya 4 ans. Elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ en 2010. Elle installe ses produits  au marché cental de Virunga. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  en huile végétale, tangausi, tomates, etc. En plus, elle ambitionne  augmenter son épargne à 1000$ enfin d’ouvrir d’autres activités génératrices de revenu. La cliente Katungu S. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe Tuinuane est composé de 38 membres.
texts.en: Katungu S. is an entrepreneur and president of the Tuinuane group. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children.  Her husband is a nurse.  She is involved in the business of selling spices, tomatoes, peanuts, onions and ginger.  She started her business with her own money given to her by her husband four years ago.  She received a loan of $50 from the IMF Hekima in 2010.  She displays her products at the main market in Virunga.  This new loan will help her to secure supplies of vegetable oil, ginger, tomatoes, etc.  In addition, she plans to increase her savings to $1,000 in order to start other money-making ventures.  Client Katungu S. thanks Hekima for their work which helps those who are excluded from the traditional banking system.  The Tuinuane group is composed of 38 members.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil, ginger, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Dominique

texts.en:
Dominique is a 48-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four children, who are between 14 and 20 years old. Dominique's husband works for the government.

She is now in her third year of business, and she explains that she works from 7 am until 6 pm every day. Dominique is requesting a loan in the amount of $875 to purchase more wedding clothes for re-sale purposes and to hire a new employee. Any profits she generates as a result of this loan would be reinvested back in her business to ensure that it continues to do well.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional wedding clothes and by hiring an employee

loans.name: Francis Waithaka

texts.en:
Francis, age 39, is married to Sophia who is a farmer.  Together they have four children aged seven, nine, 13 and 17 years old. He is a farmer dealing with both animal sales and crop farming. He buys sheep and feeds them with the intention of selling them later at a profit. Most people buy sheep for their meat as well as for the wool. Therefore, this is a profitable venture. 

Francis was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by a friend. Francis has been running this business for 12 years and he finds it profitable.This is the first loan he is getting from KADET and he intends to buy a dairy cow to suppliment the family income. 

If the loan improves the business, he will use the proceeds to expand his trade and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Robert Lampeshua

texts.en:
Robert  Lampeshua P.  is 32 years old. He is married and supports four people in the family. Robert has been buying and selling sheep and cattle for the last seven  years.

Robert learned about KADET LTD from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to use to buy more animals for sale. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to expand his business. His future dream is to be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can rear animals. His hope and dream is to become a large scale businessman. Robert is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to buy more animals

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane K. is a married lady. Her husband is a driver and they have three children aged between twenty nine years old and twenty one years old. Jane owns a tailor shop at Jogoo Market in Nairobi. She makes clothes for ladies and children. She has been in this business for nineteen years now. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more materials to increase her business and meet the demand of her customers. In future, she hopes to better her living standards. She describes herself as humble and resilient.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials

loans.name: Taroci

texts.en:
Taroci is a 38-year-old lady who runs a vegetable sprout business. She is married to Joseph, 49 years old and has been blessed with 3 children namely: Feby, 15 years old who is in the third grade of Junior high school; Astrid, 10 years old who is in the sixth grade of Elementary school; and Bastian,who is 1 year old.

Taroci makes a living from selling sprouts. In running the business, Taroci is assisted by her husband whose legs are handicapped. In a day, they are able to generate income between IDR 25,000 to 35,000. She feels that her income is very little, and not enough to meet the daily needs of her family as well as her children's education needs.  She said that in the dry season, she faces the difficulty of getting water for the sprouts. As a result, the production of sprouts decreases during the dry season and it  automatically effects her income. To overcome this situation she said that she needs a water reservoir to save water for the sprouts and to buy more containers for her sprouts. Besides selling sprouts, she also wants to buy other types of vegetables and cooking spices to be sold in order to increase her income.

To implement her plan, Taroci is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. She really hopes that TLM could help her in improving her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and cooking spices to sell

loans.name: Poala Maria

texts.es:
Paola Chávez hace 6 meses puso un local donde la mama y vende camisas, vestidos, blusas etc. Trabaja ella sola desde las 8:00am hasta las 18:00 pm. 

Unas de sus obstáculos es la delincuencia en el sector. Es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos (7, 6, 1) y estudian en escuela fiscal. Con el préstamo va a comprar camisas, perfumes y juguetes. Unos de sus sueños para los próximos 5 años es tener un bazar más grande y que satisfaga a las necesidades de los clientes
texts.en:
Six months ago, Paola Chávez started a business selling t-shirts, dresses, blouses, etc. She works on her own from 8am to 6pm. 

One of the obstacles to her business is crime in the area. She is a single mother and has children (7, 6 and 1), who study at the public school. With this loan she will purchase t-shirts, perfumes and toys. One of her dreams is to have a larger business within the next 5 years, and to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: Shirts, perfumes, and toys

loans.name: Mathurin

texts.fr:
Jeune homme de 41ans, marié, père de deux enfants dont l’âge varie entre 5 et 11ans.

Depuis 5ans, il exerce la vente en alimentation et divers sur étalage dans un grand marché de la place. Par jour, il a des ventes  de 80.000F à 150.000F par jour.
 
Avec le prêt qu’il va recevoir, il  achètera :
    1 sac de sucre,  1sac de riz, 1carton des détergents, 1carton des boites de conserves, 1carton de boites de lait concentré, 1carton de spaghetti, 1carton de litres d’huile  2cartons des savons de lessives et de toilettes.

Il compte beaucoup vendre afin de générer plus de revenus, faire des bénéfices considérables pour soutenir  la scolarité de ses enfants et  améliorer leurs conditions de vie.
texts.en:
This young man is 41 years old and married with two children aged 5 and 11. For the past five years, he has been selling food and various items which he displays at the grand market of the area. His daily sales range from 80,000 to 150,000 F.

He plans to use his loan to buy one bag of sugar, one bag of rice, one carton of detergent, one carton of canned goods, one carton of condensed milk, one carton of spaghetti, one carton of liters of oil, and two cartons of laundry and toilet soaps.

He expects his sales to reach a high volume in order to increase his revenue and earn substantial profits to support his children’s education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar, as well as cartons of canned goods, soap, milk, oil, tomatoes, toilet paper, and detergents

loans.name: Susana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Susana, de 38 años de edad, reside en Delicias de Concepción, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vive con sus cuatro hijos: Adolfo de 26 años de edad, Elizabeth de 14, Raquel de 10 y Gerson de 6 años de edad. Ella se dedica al negocio desde hace tres años, posee un puesto en la calle sobre el mercado de San Francisco Gotera, su dedicación al comercio nace por la necesidad de obtener dinero para cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la reparación del vehículo donde transporta la mercadería del negocio, ya que últimamente está presentando desperfectos mecánicos y es un riesgo para ella continuar transportándose así.
Este préstamo le ayudara a cubrir este gasto y contar con un vehículo en buenas condiciones; el objetivo de Susana velar por las necesidades del hogar y sacar a sus hijos adelante con estudios superiores que les ayude a superarse.
texts.en:
Susana is 38 years old and lives in Delicias de Concepción, located in the Department of Morazán, with her four children: Adolfo (26), Elizabeth (14), Raquel (10) and Gerson (6). She has worked selling fruits and vegetables for three years and she has a street stand near the San Francisco Gotera market. She works in this business because she needs to earn money to cover her childrens’ needs.

She is requesting a loan to repair the vehicle that she uses to transport the merchandise for her business, as it has been having mechanical problems lately and it is risky for her to continue traveling like this. This loan will help her to cover this expense in order to have a vehicle in good condition.

Susana’s goal is to look out for the household’s needs and to get her children ahead in life with post-secondary studies.

loans.use: to repair the truck she uses to transport merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Mary Joy Beth

texts.en: Mary Joy Beth Q. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Mary Joy Beth is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Joy Beth runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and gasoline by the liter. Mary Joy Beth has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Mary Joy Beth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy Beth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mary Joy Beth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Mary Joy Beth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen N. lives in the Kanyanya neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (including a grandson). Allen has a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Allen has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerycans of cooking oil. The main business challenges for Allen include intermittent electricity, transportation, and the ever-increasing prices of commodities. Her goals are to own a wholesale shop and to build rental rooms. 

Allen lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, medication, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: San Geronimo Group

texts.es:
el grupo San Geronimo esta ubicado en la aldea San Geronimo de la Ciudad de Choluteca y esta integrado por tres personas, las cuales se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y son vecinos de dicha aldea. Ellos se han formado en grupo para solicitar un credito para invertirlo en sus negocios, doña Daisis tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Concepcion y Benedicto se dedican a la cria y venta de cerdos.
la meta de ellos es hacer crecer sus negocios y que estos les generen buenas ganancias, las que necesitan para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
todos en sus tiempos libres visitan la iglesia.
texts.en: The San Geronimo Group comes from the village of San Geronimo near the city of Choluteca. The group is made up of three people who have known each other for many years and are neighbors. They formed the group to apply for a loan so that they can invest in their businesses. Mrs. Daisis has a small grocery story in her house, and Concepcion and Benedicto raise and sell pigs. Their goal is to grow their businesses and earn more profit, so that they can cover their household expenses. In their free time they all attend church.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, butter, oil, beans, bread, coffee, cookies, milk, sausages, and pigs.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is from the village of Milanid Talinga, Leon B. Postigo. She is 43 years old, married and has five children. To make a living, Sabina operates a business manufacturing charcoal from coconut shells. She is a charcoal maker. Sabina has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Sabina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Sabina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more coconut shells for her charcoal business. This will be the second loan taken out by Sabina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.
 
About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To  purchase more coconut shells for her charcoal maunfacturing business

location.town: Sindangan-Milanid, Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zambo

loans.name: Sharafat

texts.en:
Sharafat is an honest and hardworking wife. She is the loving mother of three girls. Since childhood Sharafat has been interested in business. For 15 years Sharafat has been running her fabric business. Her older daughter helps her with it. Sharafat wants to provide for her children’s needs. Sharafat has requested a loan of 13,000 TJS to purchase woman’s fabric, food and clothes. Sharafat is thankful to the lenders who support her.      

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is 37 years old, married to Micah, and supports a family of five. She has been in the farming business for the last 10 years with a monthly income of about KES 5,000 (~$55)

She has applied for her third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET, which she plans to use to purchase dairy cows and farm supplies for her family farm. Loice paid the previous loans well and in good time. 

This will help to increase her earnings. Her future plans are to expand her business and be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows and farm supplies.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea is 30 years old and married. She lives in Kompong Speu Province. She is a local cultivator, and she has only one child who attends school. Mrs. Chea generates an income of approximately $2.50 per day from her current occupation. Her husband is a car repairman in the community and earns average of US$ 13 each day to support his family. 

Mrs. Chea will use the loan to build a new fence in order to maintain safe living conditions for her family. Her old fence has been broken for a long time, but she doesn’t have sufficient money to rebuild it. That is the reason why Mrs. Chea made the decision to borrow some funds from Kiva, partnered with HKL.

loans.use: to build a new fence.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba prepares banku and fish to sell in Abura. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Araba has been selling banku and fish for 3 years. She responsibly assists her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish and ingredients to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: buy more fish and ingredients to make banku

loans.name: Unity Women Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the “Unity Women” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and profit from their hard work. 

Adama is the leader of this group. Adama was born in the village of Mamusa. She is 50 years old and married with 3 children. Adama sells palm oil and soaps. With the help of this loan, she is going to buy more gallons of palm oil to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 55 years old and married with seven children. Claudia works very hard to provide for them. 

Claudia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase inventory. 

Claudia has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, drinks, and other groceries. 

Claudia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Luz Edith

texts.es:
Luz es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Cuenta con educación superior técnico (incompleto).
Desde hace tres años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que incrementó al capital de su negocio de compra y venta de  artículos artesanales.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, comprará bayetas (telares) para sus tejidos, realiza bordados de paisajes, cojines, etc.
En el negocio le ayuda su esposo quien también trabaja en construcción civil.
Su sueño es ser mayorista e incrementar grandemente sus ventas.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo en períodos cortos.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli” (Juli Women to Progress) communal bank located in Juli District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department.  She’s 22 years old, has a spouse and two children.  She went to a technical high school but did not complete it.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last three years.  Her first loan was for 200 new soles that she used to increase her working capital buying crafts to sell. She will use this new, 300 new sol, loan to buy flannel fabric for her cloth work; she does embroidered scenes, cushions, etc.

Her husband, who also works in civil construction, helps her in the business.  Her dream is to become a wholesaler and greatly increase her sales.  What she likes about the communal bank is the short term loans.

loans.use: to buy flannel.

loans.name: Chhieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhieng, 39, is a kind resident in the Kompong Speu Province of Cambodia. Together with her husband, who is a rice farmer, she has raised four children, none of whom are married yet. To help the family’s income, her daughter is employed as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh where she can earn $70 per month, and the other three kids are attending school. 

To improve their living standards, Chhieng and her family would like to purchase a motorbike. To fund this purchase, she has decided to borrow from Kiva's partner, HKL. She hopes that this loan will give her family happiness and prosperity. She is very grateful to all kind lenders that help her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her family

loans.name: Sirere

texts.en:
Sirere is 40 years old. He is married and a father of two. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last 4 years. He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence.

This will be Sirere's first loan which he will use to buy wheat seedlings for planting and fertilizer. He hopes to use the profit acquired from the loan to purchase more land for farming, to increase wheat production, and educate his children. 

Sirere hopes to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a plot. He is a hardworking man who can do more if supported.

loans.use: To prepare his wheat farm

loans.name: Olga Desideria

texts.es:
El señor Olga Desideria es casada, tiene 28 años de edad, cursó el cuarto años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijos que esta estudiando, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la tejeduría, inició como operaria y lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para la compra de un telar ya que quiere incrementar su producción en su propio negocio, espera en el futuro ver un negocio estable.
texts.en: Señora Olga Desideria is married, 28 years old, and completed 4 years of primary education. She has a son, who is at school. Olga dedicates her time to taking care of the household and to weaving, which she started doing as a loom operator and now has 3 years' experience. She is seeking a loan to buy a loom, because she wants to increase her production and turn her weaving into her own business. She hopes that in the future she will see it become a viable business.

loans.use: To buy a loom

loans.name: Faroles De Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Deyaniris es la coordinadora del Grupo Faroles D. Esperanza y esta ubicado en la ciudad D. Santiago, la segunda más granD. del país en población y actividades económicas, desD. donD. cada uno D. estos 10 miembros se dedican a realizar sus actividades D. negocio, ofertando a sus clientes productos y servicios tales como: ventas D. ropa, salones D. belleza, venta D. calzados, cosméticos, productos D. belleza, tienda D. comestibles, entre otros. 

Deyaniris realiza ventas miscelaneas desD. zapatos, ropas, cosméticos, hasta accesorios y Ropa interior. Lleva con su negocio alrededor D. 6 meses, el cual inicio con el primer préstamo que tomo en Esperanza Internacional, siendo este ultimo su segundo préstamo y lo invertirá en la compra D. estos productos para aumentar sus ventas. Lo beneficios obtenido planea re invertirlo en su negocio y ahorrarlo.

Deyaniris es una joven - madre, tiene dos hijos, D. los cuales solo uno D. ellos vive con ella. Su reto mas difícil es terminar sus estuD., y sus pasatiempos favoritos son bailar, realizar deportes y ver televisión. Uno D. los sueños mas anhelado es poder terminar su carrera universitaria y comenzar a trabajar en ella.
texts.en:
Deyaniris is the coordinator of the Faroles D. Esperanza group, located in the city of Santiago, the second largest city in the country in population and economic activities.  All ten members of this group work on their own business activities, offering their customers products and services such as clothing sales, beauty salons, shoe sales, cosmetics, beauty products, grocery stores, and others.

Deyaniris sells various things, from shoes, clothing, and cosmetics to accessories and underwear.  She has had the business for about six months.  She started with the first loan she got from Esperanza Internacional.

The current loan is her second one, and she will invest it in buying these products to increase her sales.  She plans to reinvest the profit she makes in her business and savings.

Deyaniris is a young mother with two children, one of whom lives with her.  Her most difficult challenge is to finish her studies.  Her favorite pastimes are dancing, playing sports, and watching television.  One of the dreams she most yearns for is to be able to finish her college education and begin to work in that field.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfume, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is divorced and has 2 children. She sells frozen fish, meat, chicken and eggs at Takoradi, which she has done for 5 years. The earnings she makes from selling frozen foods is used to educate her children. Margaret will use the loan to procure chicken, fish and meat to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Margaret plans to buy land.

loans.use: to procure chicken, fish and meat to sell.

loans.name: Marciliana

texts.en:
This is Marciliana, 44, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines.  She is married and mother to three children.  She and her husband manage their household while operating a variety business.  She works hard to provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Their variety store is a small convenience store, that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to neighbors.   It is, for example, the place to buy shampoo, cooking oil or an egg.  She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling retail.

Her store is located adjacent to her house.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her store.  Marciliana expects a boost in her business income as she expands. 

Marciliana hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good, high quality education through all of her hard work.  

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-------------------------------------------------------------

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with no children. She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Rukia has operated a vegetable and dried fish stall for the past three years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation and dreams of expanding her business.

Rukia plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase more stock of dried fish and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it gives financial help to low income earners.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is married with two children. Eufemia is 43 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Eufemia owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 6000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase stock for her general store.

Eufemia has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Eufemia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María Concepción tiene 55 años de edad es casada tiene 4 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 39, 30, 26 y 24 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.

María se dedica a la Agricultura y crianza de animales. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para mejorar la actividad agrícola comprar fertilizantes, urea, abonos agrícolas, líquidos. 

Con la ayuda del préstamo le ayudará a mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia y podrá comprarse un terreno. El sueño es poder tener un buen método para que mejore la calidad de crianza de animales.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades causales,, las plagas enfermedades en la agricultura.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las fechas de los finados y disfrutar de los carnavales.
Con la ayuda del prestamo anterior pudo mejorar un poco el estilo econòmico de la familia, los ingresos han aumentado un poco más y el trabajo a crecido un poco pero se espera que con este nuevo crédito pueda mejorar aun màs.
texts.en:
María Concepción is 55 years old and is married with four children.  She lives with her husband and her children who are 39, 30, 26 and 24 years of age.  They live in the Guaranda Province of Bolívar.

She is a member of the group VRC VENTANAL which can be found in the community of Guantuncoto, in Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda Parish, at a distance of 30 inutes from the office.  The group members work in various activities, including agriculture, cattle, raising small animals like pigs, chickens and sheep, sales and construction.

María works in agriculture and raising animals.  She buys and sells in Guaranda.  She is asking for a loan in order to improve her agricultural work by buying various fertilizers.

With the help of the loan she will be able improve the quality of life of her family and be able to buy land.  Her dream is to be able to find a good method to improve the quality of the animals that she raises.  

The challenges that she faces include illnesses and plagues that affect agriculture.  In her free time she enjoys the Day of the Dead celebrations and the carnivals.  With the help of the previous loan she was able to improve a little the economic situation of her family.  Her income has increased a bit more and the work as grown some but she hopes that with this new credit she will be able to improve her situation even more.

loans.use: to improve her agricultural work by buying various fertilizers.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married and is a loving father of four children. He is 36-years of age and has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over ten years. He grows rice and then sells it at a more profitable price. He wants to expand his business and make a good profit to improve their poor living situation. He is now then requesting a loan amount PHP 20,000  to purchase of seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

He hopes to grow his business and gain enough profits to save for the college education of his four children and for the next sowing season of his business.

loans.use: to purchase of seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, natural de la ciudad de Kimbiri de 37 años de edad es una mujer  trabajadora, está casada con Germán de 41 años y fruto de esa convivencia tuvieron 03 hijos a quienes desea brindarles una buena prosperidad. Elisa tiene conocimiento sobre la  actividad  que realiza; es por ello con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo, se dedico de lleno a la actividad agrícola, específicamente  al cultivo de cacao; hace 20 años que tiene conocimiento sobre el cultivo de cacao y desde luego que aprendió las buenas enseñanzas que lo dieron sus padres. Ella reconoce que su éxito abarca desde la calidad de su producto hasta que lleva a venderlos a los centros de acopio de su comunidad a precio competitivo, no obstante se queda contenta con lo logrado hasta el momento, por lo tanto ya tiene planeado ampliar su terreno de cultivo con la necesidad de minimizar costo y tiempo, en efecto obtener buenos resultados económicos. Usualmente recibe la ayuda de su esposo y juntos realizan su trabajo, además siempre tratan de mejorar nuevas técnicas de cuidado para sus plantaciones agrícolas, para ello están abocado en su chacra desde muy tempranas horas hasta el atardecer. Este es crédito numero 04 con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago de manera oportuna, además se siente fortalecida y seguro con su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprara fertilizantes para realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, asi como sacar la mala hierba.
texts.en:
Elisa, a hard-working 37-year-old, is from the city of Kimbiri.  She is married to Germán, 41, and they have three children who they try to provide a good life for.  Elisa has expertise in agriculture and with much dedication and effort grows her cocoa crop.  She learned the trade from her parents and has been involved in this activity for 20 years.  She acknowledges the fact that the success of her crop is due to the quality of her produce and the competitive price she offers at the community center where she sells.  She is content with her achievements so far and is planning to expand her cropland while minimizing cost and time involved in an effort to obtain good economic results.

Normally her husband helps out with the work and together they are always searching for new techniques for plantation care.  They go out to work the fields from very early in the morning and are there until late in he evening.  This is her fourth loan through MFP, and she is committed to paying it back on time.  Her communal bank gives her a sense of strength and security.  With the 1,000 PEN loan she will buy fertilizers for crop maintenance and to kill the weeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a 28-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 6 years. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. 

Serah operates a retail store where she sells dresses, trousers, blouses, etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a very busy shopping centre and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes materials.  

Serah will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes materials to sell. Her business goal is to run another retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Composé de femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Kankeke ont en moyenne 42 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils. Elles résident dans le quartier de Dougounina de la ville Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles  ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur sixième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé les cinq précédents. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de céréales  à l’image de YAMA, de friperies et bien d’autres articles divers.
YAMA, qui est la présidente du groupe, assise en boubou blanchâtre document en main, compte acheter avec son  prêt, 500 kilos de maïs avec les producteurs de Bougouni et environs pour ensuite les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le marché  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités.

loans.use: Pour acheter des céréales

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz, aged 40, is a housewife. Her husband owns an auto mechanic workshop where he diagnoses, services, repairs and replaces auto parts. They have seven children. Given their increasing daily needs she wants to support her husband to increase his business so as to generate more income by applying for this loan. This way her husband will be able to purchase further necessary tools and increase business at his workshop.
She hopes this will help them become more resourceful and they will be able to meet their expenses and provide a better life for their children.

loans.use: to purchase necessary tools for her husband's auto repair workshop.

loans.name: La Cabañuela Group

texts.es:
La Cabañuela es el nombre de un grupo cuya ubicación se encuentra en el Estado de México, su comunidad, además de tener origen mazahua, es muy tranquila y habitada por personas muy trabajadoras. En la zona, gran parte de la población se dedica a la cría de animales y a  la siembra de maíz el cual es la base alimenticia para todas las familias tanto de la región como de todo el país.  
   Don Alberto es un campesino que siente orgulloso de su actividad y de su comunidad pues gracias a su trabajo ha podido brindar todos los beneficios a su familia integrada por su esposa Francisca y sus seis hijos. De igual forma, es muy reconocido en la comunidad por su carácter amigable y respetuoso. 
   Su deseo de superación lo llevó a buscar alternativas para iniciar con una actividad secundaria con el objetivo de generar más ingresos. “Conocí a VFMéxico y fue una gran esperanza para mí porque los préstamos tienen una muy buena tasa de interés” comentó de forma entusiasta. Así pues, comenzó a vender dulces, botanas y refrescos inicialmente y tiempo después, con base en su esfuerzo y los siguientes préstamos, amplió el local y ahora se convirtió en una exitosa tienda de abarrotes. Hasta el día de hoy, utiliza los apoyos para comprar más mercancía, sobre todo, pan, huevo, leche y productos enlatados.
Siente una profunda gratitud con la institución por los logros que ha tenido a lo largo de su actividad. Con este nuevo préstamo abrirá un centro de cómputo por lo que comprará dos ordenadores y artículos necesarios en su nueva actividad. La principal motivación para llevar a cabo esta actividad nació porque los alumnos de las escuelas necesitan este servicio en la comunidad para que puedan mejorarse, "este será un muy buen negocio porque no tendría ningún tipo de competencia" expresó.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Rogelio quien invertirá en abarrotes; Néstor, en escobetillas y Valentina y Juan, en ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del municipio, Don Alberto es quien

loans.use: Comprara dos maquinas

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Мaria I. is 66 years old. She has graduated Bulgarian literature and has worked as a teacher before her retirement. He husband has been a factory worker. After their retirement in 1994 they both decided to start a business and opened a stall on which to sell newspapers, books, magazines and refreshments. They chose this kind of business because their family house is on one of the main corners of the trade street of the town. And because of this fact they had many regular customers each day. Now Maria I. and her husband want to change front windows and to refresh their stall. They need $ 1 000 for this reason

loans.use: to change front windows and to refresh the stall

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Madame Elizabeth is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and knows about the TEACH Lending program. She requires a loan of $750 to expand her business. She knows how to keep records of her business transactions.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of used clothes

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
Maria Cecilia is married and has two children ages 10 and 17. She is a hardworking woman who, in order to help her husband cover the household expenses and her children's education, decided to start her own business five years ago. She started selling blankets and quilts, and later on, with the help of a teacher friend of hers, she started selling regional dresses and costumes. The response from her customers has been very positive and business has increased.

This type of dress is in high demand for special events at schools and churches. She is currently handling many orders placed by customers from her parish. In order to fill these orders, Maria is seeking a loan of $925 to buy merchandise. She is committed to repaying the loan in 8 months. Become an important part of the growth of this business and the lives of Maria and her family. They will be forever grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Cecilia es casada y tiene dos hijos, de 10 y 17 años de edad, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos decidió emprender su negocio hace cinco años, empezó vendiendo colchas y edredones y poco después, por medio de una amiga que es maestra, comenzó a vender trajes regionales y disfraces en donde ha recibido una muy buena respuesta de sus clientes y ha crecido con su negocio.

Este tipo de vestuarios tiene mucha demanda en eventos especiales en la escuela y en la iglesia, actualmente tiene muchos pedidos que le han solicitado sus clientes de la parroquia y para poder surtirles lo necesario Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 8 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de Maria y su familia, ellos te lo agradecerán siempre.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia V. is a mother of one who works hard out at her stall at the flea market to earn money to support her child.  Her line of business is selling clothes and handicrafts to locals and tourists, and this earns her a profit of $28 daily after all expenses and she only sells 5 times a week.  Her aim is to expand her business when she’s eligible for the next loan step.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies

loans.name: Florinda Juda

texts.pt:
florinda has 3 children. She is not officially married. But she lives with a man who is the father of their 3 children. Florinda's husband is not employed. He lives from small jobs and the machamba (small agricultural field). Florinda is joining the credit program now. She lives in Chasson, a location along the national highway no. 1. In addition to the business, she works with her husband in the field, sometimes selling vegetables that she grows in her small field. Florinda's children are studying in primary school. In the future, she wants to build a house from conventional materials.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Florinda tem 3 filhos. Ela nao e casada oficialmente. Mas vive com um homem que e o pai de seus 3 filhos. O marido de Florinda nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos expedientes e machamba. Florinda esta entrando agorea parao programa de credito. Ela vive em Chissano uma localidade ao longo da estrad nacional nr. 1. Para alem do negoci ela tambem trabalha com o marido na machamba, dai vender algumas vezes verduras que ela tira de sua pequena machamba. Os filhos de Florinda estao a estudar no ensin Basico. No futuro ela quer construir uma casa de material convencional.

loans.use: Florinda wants to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mr. S. Thy, 28, has been married for 7 years. He and his wife, Dit Sim, have two young children and another one on the way. Like their parents, Thy and Sim are farmers. It's the only work they've ever known. They farm three 30M x 200M plots of land - one that they own and the others that are farmed for produce trade with the owner. It is now the planting season for tomato, cucumber and ginger, and they are busy trying to get all their transplants into the ground. Soon they will plant watermelon and corn too.

Thy is requesting his first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. This loan will be used to buy a refurbished water pump for irrigating their fields. The old pump is no longer working and is a necessary piece of equipment. Thy is requesting this loan as they have just had to spend much in up-front costs preparing their fields. They will now not earn any income for another two or three months until they can begin picking the first of the vegetables. As they already have a buyer that purchases their produce, we feel that they have the ability to repay this loan.

loans.use: Buy water pump.

loans.name: Nneka

texts.en: Mrs. Nneka M. is 37 years old.  She is married, has four children and lives in Benin City. She sells drinks and toiletries for a living.  She is seeking a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more drinks and toiletries to sell.  She learned about business from her mother and started her own business in 1997. She thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to buy drinks and toiletries to sell

loans.name: Busei A South B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hasifa N.. She is currently in the business of cattle and poultry and is requesting a loan to buy another cow for business. Hasifa is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man dealing in cattle and poultry for work. She has 10 children ranging from age 5 months to 14 years and her children go to school. Each week, Hasifa makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Hasifa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to buy poultry chicks, and the loan was paid back on time.

Hasifa is joined in her small group by Madina M., Deborah M., Mariam B., and Fatuma W.. Madina M. has a poultry business and wants to buy more chicks. Deborah M. is currently operating a business in tailoring and wants a loan to trade more cloth materials. Mariam B. operates a business of selling used clothes and wants to start selling new clothes. Fatuma W. is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to trade a bigger variety of produce.

loans.use: To buy another cow and expand poultry business

loans.name: Maimuna's Tumaini. Group

texts.en:
Maimuna is 34 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14, 4 years old, and 1 month. Maimuna owns a small food vendor store which she started in 2006 and is a cloth seller. Everyday she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Maimuna has taken out 1successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending, vegetable selling and charcoal selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma and Ángel are a very united couple with lots of innumerable projects for their lives; ever since they were small they have been tied to agriculture and ranching, work that they inherited from their respective parents. Now with their knowledge and experience that they have acquired through their many years in this noble activity they are acheiving and increase in their quality of life and that of their little daughter Dianita, the fruit of their love. Irma and her beloved husband have had eight years of marital bliss, and in this time, with hard work and dedication they have managed to increase the number of cattle they have. Thanks to the care and devotion they provide, these also provide a fair quantity of milk, with which they create delicious cheeses. But in these icy seasons, Irma and Ángel find themselves in hard times. They don't have enough fodder for their many animals, and so they turn to all of you to request a loan to purchase more well-balanced foods.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Irma y Ángel, es una pareja de esposos muy unida con innumerables proyectos para sus vidas; ambos desde muy niños han estado ligados a la actividad agrícola y ganadera, labores que heredaron de sus respectivos padres y que ahora con sus conocimientos y la experiencia adquirida durante muchos años en esta noble actividad están logrando incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su pequeña niña Dianita quien nació fruto de su amor.Irma y su querido esposo tienen 8 años de feliz matrimonio, en ese período con sumo trabajo y dedicación lograron aumentar poco a poco la cantidad de sus vaquitas, que gracias a los cuidados y a la dedicación que les brindan corresponden generosamente con una buena cantidad de leche, que luego de ordeñarlas con mucho cariño proceden a vender para la elaboración de deliciosos quesos.Pero por estas temporadas de helada Irma y Ángel se ven envueltos en grandes dificultades, no cuentan con suficiente forraje para alimentar a sus generosos animalitos, es por ello que recurre a vosotros para solicitarte un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de comida balanceada.

loans.use: Purchase a balanced diet for their many cattle

loans.name: Angela's Yawezekana Group

texts.en:
Angela is 38 years old and is a married woman with a 2-year-old child. She and her husband also take care of a 20-year-old person. Angela owns a small tour company, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $700 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to expand her tour company. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Agness, Naomi, Grace and Joyce, who have a cafe and sell clothing.

loans.use: To expand her tour business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of natural medicines to sell in her community

loans.name: Tauleva

texts.en:
Tauleva T., 33, is married with 7 children and lives at Safaatoa Uta, Samoa. She has 2 years of experience growing giant taro (taro taamu) and bananas, which she sells to the villagers and the general public 3 days per week.

Tauleva has a previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (US$62). SPBD loans are Tauleva’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to purchase chemicals and pesticides for her crops.

loans.use: To buy agricultural chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 58-year-old mother of 9 children. She lives in Bware Migori, Kenya, and runs a grocery business she initiated in 1984. She has applied for a US$500 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Рахмонова Мавлюда родилась 1964 году. По некоторым обстоятельствам она развелась и осталась с тремя детьми. Трудно приходилось ей одной прокормить детей. Она решила заняться предпринимательской деятельностью, чтоб выйти из сложившейся ситуации. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской обуви. Вот уже 15 лет Мавлюда занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. Торгует женскими одеждами и обувью. Местом ее деятельности является торговый центр «Садбарг».  В ее ассортименте можно увидеть летние платья, блузки, юбки, а также разнообразные обуви для милых дам, как вечерние, так и повседневные. Она закупает товар у поставщиков из Турции и Китая 
Мавлюда  хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа осенних туфель.
texts.en:
Mavluda R. was born in 1964. Because of certain circumstances she got divorced and lives with three children. It was very difficult for her to feed all the children alone. She has decided to start her own business to help herself out of her desperate situation. She started a retail business selling children's shoes and it has been fifteen years since Mavluda has started her entrepreneurship. Now she is selling women's clothing and shoes. Her business location is in the Sadbarg trading center. In her inventory stock one can find summer dresses, blouses, skirts, and also a variety of shoes for the ladies such as dress shoes and casual. She buys merchandise from suppliers from Turkey and China. Mavluda wants to take out a loan in the amount of 4100 somoni ($1,200USD) to buy shoes for the fall season.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Mr. Ke M. is a villager in Phsar Krach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a fruit seller in the local market. His wife, Mrs. Erk Phat, assists him in the fruit selling business. They have three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining two attend the local school. Although Mr. M.'s family members have different businesses, they still live in an old house in poor condition. In order to live in better conditions, Mr. M. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings in order to build a house for his family.

loans.use: To build a house for his family

loans.name: Dolores Serafina

texts.en:
Dolores Serafina M. O. is a member of the community bank Llapanchik, which is Quechuan for “everyone together”. Dolores lives in Ayacucho with her husband and 5 children, aged 23 to 10. You can find Dolores at home cooking and selling traditional dishes from the area including "puca picante", a dish made with potatoes, a distinctive salsa, rice usually made with pork or sausage.

With her loan of 1000 soles Dolores will invest in her business, purchasing potatoes, rice, oil, and meat. Her goal is to have a bigger business and move her business out of her house.

loans.use: purchasing potatoes, rice, oil, and meat

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es: Valentín, de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. El se dedica al cultivo de plátanos, yucas, maíz, entre otras variedades de productos de pan llevar, desde hace ya 2 años. Estos productos los vende de acuerdo a la temporada de producción. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dedicarse a fondo a sus cultivos para que crezcan como es debido y estén a un precio acorde al mercado. Le es rentable, ya que los productos que el lleva vender son de buena calidad y son vendidos rápidamente. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, donde ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará semillas, abonos y fertilizantes, como también quiere comprar ganado para ponerlo en su chacra.
texts.en:
Valentin, is 38 years old, lives with his wife and four children. He works cultivating plantains, yucca, corn; among other varieties of bread products for the last 2 years. He sells them depending on the season of production. What he likes the most is to work hard so his products grow properly and can be sold at a fair market value. The business is very profitable for him because his products are of very good quality and get sold very fast. This is his second loan with MFP, he has demonstrated to be very punctual with his payments. With the money from the loan he wants to buy seeds and fertilizers, as well as livestock to rise.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a single parent and has 4 children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Esi sells plastic products at Ataabadze near Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Esi uses her income to pay for her children's school fees and utility bills. Esi will use the loan to purchase more plastic bowls and cups for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards a house she wants to build for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic bowls and cups for sale.

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en: Yadigar A. lives with his wife and three daughters. Yadigar has been breeding livestock for more than 15 years. Thanks to this activity, he can cover his living expenses. He goes out every morning to graze his animals. He enjoys caring for his animals, and he is grateful that this work puts food on the table for his children. Yadigar’s family is his greatest love, and they are the biggest motivators in his life. He will use the loan to purchase young cattle, which will revitalize his herd and help him become the best breeder in his area. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Consuelo es casada tiene 55 años y 3 hijos, Consuelo tiene un restaurante llamado Don Jose en un local alquilado, prepara desayuno, almuerzo y cena, Consuelo cuenta con 8 personas que se encargan D. la cocina y atención al publico.
 Consuelo necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Los sueños D. Consuelo son tener un multiservicio en su casa y descansar.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the Morenita Communal Bank II. She is married, is 55 years old, and has three children. Consuelo has a restaurant called Don Jose in a rented location where she prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Consuelo relies on eight people in charge of the kitchen and serving the customers. She needs a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles which will be invested in buying rice, sugar, oil. Consuelo's dreams are to have a multi-service business at home and to rest.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Z. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos para los cuales desea lo mejor para ellos. 
Don Carlos ya a tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente y lo utilizo para la construcción de un cuarto el cual le está haciendo falta los acabados de exterior e interior, por tal motivo nos está solicitando nueva mente un préstamo para llevar acabos la mejora y así tener terminada la recamara de sus hijos, que necesitan su propio espacio.
texts.en:
Carlos Z. is a head of household, and has two children for whom he wishes only the best. Carlos already has had credit with FVP, repaid by him in a timely manner, that he used to build a room in his house. This addition is still lacking some interior and exterior finish work, which is why he is again seeking a loan through us. He would like to finish the improvements that would complete his children’s bedroom, as they need their own space.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete interior and exterior finish work to an addition on his house.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica al transporte desde hace más de 15 años, esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo, tienen 3 autos y sus 2 hijos mayores son los conductores de dos de ellos, brindando el servicio de taxi. Cada día, Segundina se levanta temprano para preparar los autos y revisar todo lo necesario, luego prepara el desayuno para toda su familia y cuida de sus hijos menores mientras controla la ruta de los autos. Esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingresos para la familia de Segundina, les permite cubrir los gastos y solventar la educación de los hijos menores. Su meta es adquirir nuevas carros, modernos que es lo que exige la municipalidad de su localidad para seguir funcionando. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las más activas de su  banco comunal y parte de la junta directiva de su grupo. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en el mantenimiento de sus tres movilidades, para que sigan  funcionando en perfecto estado.
texts.en:
Segundina is 41 years old and she lives with her husband and four kids in a house that they own. She has worked in the transport business for more than 15 years. This work she does together with her husband and they have three cars and their two oldest children are the drivers of two of them, providing taxi services. Every day Segundina wakes up early to prepare the cars and to go over everything that is needed, afterwards she makes breakfast for the whole family and caring for the younger children while she governs the routes of the taxis. This activity is the principal source of income for Segundina’s family, and it allows them to cover their expenses and provide for the educations of the younger children. Her goal is to acquire new, modern cars which are required by her municipality for continued operation. This is the third time that she has had a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is one of the most active people in her communal bank and is part of the board of directors of her group. The money that she is requesting is for investment in the maintenance of her three vehicles so that they continue working in perfect condition.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her taxis

loans.name: Safarkul

texts.en:
Safarkul B., 54 and married with six children, is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children. He has great experience in cattle breeding, having been involved in it for 31 years, and over time he has increased his sales significantly. Since the business has been going well, he would like it to expand it and so is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy young cattle. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in continuing this business and helping them give the children a better quality of life. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Barfinisso

texts.en:
Barfinisso is a married mother of three children. Her fabric sales business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past four years that she’s been in business. In a typical month, Barfinisso makes about $200-$300 in profit from the business. Barfinisso is hard-working, polite, and communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help women with their clothing needs. Barfinisso has requested a loan of $1500 to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice le commerce de produits d’alimentaton générale, elle exerce ce commerce dans sa boutique qu’elle a appelé «  AMENUVEVE », elle a beaucoup de clients et attire tous les jours de nouveaux clients par sa manière d’accueillir sa clientèle. Son stock de marchandises a un peu diminué, elle s’adresse alors à WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 05 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huile, 04 cartons de savons « BF », 06 cartons de spaghetti, 20 tomates en boîtes, 06 cartons de sucre, et des cartes de recharge. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et a commencé ce commerce en 2008.
Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who earns an income from commerce in grocery items. She works out of her shop she called “AMENUVEVE”. She has many customers and attracts new customers each day because of her way of accommodating them. Her stock of merchandise has shrunk a bit. So she is inquiring with WAGES and requesting her first loan to buy 5 sacks of rice, 10 drums of oil, 4 boxes of “BF” soap, 6 boxes of spaghetti, 20 cans of tomatoes, 6 boxes of sugar, and some recharge cards. She supplies herself at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She began this business in 2008. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Walter Omar

texts.es: Walter Omar R. M. vive en el departamento de La Libertad junto a sus padres, un hermano, su hijo de 6 años de edad y su esposa. Walter tiene 26 años de edad se dedica a su negocio familiar que se encuentra ubicado en un rancho donde el  mismo es el propietario, en ese rancho se venden bebidas y comida, también Walter tiene un  empleo fijo en la Alcaldía municipal, pero este crédito lo solicita por que quiere invertir  en productos para comercializar en el rancho.
texts.en:
Walter Omar R. M. lives in the department of La Libertad with his parent, a brother, his 6-year-old son, and his wife. Walter is 26 years old and dedicates himself to his family business, which is located on a ranch that he owns; at this ranch they sell drinks and food. Walter also has a permanent job in the municipal mayor’s office. He is requesting this loan because he would like to invest in products to sell at his ranch.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his business.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo F. is from the town of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. He is 51 years old. Rodrigo is married to Corazon, who is 49 years old. They have 2 adult-aged children who are both married. To make a living, Rodrigo owns and operates a service-based business. He is a simple tricycle driver in their village. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from offering transportation services in his village as well as his farming activities at home. 

Rodrigo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of PHP8,000  which will be used to repair his tricycle type vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the  loan taken out by Rodrigo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Sandra Jovana

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Jovana A. O. tiene 24 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 3º de secundaria, tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad, quien depende económicamente de ella.
Sandra se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de te filtrantes y sandalias.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles, compró mas cajas de te y sandalias.
Con este crédito de S/ 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de te, sandalias y ropa.
Sandra sueña con tener un puesto en el mercado de Moche en donde venderá Ropa para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra Jovana A. O. is 24 years old and lives in the Moche district of the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Peru. This businesswoman studied through the eleventh grade and has a three-year-old dependent son. Sandra sells filters and sandals as a traveling saleswoman. She bought boxes of tea and sandals with her first loan of 300 soles. She will buy tea, sandals, and clothing with this loan of 500 soles. Sandra would like to have a stall in the Moche market where she could sell clothing for children, teens, and adults.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprarà mas cajas de te , sandalias y ropa

loans.name: Peace And Love Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old. She is a divorcee and mother to two boys. Currently both her children are working. She is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, lunch boxes, etc. She sells from a rented shop in the community market and sometimes hawks her goods, going from house to house. She has been trading for ten years now. She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more products like cooking utensils and other items which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan, she believes she will have the resources to make enough profit to expand her store. She would be grateful for your assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Peace and Love." She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of inventory, including cooking utensils among others things

loans.name: Huruma

texts.en:
Huruma is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group,In Kinyanambo ,Iringa.She is 46 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children,Her children are aged 18,15,8,4 years.

Huruma started her own shop business selling  rice,wheat,sugar 4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Huruma first`s loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000Tsh in order to buy more rice,wheat,cooking oil.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Huruma hopes to get more food for family,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Angel Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Ángel inicia su primer ciclo con 15 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. abarrotes en general, celulares, comidas, cereales, farmacia, además brindan servicio D. alquiler D. juegos, transporte, carpintería y albañil.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,100 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. celulares, accesorios, madera, medicamentos, cereales.

Los sueños D. las socias son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, tener casa y local propio y ampliar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Ángel Community Bank starts their first loan cycle with 15 members. The members have different businesses like selling general groceries, cell phones, food, and grains. They also work in a pharmacy, proviD. a service of renting toys, proviD. transportation, work in carpentry and work as a bricklayer. The members need loans for different amounts like 300 PEN and 600 PEN. The total loan amount for their Community Bank is 8,100 PEN. Their loans will be used to buy cell phones, accessories, wood, medicine, and grains. The members’ dreams are to proviD. their children with a good education so that they become professionals, have a house, have their own location, and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phones, accessories, wood, medicine, and grains

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana tiene 59 años, vive con el menor D. sus hijos, D. 14 años, en su casa propia. DesD. hace 25 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, para tal fin es poyada por sus hijos mayores, quienes vienen a su chacra en cada campaña D. siembra; para que todos, uniendo fuerzas, logren sembrar grandes extensiones D. terreno. Cuando llega la época D. la cosecha, D. igual manera se reúnen para recoger la abundante cantidad D. productos, generalmente: papa y maíz. Posteriormente, éstos son vendidos en las principales ferias D. su localidad, por ello Adriana siempre está pendiente D. los precios del maíz, el trigo y la papa, pues según esto sus ganancias serán D. mayor provecho a toda la familia. 
Esta es la tercera oportunidad que tiene un préstamo con MFP, obtener estos créditos le han enseñado a ser más responsable con sus cuentas y ahora mucho más cumplirá con puntualidad el pago D. esta cuotas. El dinero solicitado será utilizado en la compra sacos D. abono y en el pago del alquiler D. un tractor para su próxima siembra D. maíz.
texts.en:
Adriana is 59 years old. She lives with the youngest of her children, age 14, in her own house. She has been farming for 25 years. Through this work she supported her older children, who come to her farm each planting season. With them all joining forces they succeed in planting large tracts of land. Similarly, when the harvest season arrives they meet in order to collect an abundant quantity of crops, usually potatoes and corn. Afterwards, these are sold in the principal markets in her area. That’s why Adriana is always paying attention to the prices of corn, wheat, and potatoes—because according to this her earnings will be of greater benefit to her entire family.

This is the third opportunity she has for a loan with MFP. Obtaining these loans has taught her to be more responsible with her accounts and now she is sure to make her payments with punctuality. The money applied for will be used for purchasing sacks of fertilizer and for rental payments for a tractor for her next planting of corn.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer
