loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and rental payments for a tractor for planting crops

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Maria es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Maria vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, sus ventas en gran parte son al crédito.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Tulipanes” (Tulips). She is 38 years old, married, and has 2 children. Maria sells cosmetics by catalog and offers her products to friends and relatives. Most of her sales are made on credit.

Maria needs a loan of 1050 soles to buy more cosmetics. She hopes that her children become professionals and dreams of opening a cosmetics store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy has been helping her husband by selling fish and frozen food, such as longganisa (sausage) in their village. For additional income, she also now sells bottles and steel in their village and in the junk shops. Through the loan she obtained from lenders, she was also able to purchase one hog and is now trying to grow her business for more profit. Daisy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP for additional working capital to further expand her business. She hopes that she will again be entrusted with the loan she is asking.

Daisy is 32 years old and is married to Tito, who works as a driver in Cauayan City. They are blessed with four children, three of whom are studying in primary school. Their youngest is just a year old. The couple is trying to work hard in their daily activities so that they can sustain all the needs of their children especially now that most of them are in school. Daisy hopes that her business will further grow to be more profitable.

loans.use: For expansion of her businesses

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a hog raiser in the village of Sto. Niño, San Agustin. She would like to renovate her pigs' pen and buy additional feed supply for her pigs. However, the income she is earning is not enough, so she wants to borrow a loan form Kiva lenders amounting to Php4,000. With that amount she knows that the renovation of her pigs' pen and the purchase of additional feed for her animals will become reality.

Alona is married to Wilmer, who is a farmer. They are blessed with six children: Wilson-21 years old, Wojay-19 years old, Wilmer Jr.-15 years old, Wilma-14 years old, Whiny-ten years old, and Windy-one year old. Alona and Wilmer are praying to be able to provide for the needs of their children through the business they manage.

loans.use: Additional capital for the renovation of her pigs' pen and to buy feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruit (3 baskets of pineapples, 2 truck-loads of oranges) and 10 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ranulfa

texts.en:
Mrs. Ranulfa A., 49, is married and a resident of Migpangi, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Her husband Jesus A. is a driver is with an average net income of 3,000 Philippine pesos (about $65 US).  That amount is not sufficient to support their big family with 4 dependents who are in high school and elementary school. 

To add their family income, they decided to start using a pump boat for the transport of passengers going to Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte and other parts of Lanao. Now the couple is earning an average net income of not less than 5,000 pesos (about $108 US) a month.  

Mrs. A. joined PAGLAUM MPC in July 2008 because she is very much interested in our products and services. She is also interested in PAGLAUM MPC for being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao: we were named Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. 

With the willingness to pay shown to our cooperative, she was given the opportunity to request a loan of 7,000 pesos to finance the overhaul and reconditioning of the pump boat engine and the repair of the boat. The couple is hoping that someday they can purchase a new pump boat engine and another boat to be used for the business.

loans.use: For repair of boat and its engine

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer trabajadora de 48 años, comparte su vida con Zenón, su esposo, y con sus 4 hijos: Bryan de 24, Antoni de 19, Aron de 15 y Alexander de 9 años. Todos ellos viven muy contentos en su casa propia.
Ella se dedica a la confección de ropa, actividad en la que incursión gracias a que aprendió desde pequeña de su madre. Carmen se ha desempeñado en variedad de oficios para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Trabajó durante un tiempo en el país de Argentina, pero al tener a su familia lejos y no mejorar en su situación económica regresó a su querido país para poner un pequeño negocio. Es por ello que ahora está pensando en implementar una bodega, además de seguir dedicándose a la costura.     

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, siempre ha sido muy responsable con los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de tela para elaborar más prendas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a hardworking 48-year-old woman. She shares her life with her husband Zenón and their four children, Bryan, 24, Antoni, 19, Aron, 15, and Alexander, 9. They all live happily in their own house.

Carmen’s business is making clothing, an activity she learned at a young age from her mother. Carmen has had a number of different jobs to support her family. She worked for a while in Argentina, but because her family was so far away and she was not getting ahead financially, she returned to her beloved country to start a small business. She is thinking of starting up a store in addition to the clothing business.

This is Carmen’s fourth loan with MFP. She has always been very responsible with her payments. With this loan, she will buy a larger quantity of cloth to make more clothing items.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloth

loans.name: Aiivu Bako Mary Group

texts.en: B. Mary is 45 years of age, a single businesswoman blessed with three children. She has carried out a local brewing business since 2006. The loan is helping her to boost her business by inserting more capital into the business. At least she is now getting settled in her home and the loan is encouraging her to think very fast and work very hard to accomplish her dreams. Her future plan is to obtain livestock as assets, such as cows, goats and so forth.

loans.use: To insert more capital to boost her business.

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jessica Ramírez de 26 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, tiene en su casa con luz como servicios básicos y el agua se la van a dejar banqueros que reparten agua en su sector, su esposo trabaja como vendedor de frutas en el mercado de Paraíso.
 
Jessica empezó vendiendo tres tiras de snack poco a poco vendiendo e invirtiendo en dulces pudo poner un pequeño negocio en su casa. Ahora tiene muy surtida su tienda Jessica trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 21h00 todos los días de la semana. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, verduras, azúcar, colas para incrementar más su tienda. En el futuro quiere poner una sucursal de su tienda y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Jessica Ramírez is 26 years old, she lives in a suburb of Paraíso de Guayaquil. She has basic services such as electricity in her home and water is delivered in her neighborhood. Her husband works selling fruits in the Paraíso market.

Jessica began selling three types of snacks, and little by little started selling and investing in sweets and was able to open a small business in her home. Today, her store is very well stocked. Jessica works from 7:00am until 9:00pm every day of the week. One of the problems that she faces is crime in her neighborhood.

With this loan, she wants to buy rice, vegetables, sugar, and sodas to increase the stock of her store. In the future, she wants to open another branch of her store and improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, sodas

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: C. Solange est née le 9 mai 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique de Bénin.  Mariée à EHOUZOU Marcel, agent à BTP, Solange est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Solange vit ensemble avec ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Solange a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Solange vend des pagnes. Solange s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo.  Solange a 15 ans d’expérience dans cette activité.  Elle a déjà obtenu des crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Solange sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire des besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Solange C. was born on May 9, 1970, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Marcel EHOUZOU, an agent with BTP. She's the mother of two school-attending children, and she lives with them. The couple supports the family together. Solange attended school up to secondary level. In order to provide for herself, she sells pagnes (colorful African cloth). She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin, as well as in Lomé, Togo. Solange has 15 years of experience in this business. She already benefited from several loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were repaid without problems. Solange is seeking another loan from ALIDé, in order to bolster her business and satisfy personal needs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Petrona Crecencia

texts.es: Doña Petrona Crecencia Velásquez López cuenta con 52 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos”  cuanta con un taller habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 15 años de Elaborar Cortes Típicos  que se encuentra en el Paraje Pacoc Siguán, Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Petrona Crecencia Velásquez López is 52 years old and lives together with her husband and 2 children. She is an artesan who creates traditional crafts in her own workshop. She and her husband have worked together in the business for 15 years. The business is located in Paraje Pacoc Siguán, Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán Department, Guatemala. The demand from her customers has increased but her economic conditions aren't sufficient to allow her to increase her working capital. For this reason she went to Asociación ASDIR to seek a loan with the intention of purchasing material and in this way increase her sales. She also hopes to help her children progress and give them better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina Sagrada Familia, y todas sus integrantes se dedican a una actividad independiente. 
 Actualmente este comité  se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las que integrantes  ademas de la responsabilidad en los pagos.
El caso de la señora Maria Pinto quien se dedica a la profesión de peluquería en un salón que posee en su domicilio, sus clientela lo conforman sus vecinos del barrio donde vive. Ella trabaja con su hija quien la ayuda en el salón cuando puede, especialmente los sábados ya que es el día con mayor trabajo por la cantidad de gente que visita su local.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta con su trabajo y mediante el crédito pudo comprar los accesorios que le faltaban para trabajar mejor especialmente un secador profesional para pelos.
 Todas la integrantes del comité trabajan con la esperanza de  que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones laborales y educativas.
texts.en:
This committee is named Sagrada Familia and all of its members have independent activities. Right now, this committee is in its third cycle and the sense of responsibility and the wish to get ahead of each member stands out. They are also responsible with their payments. In the case of Maria Pinto, she is a hair stylist in a salon she has in her home. Her customers are her neighbors from the neighborhood she lives in. She works with her daughter, who helps her in the salon when she can, especially on Saturdays which is when there is the most work with the number of people who visit her locale. She is very content with her job and via a loan was able to purchase the accesories she needed to work, especially a professional hairdryer. All of the members of the committee work with the hope of their children not having to have the same employment and ecucational limitations.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, shampoo, creams, hair oils and a hairdryer.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline A. is a thirty-one-year-old mother of two children, Abby and Natalie, who are in primary school. Her husband, Charles Owino, is a school principal. Jackline runs a printing and gallery design workshop in Kisumu City, 500 kilometers West of Nairobi, the capital city. She designs some beautiful pieces of artwork and has a talented staff good at these kind of craft pieces, which she supplies to hotels, schools, and other interested customers.  

Jackline loves her job which she has done for the last six years. She is taking out her first loan from KADET Ltd and intends to maintain a good credit history so that she will be considered for subsequent loans. She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for the craft and gallery workshop and also buy stationery for the printing side of the business. She is looking for a lender through Kadet to enable her expand her business. 

Jackline, a hard-working and ambitious lady, hopes to provide quality and efficient service in order to win more clients. Her dream is to continue being a source of income to others via employment opportunities in her business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her craft workshop and printing stationery.

loans.name: Yessenia Maria

texts.es:
doña Yessenia E. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el kilometro 8 carretera a Guasaule, aldea el Jacalito Choluteca.
Yessenia se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, las cuales las elabora en su casa de habitacion.
Yessenia es madre de 2 hijos los cuales tienen 2 y 4 años de edad.
Yessenia es bien dedicada a su familia, todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para elaborar sus ricas tortillas luego salir a venderlas a sus vecinos.
el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de sus tortillas, necesita incrementar sus ventas, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de sus hijos y del hogar.
texts.en:
Yessenia E., 30, lives near the 8 kilometer marker along the Guasaule highway in a village called, Jacalito Choluteca. She sells tortillas that she manufactures at home. She has two children who are 2 and 4 years of age. Yessenia is dedicated to her family; she rises every day at 5am to make her delicious tortillas in order to go out and sell them among her neighbors. She will use the funds to buy more ingredients for tortilla making because she needs to increase her sales; she needs the profits to cover her children’s and her home’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, lime powder, corn and water.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a hard-working married lady with six children between the ages of 42 and 25. She practices dairy farming and sells milk in a dairy milk co-operative society to earn a living. She has been in the business for 30 years.  She was previously practicing poultry farming before she ventured into this business.  She saves her money with her group in Faulu Kenya on a weekly basis which enables her to access loans which the group guarantees.   She hopes to grow her business to a large scale and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Channy O. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. This group loan has four members who live in Boeng Leu-I village in Kandal province. Those members will use their loan for different purposes to improve their businesses the future.

Mrs. Channy O. is a tailor at her home and her husband, Mr. Thea Hoem, is a battery charger in his local village and he is a bread seller, too. Since her husband’s business is going well, she wants it to expand. So to improve her husband’s business, Mrs. Channy O. is asking for a loan to buy more bread to resell. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more bread

loans.name: Ramir

texts.en:
Ramir D. lives in the village of Malinao in Gingoog City. He is 40 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. For the last five years, he has made a living providing taxi services to people in his community. He earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from his work.

Earlier this year, Ramir joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, his first, to buy items he needs to improve his taxi service. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to expand his small company.  

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to provide transportation services

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an experienced market vendor from the Kherson region. She started her small venture selling men’s and women’s footwear 15 years ago. Irina was struggling to survive and make both ends meet as most Ukrainians did in early post-soviet times. She tried her luck with a shoe sales business and it became quite a success. Presently, Irina has invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her turnover capital amounts to 60,000 Grivnyas. 

Irina is divorced. She has a teenage son, Vladislav. She is the only breadwinner in the family at this point. Irina works hard to provide for her family’s needs and keep her business afloat in these difficult economic times. She is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise and re-stock it for summer.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Vitaliano

texts.es:
El señor Vitaliano tiene 55 años está casado con la señora Arnés Claudina tienen 6 hijos de (18, 16, 14, 10,7 y 2) años, en la visita realizada se pudo ver que son una familia de muy escasos recursos económicos, tanto que en su pequeña casa solo hay dos habitaciones donde no entran todos los hijos y alguno duermen en un patio cubierto de ladrillos.

Don Vitaliano vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de Vilomilla, trabaja en un empresa constructora el cargo que ocupa es SERENO, este cargo es muy duro para la edad que tiene don Vitaliano por lo tanto el desea cambiarse de cargo y ser albañil para poder descansar mejor en las noches, la esposa se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda actualmente cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado lechero, cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero y de esta manera incrementa su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos.

Entre sus sueños y metas es cambiar de cargo y que espera con ansias que si le puedan dar el cargo de albañil, su sueño más importante es ampliar y realizar una nueva construcción de su casita para que sus hijos estén más cómodos.
texts.en:
Vitaliano is 55 years old. He is married to Arnés Claudina and has 6 children (aged 18, 16, 14, 10, 7 and 2 years old). It is a family that survives on very scarce resources. Their home has only two bedrooms, which not all of the children fit into. Some sleep in a roofed brick patio. Vitaliano lives in the city of Cochabamba in the Vilomilla region. He works for a construction company as a night watchman, which is a very difficult job given his age. Vitaliano would like instead to become a bricklayer, so he can rest better at night. His wife works in the milk-production business and has five dairy cows. She sells the milk from these cows to a company that produces dairy products. The loan will be used to buy another dairy cow, which will be used to produce more milk and improve the family's income. Vitaliano dreams of changing his job and is very anxious to see if he can secure a job as a bricklayer. His greatest dream, however, is to build an extension on his small house, so that his children can live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es:
Martha de 48 años de edad es soltera, tiene un hijo; trabaja para la Alcaldia Muncipal de Juigalpa desde hace 9 años, desempeñandose como  Directora de Finanzas. 

Esta solicitando  su 3er credito con el objetivo de reparar su vivienda cambiando el techo de su casa que esta en malas condiciones y poniendole perlines y zinc nuevo, ya que con el invierno se estan mojando algunas partes de su casa.   

Su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda bonita ya que es el patrimonio que dajara a su hijo.
texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old, single, and has one child. She has worked for the City of Juigalpa for nine years as the Director of Finance.

She is requesting her third loan so that she can repair her home by replacing the roof which is in bad condition. Martha plans to install crossbeams and new sheets of zinc roofing. Since it is the winter season, moisture has seeped into some parts of her home.

Her greatest wish is to have a beautiful home that she can leave as an inheritance to her child.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en: Hurelbaatar B. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Chingeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. He graduated from 29th school, a special school for disabled and handicapped children. Hurelbaatar operates a business making wooden products and furniture in his town with the help of her wife.  The business is very family oriented, as Hurelbaatar designs and produces their products while his wife paints and decorates them. Hurelbaatar started his business in 2005. The business has been successful and they have grown a stable operation. Hurelbaatar and his wife work hard in order to build a new house in the area where the family currently lives. He is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and paints.

loans.use: To purchase wood and paint

loans.name: Ggulu Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Any business gains a credible reputation when the owner is highly principled. Integrity is a vital attribute that should elevate the prospects of any business. A certain 30-year-old hard-working lady by the name of N. Sylivia lends credence to the above. Her good demeanor has over the last three years struck a good chord with clients who incessantly flock to her popular general retail shop in Ggulu-Mukono. Being honorable has also been another trump card that she has used to the advantage of her business. 

Her shop deals in an array of goods such as soap, sugar and beans. In a week her profit returns add up to about $45. Under the auspices of this loan, she wants to buy more bags of beans, rice, sugar and maize flour, all for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of beans, rice, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Victoria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. VICTORIA DEL CARMEN O.  es comerciante del municipio de Condega y tiene un kiosco de comideria en la estación e buses en este municipio.

Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería  como son jugos en latas, sodas, materia prima para la elaboración de comidas y venderlas en la parada de buses.

Ella empezó este negocio vendiendo a los pasajeros de buses comidas rápidas en poca cantidad al ir aumentando la demanda ella fue aumentando su negocio hasta lograr poner un kiosco. Ella ha tenido este negocio propio desde hace 20 años y trabaja de los días lunes hasta los días sábado desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Ella era ama de casa antes de dedicarse a este negocio.

Ella espera que con este financiamiento logre comprar los productos que le hacen falta para ofrecer productos completos y satisfacer la demanda y así lograr retener su clientela.

Este es el crédito numero 5 que ella tiene en un periodo de  3 años y ella se demuestra agradecida ya que ha logrado tener crédito con Ceprodel cuando mas a necesitado y así mantener su negocio que es su principal fuente de ingreso
texts.en:
Mrs. VICTORIA DEL CARMEN O. is a merchant in Condega. She has a fast food kiosk in the city bus station. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like canned juices, soft-drinks and ingredients to make the food items she sells at the bus stop. She started this business selling a few fast food items to bus passengers. As demand grew her business did too until she was able to set up a kiosk. She has had her own business for 20 years now and she’s open for business from 7am until 4pm from Monday through Saturday. She used to be a housewife before going into business. She hopes the financing will make it possible for her to buy products she needs to be able to offer complete products and satisfy customer demand thus retaining her customers. This is loan number 5 that she’s had over a 3 year period. She is grateful that she was able to get a Ceprodel loan when she needed it most thus being able to keep her business, which is her main source of income, running.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy daily consumption items (juices, sugar, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
In his late 40’s, Deo F. has been farming for over thirty years and is still at his best in showing fellow farmers in the area that he can make it. Motivated personally and by his parents for quite some time, hard-working Deo has grown a banana plantation, an onion, tomato and maize garden, and raised livestock. His farm is in Kasoga, Kyenjojo where he gets 700,000 UGX a month from these enterprises.

However, Deo’s main problem is small harvests, and so with this loan he will be able to purchase soil amendments like manure. This will make it possible for him to raise more and earn more to assist his family of seven children and a wife at home. His goals are to expand his business and educate his children who are still going to school.

loans.use: To purchase manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Jane Wairimu

texts.en: Jane, aged 31, is married with one child and lives in Kilimani estate, a Nairobi suburb. Jane operates a  tailoring business in the city center. Her husband is a businessman as well. She has done this kind of business for the last three years. With this loan, she plans to buy a sewing machine for Ksh 27,000, rolls of cloth for Ksh 20,000, and other accessories for Ksh 3,000. She mainly gets orders from schools within the city center, makes wedding gowns, and does repairs on a daily basis. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and open another branch and create employment for other people.

loans.use: buy another sewing machine for Ksh 27,000, buy cloth for Kshs 20,000, and other essentials  for Kshs 3,000

loans.name: Maura Azucena

texts.es: Maura es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a la escuela Ricardo morales en la comunidad de palo grande junto a sus hijos. Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta de cosméticos el negocio cuenta con buena acogida debido a que ofrece un buen servicio y ella es muy buena aconsejando a sus clientes. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella se encarga de solventar la economía de su familia. Maura desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos pues todos los días recibe diferentes pedidos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito para la compra de lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, pintura de labios, polvos y cremas ella es una mujer tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maura is a 43-year-old mother who lives next to the Ricardo Morales school in the Palo Grande community along with her children. For ten years she has sold cosmetics. The business enjoys a good reception owing to the good service offered and the fact that she is very good at giving advice to her customers. With the income she receives from this business she is responsible for covering her family's household expenses. 

Maura wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more products since she receives various orders on a daily basis. Therefore she has believed it wise to seek a loan in order to purchase lip liner, nail polish, lip stick, powders and creams. She is a level-headed and responsible woman. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as a business owner to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy soaps, torch-lights, biscuits, toothpaste, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino Otazú tiene 43 años de edad, es oriundo de la ciudad de Ybycuí, está casado con la señora Vicenta Cañiza con quien tiene 5 hijos.
  Con el correr de los años la producción de su negocio no fue del nada bueno, por esa razón sus hijos tuvieron que emigrar a otras tierras con el fin de enviar ayuda económica, después de un tiempo pudo acceder a comprar una vaca lechera con la cual empezó a vender leche a vecinos, después compró otra vaca hasta que llegó a 4 lecheras la cantidad de vacunos con los que cuenta ahora gracias a la ayuda de sus hijos y con eso ya le provee de leche a todo el barrio donde vive.
El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de una vaca lechera en oferta.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya. El crédito otorgado ya que con ese dinero pudo comprar una vaca más.
texts.en:
Faustino Otazú is 43 years old.  He is a native of the city of Ybycuí, and he is married to Vicenta Cañiza.  They have five children.

With the passage of years, Faustino's business did not do well, and for this reason his children had to emigrate to other places in order to send money home.  After a while, Faustino was able to buy a dairy cow, and he began selling milk to his neighbors.  Later he bought another cow and eventually came to own four cows, thanks to the help of his children.  Now he provides milk for his entire neighborhood.

Faustino asked for the loan to buy a dairy cow on sale.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the loan since he was able to buy another cow with it.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 43-year-old married woman, mother of one child, living in Metn and working as a beauty expert and makeup artist for 20 years. Hiyam helps her husband with the family’s income and benefits; their own aim is raising their child in the best possible way.  

 Hiyam is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the second time, in order to buy necessary cosmetics and tattoo materials. Her previous loan improved her work a lot, and she has a good repayment history. Her dream is to open a beauty center in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary cosmetics and tattoo materials

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is 43 years old and is married with 2 children who are 4 months and 4 years old.  His wife works in the government.  He has two years experience in his shop, which is open from early in the morning at 6am until late in the evening at 10pm. He currently employs one person.

Japhet has requested a loan to purchase a wide range of stock that he thinks will sell well in his area.  With these additional goods, Japhet hopes to earn more profits which will allow him to start saving for further investments in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. is 40 years, married to Mbatha and together they have four children age between 17 years to five years .He has been selling clothes and shoes for the last two years and earns a profit of Kshs.10, 000 per month, in Mlolongo market which is a very busy market.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a Credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs.20, 000, which he plans to use the whole amount to buy more clothes and shoes for sale in this festive season. He has no history with any other MFI.

The anticipated profit he plans to save and buy a pickup which he will use to sell clothes and shoes from and also for hiring. Peter hopes to grow his business and become a prominent business man in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes worth Kshs.10,000 and shoes worth Kshs. 10,000 for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more stock for her business

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella B. N. is from Ibanda. She is 41 years old, very hard-working and married with children. 

For more than 12 years, she has had a business of selling bananas from Katunguru and she is able to make 240,000 UGX as monthly profits. 

She works closely with her spouse and casual laborers and her customers are mostly the people in her community. 

She is also involved in the sale of sugarcane that she grows with her husband. 

Her dream is to be able to increase productivity so that she can earn more. She needs a loan to be able to buy an extra piece of land and farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and land for agriculture

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي متزوج وله ول له من العمر 44 سنة يعمل سائق نقل عام له في عمله 8 سنوات يحب عائلته وهي كل اهتمامه يسعى جاهدا الى تأمين العيش الكريم له ولعائلته يريد التطور فهو يمتلك سيارة خاصة له لكنه يريد تجديدها حتى يستطيع ان يستقبل اكبر عدد من الزبائن خاصة ان مصلحته تريد دائما التطور ليستطيع استقبال السواح ونقلهم في المناطق السياحية لذلك فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى صيانة سيارته
texts.en: Ali is 44 years old and married with a son. He works as a taxi driver and has 8 years experience. He loves his family very much, they are his top priority and he wants to secure a comfortable standard of living for them. He wants the loan because though he owns his own car, he would like to renovate it so that he can increase his number of customers. He would particularly like to work in transporting tourists between tourist sites, and so with the loan from al-Majmoua he would like to perform maintenance on his car.

loans.use: Car Maintenance

loans.name: Colomba

texts.es:
Colomba es una señora D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. en El Transito departamento D. San Miguel, vive con un hijo y la familia D. este, doña Colomba se dedica a la venta D. tortillas desD. hace 19 años, este negocio lo tiene en su casa y posee un buen número D. clientes.
Ella solicita un préstamo para compra maíz, leña, gas y una plancha para hacer las tortillas, con esta inversión espera mejorar las condiciones del negocio, aumentar la producción D. tortillas y generar mayores ganancias.
Doña Colomba tiene como objetivo que su negocio sea estable y competente para que le provea lo necesario para su vida cotidiana.
texts.en:
Colomba is a 53-year old woman who lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel. She lives with one of her sons and his family. Colomba has been selling tortillas since she was 19 years old. She has her business in her house and she has a good number of clients. 

She requests a loan to purchase corn, firewood, propane base, and a cooking surface to make tortiallas. This investment will help her improve the conditions of her business and it will help her increase production of tortillas and earn a greater income. 

Colomba’s goal is to make her business stable and successful in order to have everything that she needs for her day to day life.

loans.use: To purchase corn, firewood, propane gas and a cooking surface to make tortillas.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio  tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 2 hijos ya independientes. Vive con sus hijos en Cruceta, un caserío en Tambo Grande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace tres años, se dedica a la venta de comida y la producción de chicha de jora, una bebida típica de Perú a base de harina y maíz. Realiza estas actividades en su propio domicilio. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de una olla lo que le ayudará a reducir el tiempo de preparación de la chicha. También, desea comprar más mesas y sillas  para poder servir más clientes. Espera aumentar su producción y venta de comida y chicha para lograr mejores ganancias y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Artemio, 45, is single and has two children who are now independent.  He lives with them in Cruceta, a hamlet in Tambo Grande, an agricultural zone located in Piura Province, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

For the last three years he’s been selling food and making “chicha de jora,” a drink typical of Peru made from a flour and corn base.  He does these activities at home.  He has requested a 2000 new sol loan to buy a pot that will help him reduce the time it takes him to make the chicha.  He also wants to buy more tables and chairs to accommodate more customers.  He hopes to increase food and chicha production and sales to improve profits and continue investing in his business.

loans.use: to buy a pot, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Sop Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOP NABY est créé depuis le 03 décembre 2007. Il regroupe 13 femmes qui sont du même village. Elles sont unies par des liens d'amitié et de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KIR DIOM

Madame MADA G. (debout à l'extrême droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de thé et de sucre. Elle fait aussi la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide . Elle pratique cette activité de puis environs 10 ans

Son crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises cité ci-dessus afin de réaliser son activite de petit commerce

Son objectif est subvenir à ses besoins tout en participant à la prise en charge financière de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP NABY was created on December 3, 2007. It brings together thirteen women who are from the same village. They are united by ties of friendship and kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of KIR DIOM.

Ms. MADA G. (standing at the far right in the photo) is the group's leader. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She has a small-scale business involving tea and sugar. She also processes and sells peanut oil. She has been in this business for about ten years.

Her loan will enable her to stock up on the merchandise mentioned above in order to carry out her work. 

Her goal is to meet all her needs while helping to support the family financially.

loans.use: to buy tea and sugar; and peanuts for making peanut oil

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en:
Eufrocina G. is from the village of Bugang, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Eufrocina is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Eufrocina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling canned goods, junk food, instant noodles, shampoo, soap & generic medicines in the local community. Eufrocina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Eufrocina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eufrocina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eufrocina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk food

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca  N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 7 children, all of whom are in school. Rebecca has a business of selling sugar cane. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Rebecca sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail. 

Rebecca has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bundles of sugar cane. The main business challenges for Rebecca include defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease transport. Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, medication and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of sugar cane

loans.name: Rosa Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Acción.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 51 años  de edad y es madre soltera de una niña de  ocho años de edad que estudia en la escuela. Vive con su hija y una hermana.
 
Tiene un pequeño  salón de belleza en el cual realiza muchos trabajos como cortes de cabello, tinturados, maquillajes, manicura de uñas entre otros muchos servicios. Trabaja de lunes a sábado de 09h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando sus clientes necesitan de sus servicios y a  ella no se le hace problemas ya que es su trabajo y tiene que atenderles bien a sus clientes. Tiene su salón de belleza hace 8 años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va invertir en comprar tintes de cabello, shampoo, oxigena, y otros materiales útiles es el arreglo personal. Hace siete años es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos salen rápidos y los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Sus metas son tener un SPA y una casa propia ya que arrienda donde vive.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the Manabi capital known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the communal bank "Mujeres En Acción" meets every two weeks.

Here we meet Mrs. Rosa, age 51, who is single and has an eight-year-old daughter who is in school.  She lives with her daughter and a sister.

Rosa has a small beauty salon where she offers many services such as hair cuts and color, make-up, manicure and many others.  She works Monday through Saturday, from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and sometimes even later if customers require her services.  This causes no problems for her since customer service is very important to her.  She has been in business for eight years and it is going well.

This loan will be used to buy hair color, shampoo, oxidant and other personal care materials.  She has been a member of the communal bank for seven years and enjoys the low-interest rates and rapid issuance of the loans.

Her goals are to have a SPA and her own home, since she currently lives in rental property.

loans.use: To buy hair color, shampoo, oxidant and other personal care materials.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy, 47, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Navy and her husband are farmers, earning an income of $1.25 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $75 on food and $25 on the other necessary expenses. 

Navy is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to provide transportation services. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame has two children, and her husband is a driver. The family lives in Elmina.

For the past ten years Maame has been selling bread as well as porridge she has made from millet. She helps to pay the utility bills and other household expenses.

Maame’s loan will be used to buy sugar, millet, flour and other things to prepare her porridge for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, millet, flour and other things to prepare her porridge for sale.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a water vending business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing real estate houses in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase construction supplies, sand, and cement to construct real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies, sand, and cement to construct real estate houses.

loans.name: Bakhruba

texts.en:
Bakhruba is 51 years old. She is married and has one daughter. Her husband is unemployed, and her business is the only source of income.

Bakhruba has been running her business for eight years. She sells different types of women's clothes. Bakhruba has trading locations in the central city bazaar. By being very polite with clients and by having good taste, Bakhruba has customers in each of the trading locations. Her monthly income is 250 USD.

Bakhruba is trying to have a wide range of goods in order to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income. Today, Bakhruba requests 700 AZN for the purpose of purchasing new clothes.

loans.use: to purchase summer season women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Marcelina le esta haciendo falta los acabados del interior.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita ya que es cemento, pintura, madera y pagarle a la persona que contrato para realizar la mejora. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su hijo y que este en mejores condiciones para su desarrollo y así evitar enfermedades. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una compañía con asistente de recursos humanos, ya que es madre soltera y es la única fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
The home of Señora Marcelina needs its interiors finished.  She is applying for a loan to buy the materials she needs, which are cement, paint, wood and to pay the person she has contracted to do the upgrade.  She wants to improve her child's inheritance, and live in better conditions for his development and to avoid illness.

She plans to repay the loan with part of the salary she receives from her job as a human resources assistant at a company.  She is a single mother and this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to finish the interiors of her home.

loans.name: Celia Emelina

texts.es:
Celia, vive con sus tres hijos D. 10, 15 y 16 años D. edad, ella administra una tienda y venD. tamales, la señora trabaja todos los días D. 6:00am a 7:00pm, atendiendo el negocio, tiene 6 años D. estar dedicada junto a su esposo.
Ella necesita invertir en productos D. primera necesidad para el negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar jabón, detergentes, arroz, frijoles, huevos, aceite, estos materiales son muy necesarios para atender la demanda y brindar un buen servicio.
Su aspiración es que a través del negocio pueda ayudar a sus hijos para que se formen académicamente y logren superarse.
texts.en:
Celia lives with her three children, ages 10, 15 and 16.  She has a store and sells tamales every day, with a work schedule of 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  She has been in the business for six years with her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic products for the store such as soap, detergents, rice, beans, eggs and oil.  These items are in much demand and allow her to proviD. a good service.

Her goal is to work hard enough to be able to help her sons get an education and become successful.

loans.use: To buy products such as soap, detergents, rice, beans, eggs and oil.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 34 años es una mujer joven y alegre con ganas de salir adelante, esta casada y vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas con quienes comparte la alegría de educarlos. El trabajo de Diana es muy tierno, tiene en su casa un sistema educativo no escolarizado con niños de dos años, ahí ella se encarga de cuidarlos y educarlos, este sistema es del estado pero no todo lo que le dan es suficiente, es por eso que ella invierte en la refacción y arreglo de su local para que sea seguro y poder así ayudar a las madres en el cuidado y enseñanza de sus niños. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene la oportunidad de poder ver crecer a los niños y darles un inicio de educación bueno, además le grada que por las tardes le da tiempo para poder realizar otras actividades como la venta de algunos productos por catalogo, espera mas adelante poder poner una bodega en su casa para que tenga otro ingreso extra con la ayuda de sus hijos. Este es el tercer préstamo entre la institución MFP y Diana, se siente muy cómoda con su grupo y espera poder seguir trabajando como hasta ahora de manera responsable y con seriedad de parte de todos. Con el monto solicitado de 800 soles, ella comprará materiales educativos, entre libros,cuadernos, lapices y colores, para trabajar con sus alumnos.
texts.en: Diana, is 34 and full of enthusiasm with a desire to get ahead.  She is married and lives in her own home with her husband and two daughters with whom she shares the joy of teaching them. Diana's work is very sweet; she maintains a pre-school creche in her home for children aged 2.  She takes care of them and helps educate them.  Though this pre-school is publically supported, she does not receive all the resources she needs, and she wishes to make repairs and improvements to the space used for educating children. What she loves about her job is having the opportunity to watch the children grow and give them a start to a good education. She has free time in the afternoons and sells items from catalogs.  One day Diana hopes to have a small store to sell basic items from her home.  This is Diana's third loan with MFP and she feels very comfortable with this group and hopes to continue working as she has done in a responsible and serious manner. The loan of 800 soles will be used to buy childrens' educational materials such as books, notebooks, colored and regular pencils, to work with her students.

loans.use: to buy educational materials such as books, notebooks, and colored and regular pencils

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora, de 51 años, es madre de seis hijos, de los cuales ya cinco son mayores y solo uno es menor quien depende de ella en su vida y educación, viven junto a el y a su esposo en una casa que compraron juntos gracias a mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
El trabajo de Isidora consiste en coser prendas intimas (lencería), ropa para niños, además tiene como una actividad mas la de la venta de productos por catálogos, esta actividad la realiza en su casa y lleva en esto ya varios años, lo hace sola pero cuando tiene mucho trabajo pide la ayuda de otra persona para que le felicite el trabajo.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de tiempo además de mencionar que le encanta lo que hace ya que creció en este trabajo, además siente que es muy rentable ya que siempre tiene clientes además de ser proveedora de algunas tiendas de la ciudad, por ahora espera poder empezar a vender comida por las noche ya que es una de sus metas a cumplir.Este es el séptimo préstamo entre Isidora y la institución MFP, se siente bien en el grupo ya que todos son responsables hasta ahora, agradece mucho que la institución le de le oportunidad de poder sentirse útil y sobre todo productiva.Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles espera poder comprar materiales de costura.
texts.en:
Isidora, aged 51, is the mother of six children.  Five of them are fully grown, and only one is young and still dependent on her for livelihood and education.  They live with her and her husband in a home that they bought together, thanks to much effort and sacrifice.

Isidora's work consists of sewing intimate items (lingerie) and children's clothing.  She has an additional line of work, which is selling products from catalogs.  She does this work from her home, and has been doing so for several years.  She works on her own, but when she has a lot of work she seeks support from other people, because she welcomes the work.

What she likes most about her work is that she manages her own time.  In addition, she mentions that she loves what she does, as she grew up doing this work.  She also feels that it is very profitable, as she always has customers, and also sells to several stores in the city.  

Now she is hoping to be able to start selling food in the evenings, and this is one of the goals she wants to accomplish.

This is Isidora's seventh loan with the MFP institution.  She feels good about the group, and that everyone has been responsible so far.  She is very grateful that the institution gives her the opportunity to feel useful, and above all productive.

With the amount requested of 1,000 Soles, she hopes to be able to buy sewing materials.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 40-year-old single mother of three children living in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. Ever since she separated from her husband, she has been the sole breadwinner of the family and her family goal is to build a family house. She has a salon business and has been operating it for 12 years. She hopes to expand it to a big one, despite the challenge of limited funds. Christine needs the loan to buy cosmetics for her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ruhusa

texts.en:
Ruhusa is a 34 year old married man who sells used clothes at the New Market in Malindi. He has been in this business for the past thirteen years and he earns a monthly income of about KES.12,000 with which he uses to look after his family. 

Ruhusa has been loaned Kshs.40,000 by KADET LTD  and this serves as his third loan cycle from the company.  The client intends to use the loan to purchase additional stock of used clothes for sale. 

He will use the anticipated profit to provide basic needs for his family.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 30 años es una mujer ejemplar. Vive en compañía de sus 4 hijos todos ellos menores de edad a los que cría sola, en su casa propia; ubicada en el centro poblado Unión Autiki. Ella es una mujer emprendedora, pues conocedora del trabajo de los bancos comunales, formó su asociación con mujeres como ella, que son madres solteras y que juntas lograrán sus objetivos; para el bienestar de los suyos. Su principal actividad económica es “la agricultura”; gracias a sus sembríos de plátanos, yuca y café logró obtener su casa y sus 2 terrenos productivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la capacidad de relacionarse con otras personas como ella, luchadoras y con ganas de salir adelante. Ya tiene 7 años de experiencia en esto y desea para su futuro mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos y comprar más terrenos productivos. Ya que sus hijos son pequeños y quiere ahorrar para brindarles una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Rosa de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de mil mamones (plantitas de plátano), para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Rosa, 30, is an exemplary woman.  She lives in the company of her four children who are all minors and who she raises by herself in her own house located in the town of Unión Autiki.  She is an enterprising woman because she is aware of the work of communal banks.  She formed an association with women like her who are single mothers so that they can reach their goal, their loved one’s wellbeing, together.

Her main activity is ‘agriculture.’  Thanks to her banana, manioc and coffee crops she was able to obtain her house and two fertile fields.  What she most enjoys about her work is the ability to relate to people like her: tenacious women with a drive to get ahead.

She has 7 years’ experience in this and wants in the future to improve the quality of her crops and to buy more growing fields.  Because her children are still little she wants to save up to provide them with good educations.

She belongs to the “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank and this is their first MFP loan where she hopes for support from all of you to reach her objectives.  She promises to be punctual with her installment payments.  If Rosa were to receive your support, she’ll invest the requested money in the purchase of 1000 “mamones” (banana seedlings) for her next planting.

loans.use: to buy 1000 banana plants.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel es soltero, el es un hombre trabajador, luchador con muchas ganas de superación; y por ello que día a día se dedica por entero a su trabajo el cual es la venta e instalación de ventanas y vitrinas (mamparas) que vende a constructoras y locales nuevos de la cuidad y provincias de ICA. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima (vidrios y fierro) para realizar sus trabajos; su principal sueño del Sr. Miguel es comprarse su propia casa y tener su propio taller. El esta muy agradecido por la confianza depositada en su persona.
texts.en: Miguel is single. He is a hard working fighter who really wants to get ahead. That is why day to day he is totally dedicated to his job, which is selling and installing windows and display cases that he sells to builders and new locales in the cities and provinces of Ica. He is going to invest the loan in buying materials (glass and iron) to do his jobs. Miguel's main dream is to buy his own home and have his own workshop. He is very grateful for the trust put in him.

loans.use: to buy materials (glass and iron)  to do his jobs.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, tiene la edad de 44 años y está en unión libre. Actualmente vive con su esposa y sus 7 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de y ya establecida la plantación. El quiere comprar abonos y todos los productos necesarios para surtir sus cafetales y así obtener más rendimiento en su cosecha. El tiene varios años de experiencia en el cultivo y cree que esta es una muy buena temporada para la mejorar de los cultivos, pues vienen tiempos que pueden traer excelentes resultados. El tienen como meta generar ganancias para ir saliendo con los pagos del crédito y a la vez ir generando las ganancias para su bienestar familiar cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en:
Miguel is 44 years old and in a common-law relationship. He currently lives with his wife and his seven children, who are his highest priority. Miguel will use this loan to buy supplies to assist him with his work. He has suitable land at his disposal and used it to establish a plantation. Miguel wants to buy compost and all the necessary supplies so that he can replant his coffee farm and obtain the best return from his harvest. He has several years of experience with growing coffee and believes that this is a good time to improve his crops. The upcoming seasons can bring excellent results. His goal is to generate earnings to fulfill his loan payments and still have profits to provide for his family’s daily well-being.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Miguel has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing coffee.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu lives in West Point.  She is 22 years old and is a high school graduate.   She is single and has a five year-old child who is presently in school and lives at home.  For the past year, she has been selling soap and slippers. She likes the buying in her business and the profit she received. 

She is  requesting a loan to purchase more soap and slippers for her business.  Her plan is to send her child to school and save money for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more soap and slippers for her  business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 49 years old, a single mother of three school-going children.  She has been selling clothes through hawking  for the last six years, with an income of KES 16,000, a month.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her third loan, after successfully repaid the previous loans well and in good time. She plans to buy more clothes for sale.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to support her family and grow her business and get a rental stall to display her clothes for sale. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Munkh-Erdene

texts.en:
Munkh-Erdene is a 35-year-old entrepreneur who supports his family by operating a fuel/firewood selling business at the largest outdoor wood market in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He lives with his wife in the outer ger district without the basic infrastructure of the city. 

Munkh-Erdene’s wife helps to him operate his business.  Both of them are very experienced in this business. In winter Mongolia is very cold and that kind of business is becoming popular, so they want to purchase more fuel/firewood to sell. 

Currently, Munkh-Erdene has an old small truck, but that truck's capacity is too small, so he needs a new one. With this 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan, he wants to buy a truck to carry his fuel/firewood.

loans.use: buy a new truck to carry fuel/firewood

loans.name: Wanyange Tusubiira Women's Group

texts.en:
Selling charcoal is a business which has become increasingly lucrative in every sense of the word, going by the many people who prefer charcoal in their daily cooking purposes. Many people living in Ugandan urban centers and those operating restaurants are increasingly partial to the usage of charcoal, as it is easily available and less costly.
However, this high demand for charcoal has seen a surge in its price. A bag of charcoal which used to cost less than UGX 50,000 is now costing in the range of UGX 150,000-200,000. This has somewhat played into the hands of most charcoal entrepreneurs, not only in Kampala, but in places like Jinja and Mbale which are growing metropolises.

48-year-old Harriet has been engaged in a charcoal sales business for close to 25 years now. She conducts her trade in Jinja.
Harriet, who is happily married with 5 energetic kids, also earns side income from selling firewood.
She says she will use her loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old and single.

He has been in the maize milling business for the last eight years from which he earns a monthly income of KES 80,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 80,000. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to buy more bags of maize for milling, He plans to sell branded maize flour in the future.

loans.use: To buy more maize for milling and selling.

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es: Sulma, de 25 años de edad, es soltera y tiene a su pequeña hija Evelyn de 06 años. Vive en el centro poblado Limonchayocc, en una casa alquilada. A Sulma siempre le ha gustado crecer y salir adelante sobre todas las cosas; desde muy niña le empezó a gustar estar a lado de su familia ayudándole en la venta de sus frutas. Ahora ella con la visión de salir adelante, hace 01 mes se dedico a la venta de frutas, es por ello, que ella produce y comercializa sus productos como: frutas cítricas, papaya, plátano y mango cuando están en su temporada. Los lleva a vender a la ciudad de Ayacucho, para que los venda a los mayoristas a un buen precio. En el futuro piensa invertir en comprar frutas ya que en su localidad lo venden a un precio cómodo ya que así puede solventar con los gastos de su hogar en especial ofrecerle una mejor vida para su hija. Este es crédito numero 01 con MFP, de la misma manera se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además apuesta a seguir en su Banco Comunal por el beneficio que tiene. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará frutas para luego llevarlas a vender a la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Sulma, 25, is single and has a little, 6-year-old, daughter, Evelyn.  She lives in the settlement of Limonchayocc in a rented house.  Sulma has always liked to grow and to get ahead in everything.  Since childhood she liked to be alongside her family helping them sell fruit.  

Now she started to sell fruit a month ago aiming at getting ahead herself.  This is why she produces and sells her products like citrus fruit, papaya, bananas and mangoes when they are in season.  She takes them to the city of Ayacucho to sell so that she can sell them to wholesalers for a good price.  In the future she plans to invest in the purchase of fruit since it’s sold at affordable prices in her community and she can meet household expenses and offer a better life to her daughter.

This will be MFP loan #1 and she commits to make her payment obligations; she also bets on staying in her communal bank because of the benefit it has.  She will use the 1000 new soles to buy fruit to then take to the city of Ayacucho to sell.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruit.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Rosalía  tiene 54 años de edad está casada hace más de 27 años tienen tres hijos todo mayores de edad.
Esta señora es muy emprendedora, teje frazadas y manteles artesanales y su marido se encarga de venderlos a cuotas en la localidad de Villa Elisa en donde viaja cada mes a colocar y cobrar sus productos, gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerle estudiar.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos, agujas para tejer, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y les gustaría poder cumplir.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 54 years old and has been married for more than 27 years; they have three children who are all adults now.

This lady is very enterprising.  She weaves artisanal blankets and tablecloths and her husband sells them in installments in the town of Villa Elisa where he travels monthly to sell and to collect payments.  Thanks to her work and effort she was able to provide her children with all the comforts as well as provide them with an education.

She requests the loan to buy thread and knitting needles since she has many orders and she’d like to fill them.

loans.use: to buy thread and knitting needles.

loans.name: Maria Somalia

texts.es:
La  Señora María es una persona muy  trabajadora dedicada a su negocio,  vive con sus 3 hijos. En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene  más de 12 años de tener este tipo de negocio. El préstamo lo invertirá en la  compra de carnes, pollo, manteca, refrescos  y  condimentos y de esta manera  incrementar más  sus ventas.
Doña María con el préstamo  espera, Mejorar su negocio y así satisfacer las  necesidades  de  sus clientes. Sus  sueños  es  poder  agrandar  y consolidar  su negocio, para darles a sus hijos una mejor educación ya que están pequeños y quiere que se gradúen de la universidad.
Choluteca  Honduras - Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de carnes, pollo, manteca, refrescos  y  condimentos para su negocio

loans.name: Kyakaigo Abagambakamu Women Group

texts.en:
Florence, a member of Kyakaigo Abagambakamu Women group where members guarantee each other, is aged 36 with two children, living in Fort Portal Uganda. 

She operates a canteen business and at the same time earns salary that adds more income for her. She is faced with the hardship of high competition. Besides that, she hopes to expand her business to other areas in order to generate more income. 

Florence needs a loan to add more foodstuffs, like bread and beans, to her canteen business.

loans.use: to add more foodstuffs, like bread and beans, to her canteen business.

loans.name: Maa Baishnabi Debi Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Santilata, the woman standing first from right, is a 39-year-old married woman with three children. She stays with her husband, children and parents-in-laws in a small village. Her husband is a laborer. She does her bit to supplement the family income by selling vegetables. She has been a vegetable vendor for a year. She purchases vegetables from the wholesale vegetable market and sells at retail. She wants to open a vegetable shop. This will enable her to purchase vegetables in bulk from the wholesale market and sell at retail. She is looking for a loan of 12,000 INR to increase the quantity of vegetables she purchases and a weighing scale. This loan will aid her in her goal to open a vegetable shop eventually.

Santilata, along with her group, has requested this loan of 60,000 INR from which she will use her portion for her business. Santilata is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and a weighing scale

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Meet an amazing, honest and charming woman by the name of Leah. She is a small-holder farmer based in Kabires village in the Nandi hills, Kenya. Leah has been practicing livestock farming for seven years .She has raised one cow on the farm. Leah is seeking a loan to restock her cereals business. She plans to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets where she will sell at prices high enough to cover all the expenses incurred while gaining a profit Leah is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hard working and financially disciplined. Returns from the investment will change her life as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards. Leah just needs a little help that she can get from you; a loan that may change her life.
Like Leah, thousands of smallholder farmers are waiting for your help. Take heart, make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is married with 2 children. She trades in cosmetic products from a room in her house. Her first loan of $285 was repaid well and was used to increase her stock. This second loan of US$450 is to enable her move to a shop in her neighborhood and also increase her stock. Her daily income is expected to double from $15-30 per day with the loan. In addition to selling cosmetics she also trades in cereals, selling mainly to her neighborhood.

loans.use: Stock Beauty Products Shop

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Mrs. Queen E. is a 32 year old woman with two  children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells plastic containers and drinks to the public. She needs a loan of $500 for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more rubber plastics and drinks for sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cart for his water selling business

loans.name: Juana Pastora

texts.es:
Juana is a married woman and has one little son who is two years old. Her husband works in a factory. Presently they are paying for their home that they obtained by means of a loan for low-income persons. These payments greatly reduce the family income. Faced with this need, Juana decided three years ago to begin her own business selling shoes through a catalog. She began selling among her friends and neighbors, and day by day she gained more clients.

Juana is requesting a loan for $100 dollars so she can meet her order requests for the upcoming graduations. She offers to pay back this loan in three months. She and her family appreciate your support, which helps Juana continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Juana es una mujer casada y tiene un hijo pequeño de dos años de edad, su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica. Actualmente están pagando su casa que obtuvieron mediante un crédito hipotecario para personas de bajos recursos y los pagos reducen considerablemente el ingreso familiar, ante esta necesidad Juana decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de zapatos por catálogo desde hace tres años, comenzó vendiendo entre sus amigos y vecinos, su esposo colabora con ella ofreciendo zapatos entre los trabajadores de la fabrica, y día a día se hace de más clientes.

Juana está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 100 para poder surtir sus pedidos en estas fechas para las graduaciones y ofrece pagar este préstamo en tres meses, ella y su familia te agradecen por tu apoyo para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy shoe merchandise

loans.name: Delmy Yanira

texts.es:
My name is Yanira and I work hard to sell clothing and personal products like lotions, creams, cosmetics. Since I have four years experience of sales, I already have an established customer base who buy my goods when they need them. I have three children who are at school as our economic situation is still sound. I need to increase my inventory of goods since the Christmas holidays are coming. I need to buy products at good prices so my profits post-sales are increased, even if they are marginal.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Yanira y me dedico a vender ropa y productos de uso personal como lociones, cremas, cosmeticos, tengo cuatro años de vender, ya tengo mis clientes a quienes les vendo lo que ellos necesitan. Tengo tres hijos que se encuentran en escuela y colegios por lo que la situacion economica es bantante fuerte. Necesito incrementar mi inventario ya que viene la epoca navideña y necesito tener producto comprado a buen precio para poder venderlo y obtener un poco mas de ganancia.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, cosmetics, shoes, curtains, and other items

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti K. is 36 years old and married. She sells fried snacks by going around the village everyday. She has to work to supplement her family's income since her husband Mustakim has no fixed income. She usually earns $8.50 per day and it is not enough for her family needs. She asks for an IDR 500,000 loan to complete her business, and hopes that this will improve her everyday income. Siti is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her business

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en: Hisham is a 28 year old man. He lives in south Lebanon, in the Nabatieh region. Hisham comes from a poor background. He has a small dental laboratory which is his main source of income. Hisham needs a loan of $1000 to buy the necessary material for his business and for its maintenance.

loans.use: Hisham would like to buy the necessary material for his dental business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Ms. Daisy E. is 26 years old. She is single and lives in Benin City. She operates a restaurant where she sells cooked food and drinks. She requests a loan of $700 to buy more drinks to sell. She started her restaurant in 2004. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff and drinks to sell

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche E. F. is single, 23 years old, and lives in Benin City. He deals in the sales of weaves. He has been in business since 2006. This is a business he learned for 6 years. He solicits a loan of $675 to enable him to buy more weaves to sell. He is a LAPO client. He thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more weaves for sale

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun S., 45, lives along Mekong River. She has been married to Yorn Yi since 1990 and has two sons and three daughters. Three of her children study in the local school and the other two are still young and stay at home.

Saroeun learned to weave and started silk production in 1991. She sells her finished products to the middleman inside the village. Her husband does farming. 

Mrs. Saroeun is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $200 to buy silk material for weaving.

loans.use: For purchasing silk material for weaving

loans.name: Delia Tereza's Group

texts.es:
Lie, Delia and Yanira belong to the Guadalupe Communal Bank since 6 months ago. Lie is convivial, she is 25 years old and has 2 children. Some time ago Lie used to sell tuberss and 2 months ago she decided to change her business and sell cereals instead. She buys the products in Andahuaylas and sells it at the Nery Garcia market. Along with her husband Lie sell purses and footwear that they buy in Bolivia.

Delia is married, she is 32 years old and has 3 children. Delia sells candies and natural remedies in the convent of Santa Teresa. In the afternoons Delia sells Salchipollos (chicken hotdogs), she has also thought of opening a restaurant.
