Yanira is a single mother, she is 25 years old and has one son, Yanira sells food in a stand in the Magdalene market. Yanira also sells clothes that she brings of the city of Lima and Trujillo.

Lie, Delia and Yanira need loans of 900 S., 1000 S., 900 S., money that will be invested in the purchase of purses, shoes, oil, potatoes, noodles, mustard, carbonated soft drinks, sweets, vegetables and clothes.

Lie's, Delia's and Yanira’s dreams are to travel abroad, to have their own retail stores and to offer their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer.

Lie, Delia y Yanira pertenecen al Banco Comunal Guadalupe hace 6 meses.

Lie es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Lie al inicio vendía tubérculos y hace 2 meses cambio de negocio por la venta de cereales, sus productos lo compra en Andahuaylas y lo vende en el mercado Nery García. Además Lie junto a su esposo venden carteras, calzados que compran en Bolivia.

Por otro lado Delia es casada, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos, Delia vende dulces y remedios naturales en el convento de Santa Teresa. Además Delia por las tardes vende Salchipollos y tiene proyectado aperturar un restaurante.

Mientras que Yanira es madre soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Yannira vende comida en un Kiosco en el mercado Magdalena. Además Yanira vende ropa a pedido, que trae de la ciudad de Lima y Trujillo.

Lie, Delia y Yanira necesitan présstamos de 900 S., 1000 S., 900 S., dinero que será invertido en la compra de carteras, zapatos, aceite, papa, fideo, mostaza, gaseosas, dulces, verduras y ropa.

Los sueños de Lie, Delia y Yanira son viajar al extranjero, tener local propio y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Lie, Delia and Yanira need loans of 900 Soles, 1000 Soles, 900 Soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of purses, shoes, oil, potatoes, noodles, mustard, carbonated soft drinks, sweets, vegetables and clothes.

loans.name: Herlinda Maritza

texts.es:
Investment of First Loan:

Maritza could buy all the necessary agricultural supplies to attend to the demands of her clients. That is to say she was able to buy everything in time, finishing her crop as expected and marketing all her product.

Development of Business:

The 5 hectares that she possesses have permitted her to have sufficient land to cultivate not only rice but related products, as for example corn. Twenty years of experience vouch for the quality and quantity of her products.

Personal information:

Maritza is 47 years old. She is married. She has 2 children, which are students in the primary and secondary schools of the sector. Her dwelling is of mixed construction; cane and wood. One of her aspirations is to improve her dwelling.

Use of Second Loan:

With this new loan she will buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent of machinery and contract labor to take advantage of the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of her location is that it is in the high part of this coastal sector.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11784

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Inversión de Primer Préstamo:

Maritza pudo comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Es decir que compro todo a tiempo, terminando su cosecha como el esperaba y comercializando todo su producto.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Las 5 hectáreas que posee, le han permitido tener terreno suficiente para cultivar no solo arroz sino productos afines como por ejemplo el maíz. 20 años de experiencia avalan la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

Información Personal :

Maritza tiene 47 años. Es casado. Tiene 2 hijos, los cuales están estudiando en escuela y colegio del sector. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta caña y madera. Una de sus aspiraciones es mejorar su vivienda.

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, equipo menor, alquiler de maquinarias, contratación de mano de obra, y otros insumos necesarios para aprovechar la época invernal, y ahorrar el riego. La ventaja del sector es que esta en la parte alta de este sector costero.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11784

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent of machinery and contract labor to sow a winter crop.

loans.name: Melea

texts.en: Melea P., 23, is single with children.  She has 2 year(s) of experience in the Flea Market business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).  SPBD loans are Melea’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  A single female from a family of 2 brothers and 1 sister.

loans.use: purchase fruits and vegetables from the market, and also seeds to start planting for her business.

loans.name: Thi Huong

texts.vi:
Mrs. H. Thi Huong (ID number: 020021), is 26 years old. She wants to borrow 125 USD to buy fertilizer. She and her husband are very hard-working. Besides working on the rice field, they also are hired building workers. With an income of 6-7 USD/day, it is very convenient for them to repay weekly. They have one child who is still going to school.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Hường (MS: 020021), năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND mua lân đạm phục vụ nông nghiệp. Anh chị rất chịu khó, ngoài làm ruộng anh chị còn đi làm phụ xây, đổ bê tông đường làng ngõ xóm. Với mức thu nhập 110.000 VND/ngày sẽ giúp anh chị tiết kiệm tốt qua hình thức trả góp hàng tuần. Anh chị có một con nhỏ đang đi học.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with a grown daughter. She runs a small business selling socks and stockings in one of Simferopol's markets. Her clothing sale business exhibits good economic characteristics, consistent growth, and stability. Ludmila has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and meeting the needs of her customers which helps her gain success in business. She has been in the trade for 8 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $6000. Her monthly net profit is about $800.  

Ludmila would like to get a loan of 3000 Grivnas ($650 USD) to increase her working capital. Her natural ability to please her customers, anticipate their needs, and offer speedy, courteous service will help Ludmila achieve her goals, sustain her success and consequently win the entrepreneurial game.  

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Саидов Сухроб занимается необыкновенным делом. Убой скота и продажа мяса. Ему 28 лет, женат, имеет 3 детей. У него высшее образование. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность он начал еще в 2002 году.  Сухроб торгует говяжьим и бараньим мясом. Это семейный бизнес и переходит из покален в поколение. В продаже также имеются говяжий и бараний жир, внутренний жир. Шерсть  животных продает обработчикам кожи. В неделю 2 раза Сухроб покупает скот на убой и продает их мясо в арендуемом помещении. У него свои постоянные клиенты, население покупает для потребления, столовые для приготовления пищи и его продажи. 
Услышав о программе Кива Сухроб решил участвовать и получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Suhrob S. works in a unique business, he slaughters livestock and sells meat. He is 28 years old, is married and has 3 children. He has a college education. Suhrob became an entrepreneur in 2002. He sells beef and lamb. This is a family business and has been passed down from generation to generation. Suhrob also sells beef and sheep fat. He sells the animal hair to leather workers. Two times a week Suhrob purchases livestock for slaughter and sells their meat in a rented location. He has regular customers, residents purchase meat for consumption and canteens purchase it for cooking dishes that they sell.

When Suhrob heard about Kiva he decided to participate and to take out a loan of 4100 somoni ($1200) in order to purchase large livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is a 24-year-old trader. She is married with two children. She has sold used clothes and ladies' slippers in a local market in Koforidua for three years. With this business, she has been able to support her family. Her major challenge over the years has been funds to scale up the business. Esther has lots of marketing experience and she is very confident that the loan would enable her to make remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes and ladies' slippers to increase her inventory. She says her greatest joy will come when she is able to provide her children with a quality education to make them more resourceful in the future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers.  Esther is a member a group called "Nyame mma Trust Group". Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes and ladies slippers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 20 años, vive sola en un cuarto alquilado. Es natural de la zona llamada Yllalli, reside en la ciudad de Juliaca hace 2 meses, consiguiendo un trabajo para cuidar y vender en un stand de carteras y adornos de escritorio. El negocio que atiende Elizabeth queda en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad, por ello puede lograr buenos ingresos vendiendo las carteras. Usualmente abre desde las 8 de la mañana y termina a las 7 u 8 de la noche, deteniéndose solo para almorzar.
Le gusta su trabajo, porque como a toda joven le gustan las carteras, por otra parte, el tener que atender casi todo el día la canse mucho, terminando agotada. Esta joven trabaja mucho para mejorar su situación económica  y tener mayores oportunidades de crecer. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere asociarse con la dueña del local, comprando algunas cosas que ella pueda vender y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En el futuro, le gustaría tener su negocio propio de ropa o  venta de comestibles.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 20 years old and she lives alone in a rented room. She is originally from a region called Yllalli. She has lived in the city of Juliaca for the past 2 months after she secured a job attending to a stand selling purses and office supplies. The business that is attended by Elizabeth is located in one of most popular markets in the city, which is why she can generate a good income selling purses. Usually she starts at 8 o'clock in the morning and she finishes around 7 or 8 at night, only taking a break at lunch time.

She loves her job because like all young people she loves purses, but on the other hand, having to work almost the entire day is very tiring and she ends her days exhausted. This young woman works hard to improve her financial situation and to secure better opportunities to advance. With the funds from this loan she wishes to partner with the owner of the stand, purchasing some items that she will be able to sell as well, and improve her income. In the future she will like to have her own business selling clothing or selling foods.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to partner with her employer.

loans.name: Petrona Natividad

texts.es:
La señora Petrona  Natividad López B. esta señora tiene la edad de 66 años, su estado civil es soltera, por lo que esta señora no tiene hijos solo 3 nietos que mantiene a su cargo un varón de 16 años que cursa recientemente el 4 año de secundaria, un niño de 10 años que cursa el 5 grado de primaria y una niña de 18 años que cursa el 2 año de farmacia, sus sueños son que Dios le pueda seguir proporcionando vida para ayudarle a sus nietos en la vida y para que el día de mañana ellos no sufran dificultades para el día de mañana, sus propósitos son de darle mejoras a su establecimiento para que este presente las condiciones adecuadas y necesarias.


El tiempo que esta señora tiene de poseer este negocio es de 30 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de granos básicos como lo es: arroz, azúcar, aceite, jugos y cosas para uso personal, su establecimiento esta ubicado en el mercado central  sus comienzos fueron desde hace mucho tiempo atrás e inicia con cosas pequeñas como: candelas, arroz, fríjol y aceite a medida del tiempo decide establecer su negocio y realizar la venta de granos básicos y ampliarlo mas por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar las compras de sus productos en las diferentes distribuidoras y también satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Petrona Natividad L. B. is a 66 year old single woman. She has three grandchildren that she supports: a boy of 16 years who is in his fourth year of high school, a boy of 10 years who is in fifth grade, and a girl of 18 years who is her second year of pharmacy school. Her dream is for God to continuing providing for her and her grandchildren in their lives. Also, she dreams about having no difficulties one day. Her goal is to give more to her business because it is what provides them with good conditions and necessities. She has had her business for 30 years, a financial endeavor selling basic grains such as rice, sugar, oil, juices, and personal products. Her business is located in the central market. She started it a long time ago with small items such as candels, rice, beans, and oil. Over time, she decided to grow her business and begin selling basic grains. She will grow her sales by attaining the working capital necessary to purchase the products from various distributors that will satisfy the demand of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sobeyda Jazmina

texts.es:
La joven de nombre Sobeyda Jazmina E. tiene la edad de 42 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera esta Joven tiene 3 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguiente su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 25 años y trabaja en  restaurante, su hijo de 20 años trabaja en una camaronera  y 2 su hija de 17 años de edad que cursa el 2 año de secundaria, sus propósitos son ampliar su negocio para ayudarle a su hija ya por lo que necesita darle a su hija un porvenir en los estudios ya que le falta un largo camino que recorrer en el ámbito de los estudios, en sus deseos esta proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un lugar cómodo donde vivir.


Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 15 años, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, ella inicia este negocio con pocos productos como lo es pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios y rubor por lo que no tenia mucha afluencia de clientes decide incrementar mas su producto y es así como obtiene su negocio y se gana  a los diferentes clientes que tiene actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos en los diferentes lugares como lo es en  Managua y las diferentes casas comerciales.
texts.en:
Sobeyda Jazmina E. is a young 42-year-old single mother of three: her son, aged 25, the oldest, who works in a restaurant, her second son, aged 20, who works on a shrimp farm, and her daughter, aged 17, who is in her second year of high school. Her goal is to grow her business in order to help her daughter with her future school needs as she has a long road ahead. Her dream is to improve her home so her children will have a comfortable place to live. She has a business selling cosmetics, which she has had for 15 years. She started this traveling sales business with a few products like nail polish, lipstick, and blush, but had few clients, so she expanded her product selection, which is how she built her current business and grew her client base. This loan is for capital which she needs in order to buy products in Managua and at the various commercial houses.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Kok

texts.en: Mrs. C., 34, is a grocery seller in Takhmao town market and generates revenues of around $10 per day. She works selling with her husband and has been since 2005. Her business is going well because of its good location. She has one child who is young and in school. Because her motorcycle is getting old she needs to change it. She is asking for a loan to add to the money she has saved to purchase an new one.

loans.use: to add to the money she has saved to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Tomasa del Carmen C. F. tiene 51 años, esta soltera, y tiene 12 hijos los todos que trabajan. Hace más de 16 años que Tomasa se dedica a este negocio; aunque no fue fácil por lo que tenia vender sus productos de manera ambulante. Da inicio con  productos como: pantalones, camisas, cosméticos y perfumes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de productos variados para ofrecer a sus clientes. Sus deseos son de establecer su propio negocio en el mercado y proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Ella va a pagar la cantidad de C$ 5.000 córdobas a un plazo de 8 meses.
texts.en:
Ms. Tomasa del Carmen C. F. is 51 years old, single, and has 12 children, all of whom currently work. For more than 16 years Tomasa has been in this business; although it wasn't easy because she had to sell products on the streets. She started with pants, shirts, cosmetics and perfumes. The loan is to finance working capital because she needs to offer a variety of products for her customers. Her wishes are to establish her own business in the market and to be able to provide her family with their daily bread. She will pay C$5,000 cordobas over a period of 8 months.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Doribel Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Doribel tiene 35 años de edad, habita en  villa Reconciliación de la planta de Enel 2 ½ c al norte en la ciudad de Managua,  tiene dos hijos de 12 y 13 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante de madera que ambos administran llevan doce años en las ventas, iniciaron con dinero propio y la venta de ganado, luego con préstamo en Afodenic, este es su octavo préstamo el cual va invertir en la compra de madera en 1625 pulgadas de madera de caoba. Sus metas es poder seguir con las ventas cada aumentar el inventario para poder obtener mejores ganancias y formar un buen capital para ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. C. is 35 years old and lives at Villa Reconciliacion (Reconciliation Village) in Enel, north of the city of Managua. She has two children ages 12 and 13 years old, respectively. Her husband is a lumber merchant and both of them administer the business. They have been in business for twelve years. They started their business with their own savings and by selling cattle. After that, they were granted a loan with Afodenic. This will be their eighth loan with them. They plan to invest the money in buying lumber, especifically 1625 inches of mahogany lumber. Their goals are to continue with the sales and increase their inventory to get better profits and build a good capital to help their children with their education.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying mahogany lumber

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah B. sells local dishes known as Banku and Kenkey in Abura. She also fries fish to sell. Hannah has been doing this since 2008.

Hannah received no formal education. She is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is a sanitary officer. Hannah uses her income to assist her husband with their housekeeping expenses.

Hannah will use her loan to buy more corn to increase the sale of Kenkey and meet an increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits Hannah plans to reinvest in the expansion of her trade in the Kenkey business.

loans.use: To buy more corn to increase the sale of Kenkey and meet an increase in demand.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
S. Nigora is 21 years old and is not yet married. She is a market vendor. Nigora sells women’s clothing and shoes in the local market. She has been in the business for three years.

Nigora is a friendly and polite woman. She is trying to diversify her range of goods in order to satisfy the needs of her clients who have various levels of income. However, the majority of the goods are attractive to the customers with average incomes. The business is stable allowing Nigora to make a considerable contribution to the family budget.

Now Nigora is planning to purchase new clothing in order to increase her stock of spring clothes for women. For this purpose she requests $1000 U.S. dollars for the term of 10 months. Nigora thanks all those supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her stock of spring clothes

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Tamali, 30 years old and married with two children, ages seven and three, is a fish seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. Working daily at her business, she currently earns very little profit. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more fish for resale, hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Tamali will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mery, who has her own small business selling bananas in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Hamro

texts.en: Cattle are raised in order to be butchered, to obtain derived products, as well as to be used for agricultural tasks. Hamro has been dedicated to cattle farming for three years. He is married and the father of five children. He makes a great effort in order to meet the needs of the children in his charge and to bring sustenance to his humble home. His greatest need now is to buy young cattle for expanding his business. For this reason, Hamro turned to IMON International, in order to obtain loans that will allow him to purchase these animals and make his business advance. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business
